sanskrit:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच

transliteration:
dhṛitarāśhtra uvācha

englishMeaning: Dhṛtarāṣṭra said: “O Sanjaya, what did my people and the Pāṇḍavas do, gathered together on the holy field of Kurukshetra, eager for battle?”
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on moral confusion and the need for clear vision. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

englishMeaning: There (in that army) are heroes, great bowmen, such as Bhima and Arjuna; Yuyudhana, Virata, and Drupada, a mighty warrior;

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान्।

englishMeaning: Know, O best of Brahmanas, those who are important on our side—those who are the commanders of my army. I shall name them to refresh your memory.

englishMeaning: Yourself, Bhisma, Karna, the victorious Krpa, Asvatthama, Vikarna, and Jayadratha, the son of Somadatta;

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः।।1.9।।

anye cha bahavaḥ śhūrā madarthe tyaktajīvitāḥ

englishMeaning: And there are many other heroes who are determined to give up their lives for my sake. They are all experts in using manifold missiles and dexterous in battle.

पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्।।1.10।।
transliteration:
aparyāptaṁ tadasmākaṁ balaṁ bhīṣhmābhirakṣhitam
paryāptaṁ tvidameteṣhāṁ balaṁ bhīmābhirakṣhitam
hindiMeaning: ।।1.10।। वह हमारी सेना पाण्डवों पर विजय करने में अपर्याप्त है, असमर्थ है; क्योंकि उसके संरक्षक (उभयपक्षपाती) भीष्म हैं। परन्तु इन पाण्डवों की सेना हमारे पर विजय करने में पर्याप्त है, समर्थ है; क्योंकि इसके संरक्षक (निजसेनापक्षपाती) भीमसेन हैं।
englishMeaning: Our force is inadequate, guarded by Bhisma, while their force is adequate, guarded by Bhima.

भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि।।1.11।।

ayaneṣhu cha sarveṣhu yathā-bhāgamavasthitāḥ
bhīṣhmamevābhirakṣhantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi

englishMeaning: Therefore, all of you, taking your places firmly in your respective divisions, should guard Bhisma at all costs.

transliteration:
tasya sañjanayan harṣhaṁ kuru-vṛiddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ
siṁha-nādaṁ vinadyochchaiḥ śhaṅkhaṁ dadhmau pratāpavān

englishMeaning: Then the valiant grandsire Bhisma, the senior-most of the Kuru clan, roared like a lion and blew his conch with the intention of cheering up Duryodhana.

सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्।।1.13।।

reflection: This verse invites contemplation on moral confusion and the need for clear vision. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: Those for whose sake we desire empire, enjoyment, and pleasures, stand here in war, renouncing life and wealth.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आचार्याः पितरः पुत्रास्तथैव च पितामहाः।

मातुलाः श्चशुराः पौत्राः श्यालाः सम्बन्धिनस्तथा।।1.34।।
transliteration:
āchāryāḥ pitaraḥ putrās tathaiva cha pitāmahāḥ

englishMeaning:

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
एतान्न हन्तुमिच्छामि घ्नतोऽपि मधुसूदन।

अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते।।1.35।।
transliteration:

englishMeaning: I would not slay them, even if they might slay me, for the sovereignty of the three worlds—how much less for this earth, O Krsna?

sanskrit:
निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान्नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन।

hindiMeaning: ।।1.36।। हे जनार्दन! इन धृतराष्ट्र-सम्बन्धियों को मारकर हमलोगों को क्या प्रसन्नता होगी? इन आततायियों को मारने से तो हमें पाप ही लगेगा।
englishMeaning: If we were to kill the sons of Dhrtarastra, what joy would be ours, O Krsna? Sin alone would accrue to us if we killed these murderous felons.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: Therefore, it is not befitting for us to slay our kin, the sons of Dhrtarastra. For if we kill our kinsmen, O Krsna, how can we be happy?

transliteration:
yady apy ete na paśhyanti lobhopahata-chetasaḥ
kula-kṣhaya-kṛitaṁ doṣhaṁ mitra-drohe cha pātakam

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कथं न ज्ञेयमस्माभिः पापादस्मान्निवर्तितुम्।

कुलक्षयकृतं दोषं प्रपश्यद्भिर्जनार्दन।।1.39।।
transliteration:
kathaṁ na jñeyam asmābhiḥ pāpād asmān nivartitum

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

पतन्ति पितरो ह्येषां लुप्तपिण्डोदकक्रियाः।।1.42।।
transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।1.43।। इन वर्णसंकर पैदा करनेवाले दोषोंसे कुलघातियों के सदा से चलते आये कुलधर्म और जातिधर्म नष्ट हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: By the sins of the clan-destroyers who bring about intermixing of classes, the ancient traditions of the clans and classes are destroyed.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
उत्सन्नकुलधर्माणां मनुष्याणां जनार्दन।

नरकेऽनियतं वासो भवतीत्यनुशुश्रुम।।1.44।।
transliteration:

englishMeaning: For those whose clan laws are destroyed, dwelling in hell is ordained, O Krishna; thus, we have heard.

sanskrit:

यद्राज्यसुखलोभेन हन्तुं स्वजनमुद्यताः।।1.45।।

aho bata mahat pāpaṁ kartuṁ vyavasitā vayam

sanskrit:
यदि मामप्रतीकारमशस्त्रं शस्त्रपाणयः।

धार्तराष्ट्रा रणे हन्युस्तन्मे क्षेमतरं भवेत्।।1.46।।

yadi mām apratīkāram aśhastraṁ śhastra-pāṇayaḥ

sanskrit:

sanskrit:
न चैतद्विद्मः कतरन्नो गरीयो

englishMeaning: We do not know which of the two is better for us: whether our vanquishing them or their vanquishing us. The very sons of Dhrtarastra, whom, if we were to slay, we would not wish to live, even they are standing in array against us.

yaṁ hi na vyathayantyete puruṣhaṁ puruṣharṣhabha

englishMeaning: For, he whom these do not affect, O chief of men, and to whom pain and pleasure are equal - that steadfast man alone is worthy of immortality.

sanskrit:
नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः।

उभयोरपि दृष्टोऽन्तस्त्वनयोस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः।।2.16।।
transliteration:
nāsato vidyate bhāvo nābhāvo vidyate sataḥ
ubhayorapi dṛiṣhṭo ’nta stvanayos tattva-darśhibhiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.16।। (टिप्पणी प0 55) असत् का तो भाव (सत्ता) विद्यमान नहीं है और सत् का अभाव विद्यमान नहीं है, तत्त्वदर्शी महापुरुषोंने इन दोनोंका ही अन्त अर्थात् तत्त्व देखा है।
englishMeaning: The unreal never comes into being, the real never ceases to be. The truth about these two is seen by the seers.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अविनाशि तु तद्विद्धि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्।

विनाशमव्ययस्यास्य न कश्चित् कर्तुमर्हति।।2.17।।
transliteration:
avināśhi tu tadviddhi yena sarvam idaṁ tatam
vināśham avyayasyāsya na kaśhchit kartum arhati
hindiMeaning: ।।2.17।। अविनाशी तो उसको जान, जिससे यह सम्पूर्ण संसार व्याप्त है। इस अविनाशीका विनाश कोई भी नहीं कर सकता।
englishMeaning: Know that to be indestructible by which all this is pervaded. No one can cause the destruction of this immutable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अन्तवन्त इमे देहा नित्यस्योक्ताः शरीरिणः।

अनाशिनोऽप्रमेयस्य तस्माद्युध्यस्व भारत।।2.18।।
transliteration:
antavanta ime dehā nityasyoktāḥ śharīriṇaḥ
anāśhino ’prameyasya tasmād yudhyasva bhārata
hindiMeaning: ।।2.18।। अविनाशी, अप्रमेय और नित्य रहनेवाले इस शरीरी के ये देह अन्तवाले कहे गये हैं। इसलिये हे अर्जुन! तुम युद्ध करो।
englishMeaning: These bodies of the Jiva (the embodied self) are said to have an end, while the Jiva itself is eternal, indestructible, and incomprehensible. Therefore, fight, O Bharata (Arjuna).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
य एनं वेत्ति हन्तारं यश्चैनं मन्यते हतम्।

उभौ तौ न विजानीतो नायं हन्ति न हन्यते।।2.19।।
transliteration:
ya enaṁ vetti hantāraṁ yaśh chainaṁ manyate hatam
ubhau tau na vijānīto nāyaṁ hanti na hanyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.19।। जो मनुष्य इस अविनाशी शरीरीको मारनेवाला मानता है और जो मनुष्य इसको मरा मानता है, वे दोनों ही इसको नहीं जानते; क्योंकि यह न मारता है और न मारा जाता है।
englishMeaning: He who considers It (the self) to be the slayer, and he who thinks of It as slain—both are ignorant. For, the self neither slays nor is being slain.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचि

न्नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः।

अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो

न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे।।2.20।।
transliteration:
na jāyate mriyate vā kadāchin
nāyaṁ bhūtvā bhavitā vā na bhūyaḥ
ajo nityaḥ śhāśhvato ’yaṁ purāṇo
na hanyate hanyamāne śharīre
hindiMeaning: ।।2.20।। यह शरीरी न कभी जन्मता है और न मरता है तथा यह उत्पन्न होकर फिर होनेवाला नहीं है। यह जन्मरहित, नित्य-निरन्तर रहनेवाला, शाश्वत और पुराण (अनादि) है। शरीरके मारे जानेपर भी यह नहीं मारा जाता।
englishMeaning: It is never born; it never dies; having come into existence once, it never ceases to exist. Unborn, eternal, perpetual, and primordial, it is not destroyed when the body is destroyed.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वेदाविनाशिनं नित्यं य एनमजमव्ययम्।

कथं स पुरुषः पार्थ कं घातयति हन्ति कम्।।2.21।।
transliteration:
vedāvināśhinaṁ nityaṁ ya enam ajam avyayam
kathaṁ sa puruṣhaḥ pārtha kaṁ ghātayati hanti kam
hindiMeaning: ।।2.21।। हे पृथानन्दन! जो मनुष्य इस शरीरीको अविनाशी, नित्य, जन्मरहित और अव्यय जानता है, वह कैसे किसको मारे और कैसे किसको मरवाये?
englishMeaning: He who knows this self to be indestructible, unborn, unchanging, and thus eternal—how, O Arjuna, does he cause anyone to be killed, and whom does he kill?
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय

नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि।

तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णा

न्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही।।2.22।।
transliteration:
vāsānsi jīrṇāni yathā vihāya
navāni gṛihṇāti naro ’parāṇi
tathā śharīrāṇi vihāya jīrṇānya
nyāni sanyāti navāni dehī
hindiMeaning: ।।2.22।। मनुष्य जैसे पुराने कपड़ोंको छोड़कर दूसरे नये कपड़े धारण कर लेता है, ऐसे ही देही पुराने शरीरोंको छोड़कर दूसरे नये शरीरोंमें चला जाता है।
englishMeaning: As a man casts off worn-out garments and puts on new ones, so does the embodied self cast off its worn-out bodies and enter into new ones.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः।

न चैनं क्लेदयन्त्यापो न शोषयति मारुतः।।2.23।।
transliteration:
nainaṁ chhindanti śhastrāṇi nainaṁ dahati pāvakaḥ
na chainaṁ kledayantyāpo na śhoṣhayati mārutaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.23।। शस्त्र इस शरीरीको काट नहीं सकते, अग्नि इसको जला नहीं सकती, जल इसको गीला नहीं कर सकता और वायु इसको सुखा नहीं सकती।
englishMeaning: Weapons cannot cleave It, fire cannot burn It, waters cannot wet It, and wind cannot dry It.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अच्छेद्योऽयमदाह्योऽयमक्लेद्योऽशोष्य एव च।

नित्यः सर्वगतः स्थाणुरचलोऽयं सनातनः।।2.24।।
transliteration:
achchhedyo ’yam adāhyo ’yam akledyo ’śhoṣhya eva cha
nityaḥ sarva-gataḥ sthāṇur achalo ’yaṁ sanātanaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.24।। यह शरीरी काटा नहीं जा सकता, यह जलाया नहीं जा सकता, यह गीला नहीं किया जा सकता और यह सुखाया भी नहीं जा सकता। कारण कि यह नित्य रहनेवाला सबमें परिपूर्ण, अचल, स्थिर स्वभाववाला और अनादि है।
englishMeaning: It cannot be cleaved; It cannot be burned; It cannot be wetted, and It cannot be dried; It is eternal, all-pervasive, stable, immovable, and primordial.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अव्यक्तोऽयमचिन्त्योऽयमविकार्योऽयमुच्यते।

तस्मादेवं विदित्वैनं नानुशोचितुमर्हसि।।2.25।।
transliteration:
avyakto ’yam achintyo ’yam avikāryo ’yam uchyate
tasmādevaṁ viditvainaṁ nānuśhochitum arhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.25।। यह देही प्रत्यक्ष नहीं दीखता, यह चिन्तनका विषय नहीं है और यह निर्विकार कहा जाता है। अतः इस देहीको ऐसा जानकर शोक नहीं करना चाहिये।
englishMeaning: This (self) is said to be unmanifest, inconceivable, and unchanging. Therefore, knowing it thus, it does not befit you to grieve.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अथ चैनं नित्यजातं नित्यं वा मन्यसे मृतम्।

तथापि त्वं महाबाहो नैवं शोचितुमर्हसि।।2.26।।
transliteration:
atha chainaṁ nitya-jātaṁ nityaṁ vā manyase mṛitam
tathāpi tvaṁ mahā-bāho naivaṁ śhochitum arhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.26।। हे महाबाहो ! अगर तुम इस देहीको नित्य पैदा होनेवाला अथवा नित्य मरनेवाला भी मानो, तो भी तुम्हें इस प्रकार शोक नहीं करना चाहिये।
englishMeaning: Or, if you consider this self as constantly being born and constantly dying, O mighty-armed one, it still does not become you to feel grief.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युर्ध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च।

तस्मादपरिहार्येऽर्थे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि।।2.27।।
transliteration:
jātasya hi dhruvo mṛityur dhruvaṁ janma mṛitasya cha
tasmād aparihārye ’rthe na tvaṁ śhochitum arhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.27।। क्योंकि पैदा हुएकी जरूर मृत्यु होगी और मरे हुएका जरूर जन्म होगा। इस (जन्म-मरण-रूप परिवर्तन के प्रवाह) का परिहार अर्थात् निवारण नहीं हो सकता। अतः इस विषयमें तुम्हें शोक नहीं करना चाहिये।
englishMeaning: For, death is certain for the born, and rebirth is certain for the dead; therefore, you should not grieve for what is inevitable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अव्यक्तादीनि भूतानि व्यक्तमध्यानि भारत।

अव्यक्तनिधनान्येव तत्र का परिदेवना।।2.28।।
transliteration:
avyaktādīni bhūtāni vyakta-madhyāni bhārata
avyakta-nidhanānyeva tatra kā paridevanā
hindiMeaning: ।।2.28।। हे भारत ! सभी प्राणी जन्मसे पहले अप्रकट थे और मरनेके बाद अप्रकट हो जायँगे, केवल बीचमें ही प्रकट दीखते हैं। अतः इसमें शोक करनेकी बात ही क्या है?
englishMeaning: O Arjuna, beings have an unknown beginning, a known middle, and an unknown end. What is there to grieve about in all this?
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आश्चर्यवत्पश्यति कश्चिदेन

माश्चर्यवद्वदति तथैव चान्यः।

आश्चर्यवच्चैनमन्यः श्रृणोति

श्रुत्वाप्येनं वेद न चैव कश्चित्।।2.29।।
transliteration:
āśhcharya-vat paśhyati kaśhchid enan
āśhcharya-vad vadati tathaiva chānyaḥ
āśhcharya-vach chainam anyaḥ śhṛiṇoti
śhrutvāpyenaṁ veda na chaiva kaśhchit
hindiMeaning: ।।2.29।। कोई इस शरीरीको आश्चर्यकी तरह देखता है और वैसे ही अन्य कोई इसका आश्चर्यकी तरह वर्णन करता है तथा अन्य कोई इसको आश्चर्यकी तरह सुनता है; और इसको सुनकर भी कोई नहीं जानता। अर्थात यह शरीरी दुर्विज्ञेय है।
englishMeaning: One regards This (self) as a wonder; another speaks of It as a wonder; yet another hears of It as a wonder; and even after hearing of It, one does not know It.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
देही नित्यमवध्योऽयं देहे सर्वस्य भारत।

तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि।।2.30।।
transliteration:
dehī nityam avadhyo ’yaṁ dehe sarvasya bhārata
tasmāt sarvāṇi bhūtāni na tvaṁ śhochitum arhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.30।। हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन! सबके देहमें यह देही नित्य ही अवध्य है। इसलिये सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके लिये अर्थात् किसी भी प्राणीके लिये तुम्हें शोक नहीं करना चाहिये।
englishMeaning: The self in the body, O Arjuna, is eternal and indestructible. This is the case for all selves in all bodies. Therefore, it is not fitting for you to feel grief for any being.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
स्वधर्ममपि चावेक्ष्य न विकम्पितुमर्हसि।

धर्म्याद्धि युद्धाछ्रेयोऽन्यत्क्षत्रियस्य न विद्यते।।2.31।।
transliteration:
swa-dharmam api chāvekṣhya na vikampitum arhasi
dharmyāddhi yuddhāch chhreyo ’nyat kṣhatriyasya na vidyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.31।। अपने स्वधर्म (क्षात्रधर्म) को देखकर भी तुम्हें विकम्पित अर्थात् कर्तव्य-कर्मसे विचलित नहीं होना चाहिये; क्योंकि धर्ममय युद्धसे बढ़कर क्षत्रियके लिये दूसरा कोई कल्याणकारक कर्म नहीं है।
englishMeaning: Further, considering also your own duty, it does not befit you to waver. For, to a Kshatriya, there is no greater good than a righteous war.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यदृच्छया चोपपन्नं स्वर्गद्वारमपावृतम्।

सुखिनः क्षत्रियाः पार्थ लभन्ते युद्धमीदृशम्।।2.32।।
transliteration:
yadṛichchhayā chopapannaṁ swarga-dvāram apāvṛitam
sukhinaḥ kṣhatriyāḥ pārtha labhante yuddham īdṛiśham
hindiMeaning: ।।2.32।। अपने-आप प्राप्त हुआ युद्ध खुला हुआ स्वर्गका दरवाजा भी है। हे पृथानन्दन ! वे क्षत्रिय बड़े सुखी (भाग्यशाली) हैं, जिनको ऐसा युद्ध प्राप्त होता है।
englishMeaning: Happy are the Ksatriyas, O Arjuna, to whom such a war comes of its own accord; it opens the gates to heaven.

sanskrit:
अथ चैत्त्वमिमं धर्म्यं संग्रामं न करिष्यसि।

ततः स्वधर्मं कीर्तिं च हित्वा पापमवाप्स्यसि।।2.33।।
transliteration:

tataḥ sva-dharmaṁ kīrtiṁ cha hitvā pāpam avāpsyasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.33।। अब अगर तू यह धर्ममय युद्ध नहीं करेगा,  तो अपने धर्म और कीर्तिका त्याग करके पापको प्राप्त होगा।
englishMeaning: But if you do not fight this righteous war, you will be turning away from your duty and honor, and will incur sin.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अकीर्तिं चापि भूतानि कथयिष्यन्ति तेऽव्ययाम्।

संभावितस्य चाकीर्तिर्मरणादतिरिच्यते।।2.34।।
transliteration:
akīrtiṁ chāpi bhūtāni
kathayiṣhyanti te ’vyayām
sambhāvitasya chākīrtir
maraṇād atirichyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.34।। और सब प्राणी भी तेरी सदा रहनेवाली अपकीर्तिका कथन अर्थात निंदा करेंगे। वह अपकीर्ति सम्मानित मनुष्यके लिये मृत्युसे भी बढ़कर दुःखदायी होती है।
englishMeaning: Further, people will speak ill of you for all time, and for one accustomed to being honored, dishonor is worse than death.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
भयाद्रणादुपरतं मंस्यन्ते त्वां महारथाः।

येषां च त्वं बहुमतो भूत्वा यास्यसि लाघवम्।।2.35।।
transliteration:
bhayād raṇād uparataṁ mansyante tvāṁ mahā-rathāḥ
yeṣhāṁ cha tvaṁ bahu-mato bhūtvā yāsyasi lāghavam
hindiMeaning: ।।2.35।।  महारथीलोग तुझे भयके कारण युद्धसे उपरत (हटा) हुआ मानेंगे। जिनकी धारणामें तू बहुमान्य हो चुका है, उनकी दृष्टिमें तू लघुताको प्राप्त हो जायगा।
englishMeaning: The great warriors will think that you have fled from battle out of fear. Those who held you in high esteem will now speak of you disparagingly.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अवाच्यवादांश्च बहून् वदिष्यन्ति तवाहिताः।

निन्दन्तस्तव सामर्थ्यं ततो दुःखतरं नु किम्।।2.36।।
transliteration:
avāchya-vādānśh cha bahūn vadiṣhyanti tavāhitāḥ
nindantastava sāmarthyaṁ tato duḥkhataraṁ nu kim
hindiMeaning: ।।2.36।। तेरे शत्रुलोग तेरी सार्मथ्यकी निन्दा करते हुए न कहनेयोग्य बहुत-से वचन भी कहेंगे। उससे बढ़कर और दुःखकी बात क्या होगी?
englishMeaning: Your enemies, slandering your prowess, will use words that should never be uttered. What could be more painful than that?
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
हतो वा प्राप्स्यसि स्वर्गं जित्वा वा भोक्ष्यसे महीम्।

तस्मादुत्तिष्ठ कौन्तेय युद्धाय कृतनिश्चयः।।2.37।।
transliteration:
hato vā prāpsyasi swargaṁ jitvā vā bhokṣhyase mahīm
tasmād uttiṣhṭha kaunteya yuddhāya kṛita-niśhchayaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.37।। अगर युद्धमें तू मारा जायगा तो तुझे स्वर्गकी प्राप्ति होगी और अगर युद्धमें तू जीत जायगा तो पृथ्वीका राज्य भोगेगा। अतः हे कुन्तीनन्दन! तू युद्धके लिये निश्चय करके खड़ा हो जा।
englishMeaning: If slain, you will win heaven; or if victorious, you will enjoy the earth. Therefore, arise, O Arjuna, resolved to fight.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सुखदुःखे समे कृत्वा लाभालाभौ जयाजयौ।

ततो युद्धाय युज्यस्व नैवं पापमवाप्स्यसि।।2.38।।
transliteration:
sukha-duḥkhe same kṛitvā lābhālābhau jayājayau
tato yuddhāya yujyasva naivaṁ pāpam avāpsyasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.38।। जय-पराजय, लाभ-हानि और सुख-दुःखको समान करके फिर युद्धमें लग जा। इस प्रकार युद्ध करनेसे तू पापको प्राप्त नहीं होगा।
englishMeaning: Holding pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat as equal, gird yourself up for the battle. Thus, you shall not incur any sin.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
एषा तेऽभिहिता सांख्ये बुद्धिर्योगे त्विमां श्रृणु।

बुद्ध्यायुक्तो यया पार्थ कर्मबन्धं प्रहास्यसि।।2.39।।
transliteration:
eṣhā te ’bhihitā sānkhye
buddhir yoge tvimāṁ śhṛiṇu
buddhyā yukto yayā pārtha
karma-bandhaṁ prahāsyasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.39।। हे पार्थ! यह समबुद्धि तेरे लिए पहले सांख्ययोगमें कही गयी, अब तू इसको कर्मयोगके विषयमें सुन; जिस समबुद्धिसे युक्त हुआ तू कर्मबन्धनका त्याग कर देगा।
englishMeaning: This Buddhi concerning the Self (Sankhya) has been imparted to you. Now listen to this with regard to Yoga, by following which you will get rid of the bondage of Karma.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नेहाभिक्रमनाशोऽस्ति प्रत्यवायो न विद्यते।

स्वल्पमप्यस्य धर्मस्य त्रायते महतो भयात्।।2.40।।
transliteration:
nehābhikrama-nāśho ’sti pratyavāyo na vidyate
svalpam apyasya dharmasya trāyate mahato bhayāt
hindiMeaning: ।।2.40।। मनुष्यलोकमें इस समबुद्धिरूप धर्मके आरम्भका नाश नहीं होता, इसके अनुष्ठानका उलटा फल भी नहीं होता और इसका थोड़ासा भी अनुष्ठान (जन्म-मरणरूप) महान् भयसे रक्षा कर लेता है।
englishMeaning: Here, there is no loss of effort, nor any accrual of evil. Even a little of this Dharma (called Karma Yoga) protects one from the great fear.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिरेकेह कुरुनन्दन।

बहुशाखा ह्यनन्ताश्च बुद्धयोऽव्यवसायिनाम्।।2.41।।
transliteration:
vyavasāyātmikā buddhir ekeha kuru-nandana
bahu-śhākhā hyanantāśh cha buddhayo ’vyavasāyinām
hindiMeaning: ।।2.41।। हे कुरुनन्दन! इस समबुद्धिकी प्राप्तिके विषयमें व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धि एक ही होती है। अव्यवसायी मनुष्योंकी बुद्धियाँ अनन्त और बहुशाखाओंवाली ही होती हैं।
englishMeaning: In this (Karma Yoga), O Arjuna, the resolute mind is single-pointed; the minds of the irresolute are multi-branched and endless.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यामिमां पुष्पितां वाचं प्रवदन्त्यविपश्चितः।

वेदवादरताः पार्थ नान्यदस्तीति वादिनः।।2.42।।
transliteration:
yāmimāṁ puṣhpitāṁ vāchaṁ pravadanty-avipaśhchitaḥ
veda-vāda-ratāḥ pārtha nānyad astīti vādinaḥ
 kāmātmānaḥ swarga-parā janma-karma-phala-pradām
kriyā-viśheṣha-bahulāṁ bhogaiśhwarya-gatiṁ prati
hindiMeaning: ।।2.42 -- 2.43।। हे पृथानन्दन ! जो कामनाओंमें तन्मय हो रहे हैं, स्वर्गको ही श्रेष्ठ माननेवाले हैं, वेदोंमें कहे हुए सकाम कर्मोंमें प्रीति रखनेवाले हैं, भोगोंके सिवाय और कुछ है ही नहीं - ऐसा कहनेवाले हैं, वे अविवेकी मनुष्य इस प्रकारकी जिस पुष्पित (दिखाऊ शोभायुक्त) वाणीको कहा करते हैं, जो कि जन्मरूपी कर्मफलको देनेवाली है तथा भोग और ऐश्वर्यकी प्राप्तिके लिये बहुतसी क्रियाओंका वर्णन करनेवाली है।
englishMeaning: - O Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas, say, "There is nothing else." They are full only of worldly desires and they hanker for heaven. They speak flowery words that offer mirth as the fruit of work. They look upon the Vedas as consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech (offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a concentrated mind.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कामात्मानः स्वर्गपरा जन्मकर्मफलप्रदाम्।

क्रियाविशेषबहुलां भोगैश्वर्यगतिं प्रति।।2.43।।
transliteration:
kāmātmānaḥ svarga-parā 

 janma-karma-phala-pradām

 kriyā-viśeṣa-bahulāṁ

 bhogaiśvarya-gatiṁ prati
hindiMeaning: ।।2.42 -- 2.43।। हे पृथानन्दन ! जो कामनाओंमें तन्मय हो रहे हैं, स्वर्गको ही श्रेष्ठ माननेवाले हैं, वेदोंमें कहे हुए सकाम कर्मोंमें प्रीति रखनेवाले हैं, भोगोंके सिवाय और कुछ है ही नहीं - ऐसा कहनेवाले हैं, वे अविवेकी मनुष्य इस प्रकारकी जिस पुष्पित (दिखाऊ शोभायुक्त) वाणीको कहा करते हैं, जो कि जन्मरूपी कर्मफलको देनेवाली है तथा भोग और ऐश्वर्यकी प्राप्तिके लिये बहुतसी क्रियाओंका वर्णन करनेवाली है।
englishMeaning: - O Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas, say, "There is nothing else." They are full only of worldly desires and they yearn for heaven. They speak flowery words that offer mirth as the fruit of work. They view the Vedas as consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech (offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a focused mind.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
भोगैश्वर्यप्रसक्तानां तयापहृतचेतसाम्।

व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धिः समाधौ न विधीयते।।2.44।।
transliteration:
bhogaiśwvarya-prasaktānāṁ tayāpahṛita-chetasām
vyavasāyātmikā buddhiḥ samādhau na vidhīyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.44।। उस पुष्पित वाणीसे जिसका अन्तःकरण हर लिया गया है अर्थात् भोगोंकी तरफ खिंच गया है और जो भोग तथा ऐश्वर्यमें अत्यन्त आसक्त हैं, उन मनुष्योंकी परमात्मामें निश्चयात्मिका बुद्धि नहीं होती।
englishMeaning: - O Partha, the unwise, who rejoice in the letter of the Vedas, say, "There is nothing else." They are full only of worldly desires and they hanker for heaven. They speak flowery words that offer mirth as the fruit of work. They look upon the Vedas as consisting entirely of varied rites for the attainment of pleasure and power. Those who cling so to pleasure and power are attracted by that speech (offering heavenly rewards) and are unable to develop the resolute will of a concentrated mind.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
त्रैगुण्यविषया वेदा निस्त्रैगुण्यो भवार्जुन।

निर्द्वन्द्वो नित्यसत्त्वस्थो निर्योगक्षेम आत्मवान्।।2.45।।
transliteration:
trai-guṇya-viṣhayā vedā nistrai-guṇyo bhavārjuna
nirdvandvo nitya-sattva-stho niryoga-kṣhema ātmavān
hindiMeaning: ।।2.45।। वेद तीनों गुणोंके कार्यका ही वर्णन करनेवाले हैं; हे अर्जुन! तू तीनों गुणोंसे रहित हो जा, निर्द्वन्द्व हो जा, निरन्तर नित्य वस्तु परमात्मा में स्थित हो जा, योगक्षेमकी चाहना भी मत रख और परमात्मपरायण हो जा।
englishMeaning: The Vedas have the three Gunas as their sphere, O Arjuna. You must be free from the three Gunas and be free from the pairs of opposites. Abide in pure Sattva; never care to acquire things and to protect what has been acquired, but be established in the Self.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यावानर्थ उदपाने सर्वतः संप्लुतोदके।

तावान्सर्वेषु वेदेषु ब्राह्मणस्य विजानतः।।2.46।।
transliteration:
yāvān artha udapāne sarvataḥ samplutodake
tāvānsarveṣhu vedeṣhu brāhmaṇasya vijānataḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.46।। सब तरफसे परिपूर्ण महान् जलाशयके प्राप्त होनेपर छोटे गड्ढों में भरे जल में मनुष्यका जितना प्रयोजन रहता है अर्थात् कुछ भी प्रयोजन नहीं रहता, वेदों और शास्त्रोंको तत्त्वसे जाननेवाले ब्रह्मज्ञानीका सम्पूर्ण वेदोंमें उतना ही प्रयोजन रहता है अर्थात् कुछ भी प्रयोजन नहीं रहता।
englishMeaning: What use does a thirsty person have for a water reservoir when all sides of it are flooded—that is the only use of all the Vedas for a Brahmana who knows.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन।

मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि।।2.47।।
transliteration:
karmaṇy-evādhikāras te mā phaleṣhu kadāchana
mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo ’stvakarmaṇi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.47।। कर्तव्य-कर्म करनेमें ही तेरा अधिकार है, फलोंमें कभी नहीं। अतः तू कर्मफलका हेतु भी मत बन और तेरी अकर्मण्यतामें भी आसक्ति न हो।
englishMeaning: You have the right to work alone, but not to the fruits of it. Do not be driven by the results of your work, nor have attachment to inaction.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
योगस्थः कुरु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा धनञ्जय।

सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योः समो भूत्वा समत्वं योग उच्यते।।2.48।।
transliteration:
yoga-sthaḥ kuru karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā dhanañjaya
siddhy-asiddhyoḥ samo bhūtvā samatvaṁ yoga uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.48।। हे धनञ्जय ! तू आसक्तिका त्याग करके सिद्धि-असिद्धिमें सम होकर योगमें स्थित हुआ कर्मोंको कर; क्योंकि समत्व ही योग कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: Abandoning attachment and established in Yoga, perform works, viewing success and failure with an even mind. Evenness of mind is said to be Yoga.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

बुद्धौ शरणमन्विच्छ कृपणाः फलहेतवः।।2.49।।
transliteration:
dūreṇa hy-avaraṁ karma buddhi-yogād dhanañjaya
buddhau śharaṇam anvichchha kṛipaṇāḥ phala-hetavaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.49।। बुद्धियोग-(समता) की अपेक्षा सकामकर्म दूरसे (अत्यन्त) ही निकृष्ट है। अतः हे धनञ्जय ! तू बुद्धि (समता) का आश्रय ले; क्योंकि फलके हेतु बननेवाले अत्यन्त दीन हैं।
englishMeaning: Action done with attachment, O Arjuna, is far inferior to action done with evenness of mind. Seek refuge in evenness of mind; those who act with a motive for results are miserable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बुद्धियुक्तो जहातीह उभे सुकृतदुष्कृते।

तस्माद्योगाय युज्यस्व योगः कर्मसु कौशलम्।।2.50।।
transliteration:
buddhi-yukto jahātīha ubhe sukṛita-duṣhkṛite
tasmād yogāya yujyasva yogaḥ karmasu kauśhalam
hindiMeaning: ।।2.50।। बुद्धि-(समता) से युक्त मनुष्य यहाँ जीवित अवस्थामें ही पुण्य और पाप दोनोंका त्याग कर देता है। अतः तू योग-(समता-) में लग जा, क्योंकि योग ही कर्मोंमें कुशलता है।
englishMeaning: A person with an evenness of mind discards both good and evil here and now. Therefore, strive for Yoga; for Yoga is skill in action.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कर्मजं बुद्धियुक्ता हि फलं त्यक्त्वा मनीषिणः।

जन्मबन्धविनिर्मुक्ताः पदं गच्छन्त्यनामयम्।।2.51।।
transliteration:
karma-jaṁ buddhi-yuktā hi phalaṁ tyaktvā manīṣhiṇaḥ
janma-bandha-vinirmuktāḥ padaṁ gachchhanty-anāmayam
hindiMeaning: ।।2.51।। समतायुक्त मनीषी साधक कर्मजन्य फलका त्याग करके जन्मरूप बन्धनसे मुक्त होकर निर्विकार पदको प्राप्त हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: The wise, who possess evenness of mind, relinquish the fruits born of action, and are freed from the bondage of birth, going to the region beyond all ills.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यदा ते मोहकलिलं बुद्धिर्व्यतितरिष्यति।

तदा गन्तासि निर्वेदं श्रोतव्यस्य श्रुतस्य च।।2.52।।
transliteration:
yadā te moha-kalilaṁ buddhir vyatitariṣhyati
tadā gantāsi nirvedaṁ śhrotavyasya śhrutasya cha
hindiMeaning: ।।2.52।। जिस समय तेरी बुद्धि मोहरूपी दलदलको तर जायगी, उसी समय तू सुने हुए और सुननेमें आनेवाले भोगोंसे वैराग्यको प्राप्त हो जायगा।
englishMeaning: When your intellect has passed beyond the tangle of delusion, you will yourself feel disgusted with what you have heard and what you will hear.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्रुतिविप्रतिपन्ना ते यदा स्थास्यति निश्चला।

समाधावचला बुद्धिस्तदा योगमवाप्स्यसि।।2.53।।
transliteration:
śhruti-vipratipannā te yadā sthāsyati niśhchalā
samādhāv-achalā buddhis tadā yogam avāpsyasi
hindiMeaning: ।।2.53।। जिस कालमें शास्त्रीय मतभेदोंसे विचलित हुई तेरी बुद्धि निश्चल हो जायगी और परमात्मामें अचल हो जायगी, उस कालमें तू योगको प्राप्त हो जायगा।
englishMeaning: When your intellect, having been well enlightened by hearing from Me and firmly placed, stands unshaken in a concentrated mind, then you will attain the vision of the Self.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

स्थितप्रज्ञस्य का भाषा समाधिस्थस्य केशव।

स्थितधीः किं प्रभाषेत किमासीत व्रजेत किम्।।2.54।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
sthita-prajñasya kā bhāṣhā samādhi-sthasya keśhava
sthita-dhīḥ kiṁ prabhāṣheta kim āsīta vrajeta kim
hindiMeaning: ।।2.54।। अर्जुन बोले - हे केशव ! परमात्मामें स्थित स्थिर बुद्धिवाले मनुष्यके क्या लक्षण होते हैं? वह स्थिर बुद्धिवाला मनुष्य कैसे बोलता है, कैसे बैठता है और कैसे चलता है?
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "What is the mode of speech of one who is of firm wisdom, established in the control of the mind? What does a man of firm wisdom speak, O Krsna? How does he sit? How does he move?"
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

प्रजहाति यदा कामान् सर्वान् पार्थ मनोगतान्।

आत्मन्येवात्मना तुष्टः स्थितप्रज्ञस्तदोच्यते।।2.55।।
transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
prajahāti yadā kāmān sarvān pārtha mano-gatān
ātmany-evātmanā tuṣhṭaḥ sthita-prajñas tadochyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.55।। श्रीभगवान् बोले - हे पृथानन्दन ! जिस कालमें साधक मनोगत सम्पूर्ण कामनाओंका अच्छी तरह त्याग कर देता है और अपने-आपसे अपने-आपमें ही सन्तुष्ट रहता है, उस कालमें वह स्थितप्रज्ञ कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "When a man renounces all the desires of the mind and is content with himself, then he is said to possess firm wisdom."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
दुःखेष्वनुद्विग्नमनाः सुखेषु विगतस्पृहः।

वीतरागभयक्रोधः स्थितधीर्मुनिरुच्यते।।2.56।।
transliteration:
duḥkheṣhv-anudvigna-manāḥ sukheṣhu vigata-spṛihaḥ
vīta-rāga-bhaya-krodhaḥ sthita-dhīr munir uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.56।। दुःखोंकी प्राप्ति होनेपर जिसके मनमें उद्वेग नहीं होता और सुखोंकी प्राप्ति होनेपर जिसके मनमें स्पृहा नहीं होती तथा जो राग, भय और क्रोधसे सर्वथा रहित हो गया है, वह मननशील मनुष्य स्थिरबुद्धि कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: He whose mind is not perturbed by pain, who has no longing for pleasures, who is free from desire, fear, and anger—he is called a sage of firm wisdom.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यः सर्वत्रानभिस्नेहस्तत्तत्प्राप्य शुभाशुभम्।

नाभिनन्दति न द्वेष्टि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता।।2.57।।
transliteration:
yaḥ sarvatrānabhisnehas tat tat prāpya śhubhāśhubham
nābhinandati na dveṣhṭi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
hindiMeaning: ।।2.57।। सब जगह आसक्तिरहित हुआ जो मनुष्य उस-उस शुभ-अशुभको प्राप्त करके न तो अभिनन्दित होता है और न द्वेष करता है, उसकी बुद्धि प्रतिष्ठित है।
englishMeaning: He who has no love on any side, who, upon finding good or evil, neither rejoices nor hates—his wisdom is firmly set.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यदा संहरते चायं कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः।

इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता।।2.58।।
transliteration:
yadā sanharate chāyaṁ kūrmo ’ṅgānīva sarvaśhaḥ
indriyāṇīndriyārthebhyas tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
hindiMeaning: ।।2.58।। जिस तरह कछुआ अपने अङ्गोंको सब ओरसे समेट लेता है, ऐसे ही जिस कालमें यह कर्मयोगी इन्द्रियोंके विषयोंसे इन्द्रियोंको सब प्रकारसे समेट लेता (हटा लेता) है, तब उसकी बुद्धि प्रतिष्ठित हो जाती है।
englishMeaning: When one is able to draw their senses away from the objects of sense on all sides, like a tortoise draws in its limbs, then their wisdom is firmly established.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
विषया विनिवर्तन्ते निराहारस्य देहिनः।

रसवर्जं रसोऽप्यस्य परं दृष्ट्वा निवर्तते।।2.59।।
transliteration:
viṣhayā vinivartante nirāhārasya dehinaḥ
rasa-varjaṁ raso ’pyasya paraṁ dṛiṣhṭvā nivartate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.59।। निराहारी (इन्द्रियोंको विषयोंसे हटानेवाले) मनुष्यके भी विषय तो निवृत्त हो जाते हैं, पर रस निवृत्त नहीं होता। परन्तु इस स्थितप्रज्ञ मनुष्यका तो रस भी परमात्मतत्त्वका अनुभव होनेसे निवृत्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: The objects of the senses, except for the pleasure they bring, turn away from the abstinent dweller in the body. Even the pleasure turns away from him when the Self, which is supreme over the senses, is seen.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यततो ह्यपि कौन्तेय पुरुषस्य विपश्चितः।

इन्द्रियाणि प्रमाथीनि हरन्ति प्रसभं मनः।।2.60।।
transliteration:
yatato hyapi kaunteya puruṣhasya vipaśhchitaḥ
indriyāṇi pramāthīni haranti prasabhaṁ manaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।2.60।। हे कुन्तीनन्दन! (रसबुद्धि रहनेसे) यत्न करते हुए विद्वान् मनुष्यकी भी प्रमथनशील इन्द्रियाँ उसके मनको बलपूर्वक हर लेती हैं।
englishMeaning: The turbulent senses, O Arjuna, can forcibly carry away the mind of even a wise man, though he is ever striving.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तानि सर्वाणि संयम्य युक्त आसीत मत्परः।

वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता।।2.61।।
transliteration:
tāni sarvāṇi sanyamya yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ
vaśhe hi yasyendriyāṇi tasya prajñā pratiṣhṭhitā
hindiMeaning: ।।2.61।। कर्मयोगी साधक उन सम्पूर्ण इन्द्रियोंको वशमें करके मेरे परायण होकर बैठे; क्योंकि जिसकी इन्द्रियाँ वशमें हैं, उसकी बुद्धि प्रतिष्ठित है।
englishMeaning: Having controlled all the senses, let him remain in contemplation, regarding Me as supreme; for his knowledge is firmly established when his senses are under control.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ध्यायतो विषयान्पुंसः सङ्गस्तेषूपजायते।

सङ्गात् संजायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते।।2.62।।
transliteration:
dhyāyato viṣhayān puṁsaḥ saṅgas teṣhūpajāyate
saṅgāt sañjāyate kāmaḥ kāmāt krodho ’bhijāyate
hindiMeaning: ।।2.62 -- 2.63।। विषयोंका चिन्तन करनेवाले मनुष्यकी उन विषयोंमें आसक्ति पैदा हो जाती है। आसक्तिसे कामना पैदा होती है। कामनासे क्रोध पैदा होता है। क्रोध होनेपर सम्मोह (मूढ़भाव) हो जाता है। सम्मोहसे स्मृति भ्रष्ट हो जाती है। स्मृति भ्रष्ट होनेपर बुद्धिका नाश हो जाता है। बुद्धिका नाश होनेपर मनुष्यका पतन हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: To one who is thinking about sense-objects, attachment to them arises; from attachment arises desire, and from desire arises anger.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
क्रोधाद्भवति संमोहः संमोहात्स्मृतिविभ्रमः।

स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति।।2.63।।
transliteration:
krodhād bhavati sammohaḥ sammohāt smṛiti-vibhramaḥ
smṛiti-bhranśhād buddhi-nāśho buddhi-nāśhāt praṇaśhyati
hindiMeaning: ।।2.62 -- 2.63।। विषयोंका चिन्तन करनेवाले मनुष्यकी उन विषयोंमें आसक्ति पैदा हो जाती है। आसक्तिसे कामना पैदा होती है। कामनासे क्रोध पैदा होता है। क्रोध होनेपर सम्मोह (मूढ़भाव) हो जाता है। सम्मोहसे स्मृति भ्रष्ट हो जाती है। स्मृति भ्रष्ट होनेपर बुद्धिका नाश हो जाता है। बुद्धिका नाश होनेपर मनुष्यका पतन हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Anger leads to delusion, which causes the loss of memory; the loss of memory leads to the destruction of discrimination, and with the destruction of discrimination, one is lost.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन्।

आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति।।2.64।।
transliteration:
rāga-dveṣha-viyuktais tu viṣhayān indriyaiśh charan
ātma-vaśhyair-vidheyātmā prasādam adhigachchhati
hindiMeaning: ।।2.64 -- 2.65।। वशीभूत अन्तःकरणवाला कर्मयोगी साधक रागद्वेषसे रहित अपने वशमें की हुई इन्द्रियोंके द्वारा विषयोंका सेवन करता हुआ अन्तःकरणकी निर्मलता को प्राप्त हो जाता है। निर्मलता प्राप्त होनेपर साधकके सम्पूर्ण दुःखोंका नाश हो जाता है और ऐसे शुद्ध चित्तवाले साधककी बुद्धि निःसन्देह बहुत जल्दी परमात्मामें स्थिर हो जाती है।
englishMeaning: But he who goes through the sense-objects with the senses free from love and hate, disciplined and controlled, attains serenity.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the eternal self and wise action. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।2.66।। जिसके मन-इन्द्रियाँ संयमित नहीं हैं, ऐसे मनुष्यकी व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धि नहीं होती और व्यवसायात्मिका बुद्धि न होनेसे उसमें कर्तव्यपरायणताकी भावना नहीं होती। ऐसी भावना न होनेसे उसको शान्ति नहीं मिलती। फिर शान्तिरहित मनुष्यको सुख कैसे मिल सकता है?

englishMeaning: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, he whose senses are restrained from going after their objects on all sides, his wisdom is firmly established.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।2.69।। सम्पूर्ण प्राणियों की जो रात (परमात्मासे विमुखता) है, उसमें संयमी मनुष्य जागता है, और जिसमें सब प्राणी जागते हैं (भोग और संग्रहमें लगे रहते हैं), वह तत्त्वको जाननेवाले मुनिकी दृष्टिमें रात है।
englishMeaning: What is night for all beings, in it the one who is controlled is awake; when all beings are awake, that is the night for the sage who sees.

transliteration:
āpūryamāṇam achala-pratiṣhṭhaṁ

sa śhāntim āpnoti na kāma-kāmī
hindiMeaning: ।।2.70।। जैसे सम्पूर्ण नदियोंका जल चारों ओरसे जलद्वारा परिपूर्ण समुद्रमें आकर मिलता है, पर समुद्र अपनी मर्यादामें अचल प्रतिष्ठित रहता है ऐसे ही सम्पूर्ण भोग-पदार्थ जिस संयमी मनुष्य को विकार उत्पन्न किये बिना ही उसको प्राप्त होते हैं, वही मनुष्य परमशान्तिको प्राप्त होता है, भोगोंकी कामनावाला नहीं।
englishMeaning: He into whom all desires enter, just as the waters enter the full and undisturbed sea, attains peace, and not he who longs after objects of desire.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।2.71।। जो मनुष्य सम्पूर्ण कामनाओंका त्याग करके स्पृहारहित, ममतारहित और अहंकाररहित होकर आचरण करता है, वह शान्तिको प्राप्त होता है।

sanskrit:

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।3.1 -- 3.2।। अर्जुन बोले -- हे जनार्दन! अगर आप कर्मसे बुद्धि- (ज्ञान-) को श्रेष्ठ मानते हैं, तो फिर हे केशव ! मुझे घोर कर्ममें क्यों लगाते हैं ? आप अपने मिले हुए-से वचनोंसे मेरी बुद्धिको मोहित-सी कर रहे हैं। अतः आप निश्चय करके उस एक बात को कहिये, जिससे मैं कल्याणको प्राप्त हो जाऊँ।
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "O Krsna, if you deem knowledge to be superior to action, why then do you urge me to engage in this terrible deed?"

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

श्री भगवानुवाच

englishMeaning: You must perform your obligatory action; for action is superior to non-action (Jñāna Yoga). For a person following non-action, not even the sustenance of the body is possible.

sanskrit:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः।

तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसंगः समाचर।।3.9।।
transliteration:
yajñārthāt karmaṇo ’nyatra loko ’yaṁ karma-bandhanaḥ
tad-arthaṁ karma kaunteya mukta-saṅgaḥ samāchara
hindiMeaning: ।।3.9।। यज्ञ (कर्तव्यपालन) के लिये किये जानेवाले कर्मोंसे अन्यत्र (अपने लिये किये जानेवाले) कर्मोंमें लगा हुआ यह मनुष्य-समुदाय कर्मोंसे बँधता है, इसलिये हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! तू आसक्ति-रहित होकर उस यज्ञके लिये ही कर्तव्य-कर्म कर।
englishMeaning: This world is held in the bondage of work only when work is not performed as a sacrifice. O Arjuna, you must perform work for this purpose, free from attachment.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सहयज्ञाः प्रजाः सृष्ट्वा पुरोवाच प्रजापतिः।

अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्।।3.10।।
transliteration:
saha-yajñāḥ prajāḥ sṛiṣhṭvā purovācha prajāpatiḥ
anena prasaviṣhyadhvam eṣha vo ’stviṣhṭa-kāma-dhuk
hindiMeaning: ।।3.10 -- 3.11।। प्रजापति ब्रह्माजीने सृष्टिके आदिकालमें कर्तव्य-कर्मोंके विधानसहित प्रजा-(मनुष्य आदि-) की रचना करके उनसे (प्रधानतया मनुष्योंसे) कहा कि तुमलोग इस कर्तव्यके द्वारा सबकी वृद्धि करो और वह कर्तव्य-कर्म-रूप यज्ञ तुमलोगोंको कर्तव्य-पालनकी आवश्यक सामग्री प्रदान करनेवाला हो। अपने कर्तव्य-कर्मके द्वारा तुमलोग देवताओंको उन्नत करो और वे देवतालोग अपने कर्तव्यके द्वारा तुमलोगोंको उन्नत करें। इस प्रकार एक-दूसरेको उन्नत करते हुए तुमलोग परम कल्याणको प्राप्त हो जाओगे।
englishMeaning: In the beginning, the Lord of all beings created man along with the sacrifice and said, "By this shall you prosper; this shall be the cow of plenty, granting all your desires."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः।

परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ।।3.11।।
transliteration:
devān bhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ
parasparaṁ bhāvayantaḥ śhreyaḥ param avāpsyatha
hindiMeaning: ।।3.10 -- 3.11।। प्रजापति ब्रह्माजीने सृष्टिके आदिकालमें कर्तव्य-कर्मोंके विधानसहित प्रजा-(मनुष्य आदि-) की रचना करके (उनसे, प्रधानतया मनुष्योंसे) कहा कि तुमलोग इस कर्तव्यके द्वारा सबकी वृद्धि करो और वह कर्तव्य-कर्म-रूप यज्ञ तुमलोगोंको कर्तव्य-पालनकी आवश्यक सामग्री प्रदान करनेवाला हो। अपने कर्तव्य-कर्मके द्वारा तुमलोग देवताओंको उन्नत करो और वे देवतालोग अपने कर्तव्यके द्वारा तुमलोगोंको उन्नत करें। इस प्रकार एक-दूसरेको उन्नत करते हुए तुमलोग परम कल्याणको प्राप्त हो जाओगे।
englishMeaning: By this, please the gods, and they will support you. Thus, nourishing each other, you may obtain the highest good.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः।

तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः।।3.12।।
transliteration:
iṣhṭān bhogān hi vo devā dāsyante yajña-bhāvitāḥ
tair dattān apradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.12।। यज्ञसे भावित (पुष्ट) हुए देवता भी तुमलोगोंको (बिना माँगे ही) कर्तव्य-पालनकी आवश्यक सामग्री देते रहेंगे। इस प्रकार उन देवताओंसे प्राप्त हुई सामग्रीको दूसरोंकी सेवामें लगाये बिना जो मनुष्य स्वयं ही उसका उपभोग करता है, वह चोर ही है।
englishMeaning: The gods, pleased by the sacrifice, will bestow upon you the enjoyments you desire. He who enjoys the bounty of the gods without giving them anything in return is but a thief.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यज्ञशिष्टाशिनः सन्तो मुच्यन्ते सर्वकिल्बिषैः।

भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात्।।3.13।।
transliteration:
yajña-śhiṣhṭāśhinaḥ santo muchyante sarva-kilbiṣhaiḥ
bhuñjate te tvaghaṁ pāpā ye pachantyātma-kāraṇāt
hindiMeaning: ।।3.13।। यज्ञशेष- (योग-) का अनुभव करनेवाले श्रेष्ठ मनुष्य सम्पूर्ण पापोंसे मुक्त हो जाते हैं। परन्तु जो केवल अपने लिये ही पकाते अर्थात् सब कर्म करते हैं, वे पापीलोग तो पापका ही भक्षण करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Pious people who eat the remnants of sacrifices are freed from all sins, whereas those who are sinful and cook only for their own sake will only incur sin.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः।

यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः।।3.14।।
transliteration:
annād bhavanti bhūtāni parjanyād anna-sambhavaḥ
yajñād bhavati parjanyo yajñaḥ karma-samudbhavaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.14 -- 3.15।। सम्पूर्ण प्राणी अन्नसे उत्पन्न होते हैं। अन्न  वर्षासे होती है। वर्षा यज्ञसे होती है। यज्ञ कर्मोंसे निष्पन्न होता है। कर्मोंको तू वेदसे उत्पन्न जान और वेदको अक्षरब्रह्मसे प्रकट हुआ जान। इसलिये वह सर्वव्यापी परमात्मा यज्ञ (कर्तव्य-कर्म) में नित्य प्रतिष्ठित है।
englishMeaning: All beings arise from food; food is produced from rain; rain comes from sacrifice; and sacrifice is born of action.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कर्म ब्रह्मोद्भवं विद्धि ब्रह्माक्षरसमुद्भवम्।

तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्।।3.15।।
transliteration:
karma brahmodbhavaṁ viddhi brahmākṣhara-samudbhavam
tasmāt sarva-gataṁ brahma nityaṁ yajñe pratiṣhṭhitam
hindiMeaning: ।।3.14 -- 3.15।। सम्पूर्ण प्राणी अन्नसे उत्पन्न होते हैं। अन्न  वर्षासे होती है। वर्षा यज्ञसे होती है। यज्ञ कर्मोंसे निष्पन्न होता है। कर्मोंको तू वेदसे उत्पन्न जान और वेदको अक्षरब्रह्मसे प्रकट हुआ जान। इसलिये वह सर्वव्यापी परमात्मा यज्ञ (कर्तव्य-कर्म) में नित्य प्रतिष्ठित है।
englishMeaning: Know that activity springs from Brahman, i.e., the physical body; Brahman arises from the imperishable Self; therefore, the all-pervading Brahman is ever established in sacrifice.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः।

अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति।।3.16।।
transliteration:
evaṁ pravartitaṁ chakraṁ nānuvartayatīha yaḥ
aghāyur indriyārāmo moghaṁ pārtha sa jīvati
hindiMeaning: ।।3.16।। हे पार्थ! जो मनुष्य इस लोकमें इस प्रकार परम्परासे प्रचलित सृष्टिचक्रके अनुसार नहीं चलता, वह इन्द्रियोंके द्वारा भोगोंमें रमण करनेवाला अघायु (पापमय जीवन बितानेवाला) मनुष्य संसारमें व्यर्थ ही जीता है।
englishMeaning: He who does not follow the wheel thus set in motion here, lives in sin, satisfying the senses, O Arjuna; he lives in vain.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यस्त्वात्मरतिरेव स्यादात्मतृप्तश्च मानवः।

आत्मन्येव च सन्तुष्टस्तस्य कार्यं न विद्यते।।3.17।।
transliteration:
yas tvātma-ratir eva syād ātma-tṛiptaśh cha mānavaḥ
ātmanyeva cha santuṣhṭas tasya kāryaṁ na vidyate
hindiMeaning: ।।3.17।।  जो मनुष्य अपने-आपमें ही रमण करनेवाला और अपने-आपमें ही तृप्त तथा अपने-आपमें ही संतुष्ट है, उसके लिये कोई कर्तव्य नहीं है।
englishMeaning: But the man whose delight is only in the Self, who is satisfied with the Self, who rejoices in the Self, for him nothing remains to be accomplished.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नैव तस्य कृतेनार्थो नाकृतेनेह कश्चन।

न चास्य सर्वभूतेषु कश्िचदर्थव्यपाश्रयः।।3.18।।
transliteration:
naiva tasya kṛitenārtho nākṛiteneha kaśhchana
na chāsya sarva-bhūteṣhu kaśhchid artha-vyapāśhrayaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.18।। उस (कर्मयोगसे सिद्ध हुए) महापुरुषका इस संसारमें न तो कर्म करनेसे कोई प्रयोजन रहता है, और न कर्म न करनेसे ही कोई प्रयोजन रहता है, तथा सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें (किसी भी प्राणीके साथ) इसका किञ्चिन्मात्र भी स्वार्थका सम्बन्ध नहीं रहता।
englishMeaning: He has no purpose to gain from work done or left undone, nor does he have to rely on any end.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तस्मादसक्तः सततं कार्यं कर्म समाचर।

असक्तो ह्याचरन्कर्म परमाप्नोति पूरुषः।।3.19।।
transliteration:
tasmād asaktaḥ satataṁ kāryaṁ karma samāchara
asakto hyācharan karma param āpnoti pūruṣhaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.19।। इसलिये तू निरन्तर आसक्तिरहित होकर कर्तव्य-कर्मका भलीभाँति आचरण कर; क्योंकि आसक्तिरहित होकर कर्म करता हुआ मनुष्य परमात्माको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Therefore, do your work without attachment, which ought to be done. For, a person who works without attachment attains the Supreme.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कर्मणैव हि संसिद्धिमास्थिता जनकादयः।

लोकसंग्रहमेवापि संपश्यन्कर्तुमर्हसि।।3.20।।
transliteration:
karmaṇaiva hi sansiddhim āsthitā janakādayaḥ
loka-saṅgraham evāpi sampaśhyan kartum arhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।3.20।। राजा जनक-जैसे अनेक महापुरुष भी कर्मके द्वारा ही परमसिद्धिको प्राप्त हुए हैं। इसलिये लोकसंग्रहको देखते हुए भी तू (निष्कामभावसे) कर्म करनेके योग्य है।
englishMeaning: Indeed, Janaka and others reached perfection through Karma Yoga alone. Even recognizing its necessity for guiding the world, you must perform action.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः।

स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते।।3.21।।
transliteration:
yad yad ācharati śhreṣhṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ
sa yat pramāṇaṁ kurute lokas tad anuvartate
hindiMeaning: ।।3.21।। श्रेष्ठ मनुष्य जो-जो आचरण करता है, दूसरे मनुष्य वैसा-वैसा ही आचरण करते हैं। वह जो कुछ प्रमाण  देता है,  दूसरे मनुष्य उसीके अनुसार आचरण करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Whatever a great man does, others do too. Whatever standard he sets, the world follows it.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन।

नानवाप्तमवाप्तव्यं वर्त एव च कर्मणि।।3.22।।
transliteration:
na me pārthāsti kartavyaṁ triṣhu lokeṣhu kiñchana
nānavāptam avāptavyaṁ varta eva cha karmaṇi
hindiMeaning: ।।3.22।। हे पार्थ! मुझे तीनों लोकोंमें न तो कुछ कर्तव्य है और न कोई प्राप्त करनेयोग्य वस्तु अप्राप्त है, फिर भी मैं कर्तव्यकर्ममें ही लगा रहता हूँ।
englishMeaning: For me, Arjuna, there is nothing in all the three worlds that ought to be done, nor is there anything unaccomplished that ought to be accomplished. Yet I continue to work.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यदि ह्यहं न वर्तेयं जातु कर्मण्यतन्द्रितः।

मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः।।3.23।।
transliteration:
yadi hyahaṁ na varteyaṁ jātu karmaṇyatandritaḥ
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣhyāḥ pārtha sarvaśhaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.23 -- 3.24।।  हे पार्थ! अगर मैं किसी समय सावधान होकर कर्तव्यकर्म न करूँ तो बड़ी हानि हो जाय; क्योंकि मनुष्य सब प्रकारसे मेरे ही मार्गका अनुसरण करते हैं। यदि मैं कर्म न करूँ, तो ये सब मनुष्य नष्ट-भ्रष्ट हो जायँ और मैं वर्णसंकरताको करनेवाला होऊँ तथा इस समस्त प्रजाको नष्ट करनेवाला बनूँ।
englishMeaning: If I did not continue to work unweariedly, O Arjuna, people would follow my path.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
उत्सीदेयुरिमे लोका न कुर्यां कर्म चेदहम्।

सङ्करस्य च कर्ता स्यामुपहन्यामिमाः प्रजाः।।3.24।।
transliteration:
utsīdeyur ime lokā na kuryāṁ karma ched aham
sankarasya cha kartā syām upahanyām imāḥ prajāḥ

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: Just as the ignorant, attached to their work, act, O Arjuna, so too the learned should act without any attachment, and only for the welfare of the world.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

transliteration:
na buddhi-bhedaṁ janayed ajñānāṁ karma-saṅginām

hindiMeaning: ।।3.25 -- 3.26।। हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन! कर्ममें आसक्त हुए अज्ञानीजन जिस प्रकार कर्म करते हैं आसक्तिरहित विद्वान भी लोकसंग्रह करना चाहता हुआ उसी प्रकार कर्म करे। सावधान तत्त्वज्ञ महापुरुष कर्मोंमें आसक्तिवाले अज्ञानी मनुष्योंकी बुद्धिमें भ्रम उत्पन्न न करे, प्रत्युत स्वयं समस्त कर्मोंको अच्छी तरहसे करता हुआ उनसे भी वैसे ही करवाये।
englishMeaning: He should not bewilder the minds of the ignorant who are attached to work; rather, he should himself perform work with devotion and cause others to do the same.

sanskrit:

अहङ्कारविमूढात्मा कर्ताऽहमिति मन्यते।।3.27।।
transliteration:
prakṛiteḥ kriyamāṇāni guṇaiḥ karmāṇi sarvaśhaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।3.27।। सम्पूर्ण कर्म सब प्रकारसे प्रकृतिके गुणोंद्वारा किये जाते हैं; परन्तु अहंकारसे मोहित अन्तःकरणवाला अज्ञानी मनुष्य 'मैं कर्ता हूँ' -- ऐसा मानता है।
englishMeaning: Actions are being performed in every way by the Gunas of Prakrti; he whose nature is deluded by egoism, however, thinks, 'I am the doer.'

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

tattva-vit tu mahā-bāho guṇa-karma-vibhāgayoḥ
guṇā guṇeṣhu vartanta iti matvā na sajjate
hindiMeaning: ।।3.28।।  हे महाबाहो! गुण-विभाग और कर्म-विभागको तत्त्वसे जाननेवाला महापुरुष 'सम्पूर्ण गुण ही गुणोंमें बरत रहे हैं' --  ऐसा मानकर उनमें आसक्त नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: But he who knows the truth about the division of the Gunas and works, O mighty-armed one, through his knowledge that the Gunas 'operate on their own products,' is not attached.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

तानकृत्स्नविदो मन्दान्कृत्स्नविन्न विचालयेत्।।3.29।।
transliteration:
prakṛiter guṇa-sammūḍhāḥ sajjante guṇa-karmasu

hindiMeaning: ।।3.29।। प्रकृतिजन्य गुणोंसे अत्यन्त मोहित हुए अज्ञानी मनुष्य गुणों और कर्मोंमें आसक्त रहते हैं। उन पूर्णतया न समझनेवाले मन्दबुद्धि अज्ञानियोंको पूर्णतया जाननेवाला ज्ञानी मनुष्य विचलित न करे।
englishMeaning: Those who are deluded by the Gunas of Prakrti are attached to the works of the Gunas. But he who knows the whole truth should not disturb the ignorant who do not know the whole truth.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
मयि सर्वाणि कर्माणि संन्यस्याध्यात्मचेतसा।

transliteration:
mayi sarvāṇi karmāṇi sannyasyādhyātma-chetasā
nirāśhīr nirmamo bhūtvā yudhyasva vigata-jvaraḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.30।। तू विवेकवती बुद्धिके द्वारा सम्पूर्ण कर्तव्य-कर्मोंको मेरे अर्पण करके कामना, ममता और संताप-रहित होकर युद्धरूप कर्तव्य-कर्मको कर।
englishMeaning: Surrender all your actions to Me, with a mind focused on the Self, free from desire and selfishness, and fight with the heat of excitement abated.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ये मे मतमिदं नित्यमनुतिष्ठन्ति मानवाः।

श्रद्धावन्तोऽनसूयन्तो मुच्यन्ते तेऽपि कर्मभिः।।3.31।।
transliteration:
ye me matam idaṁ nityam anutiṣhṭhanti mānavāḥ
śhraddhāvanto ’nasūyanto muchyante te ’pi karmabhiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.31।। जो मनुष्य दोष-दृष्टिसे रहित होकर श्रद्धापूर्वक मेरे इस (पूर्वश्लोकमें वर्णित) मतका सदा अनुसरण करते हैं, वे भी कर्मोंके बन्धनसे मुक्त हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Those men who, full of faith, ever practice this teaching of Mine and those who receive it without cavil—even they are released from karma.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

ये त्वेतदभ्यसूयन्तो नानुतिष्ठन्ति मे मतम्।

सर्वज्ञानविमूढांस्तान्विद्धि नष्टानचेतसः।।3.32।।
transliteration:
ye tvetad abhyasūyanto nānutiṣhṭhanti me matam

hindiMeaning: ।।3.32।। परन्तु जो मनुष्य मेरे इस मतमें दोष-दृष्टि करते हुए इसका अनुष्ठान नहीं करते, उन सम्पूर्ण ज्ञानोंमें मोहित और अविवेकी मनुष्योंको नष्ट हुए ही समझो।
englishMeaning: But those who slander it, and those who do not practice this teaching of Mine—know them to be utterly senseless and devoid of all knowledge, and thus lost.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।3.33।। सम्पूर्ण प्राणी प्रकृतिको प्राप्त होते हैं। ज्ञानी महापुरुष भी अपनी प्रकृतिके अनुसार चेष्टा करता है। फिर इसमें किसीका हठ क्या करेगा?
englishMeaning: Even the man of knowledge acts according to his nature; all beings follow their own nature. What will repression accomplish?

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

इन्द्रियस्येन्द्रियस्यार्थे रागद्वेषौ व्यवस्थितौ।

hindiMeaning: ।।3.34।। इन्द्रिय-इन्द्रियके अर्थमें (प्रत्येक इन्द्रियके प्रत्येक विषयमें) मनुष्यके राग और द्वेष व्यवस्थासे (अनुकूलता और प्रतिकूलताको लेकर) स्थित हैं। मनुष्यको उन दोनोंके वशमें नहीं होना चाहिये; क्योंकि वे दोनों ही इसके (पारमार्थिक मार्गमें विघ्न डालनेवाले) शत्रु हैं।
englishMeaning: Each sense has a fixed attachment to and aversion for its corresponding object, but one should not come under their sway, for they are enemies.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

transliteration:
śhreyān swa-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitāt
swa-dharme nidhanaṁ śhreyaḥ para-dharmo bhayāvahaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।3.35।। अच्छी तरह आचरणमें लाये हुए दूसरेके धर्मसे गुणोंकी कमीवाला अपना धर्म श्रेष्ठ है। अपने धर्ममें तो मरना भी कल्याणकारक है और दूसरेका धर्म भयको देनेवाला है।
englishMeaning: Better is one's own duty, even if done poorly, than the duty of another done well. It is better to die while performing one's own duty; the duty of another is full of fear.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

अथ केन प्रयुक्तोऽयं पापं चरति पूरुषः।

transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
atha kena prayukto ’yaṁ pāpaṁ charati pūruṣhaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।3.36।। अर्जुन बोले - हे वार्ष्णेय ! फिर यह मनुष्य न चाहता हुआ भी जबर्दस्ती लगाये हुएकी तरह किससे प्रेरित होकर पापका आचरण करता है?
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "But, O Krsna, what impels one to commit sin, even against their own will, as if constrained by force?"

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

काम एष क्रोध एष रजोगुणसमुद्भवः।

महाशनो महापाप्मा विद्ध्येनमिह वैरिणम्।।3.37।।
transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
kāma eṣha krodha eṣha rajo-guṇa-samudbhavaḥ
mahāśhano mahā-pāpmā viddhyenam iha vairiṇam
hindiMeaning: ।।3.37।। श्रीभगवान् बोले - रजोगुणसे उत्पन्न हुआ  यह काम ही क्रोध  है। यह बहुत खानेवाला और महापापी है। इस विषयमें तू इसको ही वैरी जान।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "It is desire, it is wrath, born of the guna of rajas; it is a great devourer, an impeller of sin. Know this to be the enemy here."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
धूमेनाव्रियते वह्निर्यथाऽऽदर्शो मलेन च।

यथोल्बेनावृतो गर्भस्तथा तेनेदमावृतम्।।3.38।।
transliteration:
dhūmenāvriyate vahnir yathādarśho malena cha
yatholbenāvṛito garbhas tathā tenedam āvṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।3.38।। जैसे धुएँसे अग्नि और मैलसे दर्पण ढक जाता है तथा जैसे जेरसे गर्भ ढका रहता है, ऐसे ही उस कामके द्वारा यह ज्ञान ( विवेक) ढका हुआ है।
englishMeaning: As a fire is enveloped by smoke, as a mirror is covered by dust, and as an embryo is encased in the amniotic sac, so is this world enveloped by desire.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

कामरूपेण कौन्तेय दुष्पूरेणानलेन च।।3.39।।
transliteration:
āvṛitaṁ jñānam etena jñānino nitya-vairiṇā

एतैर्विमोहयत्येष ज्ञानमावृत्य देहिनम्।।3.40।।

englishMeaning: The senses, the mind, and the intellect are said to be its instruments; by these, it overpowers the embodied self, enveloping its knowledge.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on selfless action as a sacred offering. sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

sanskrit:

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः।

कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति।।4.4।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
aparaṁ bhavato janma paraṁ janma vivasvataḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।4.4।। अर्जुन बोले - आपका जन्म तो अभीका है और सूर्यका जन्म बहुत पुराना है; अतः आपने ही सृष्टिके आदिमें सूर्यसे यह योग कहा था - यह बात मैं कैसे समझूँ?

englishMeaning: The Lord said, "Many of My births have passed, O Arjuna, as have yours. I know them all, but you do not know them."

kāṅkṣhantaḥ karmaṇāṁ siddhiṁ yajanta iha devatāḥ

englishMeaning: The system of four stations was created by Me, according to the distinction of Gunas and Karma. Though I am their creator, know Me to be non-agent and immutable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on divine knowledge, purpose, and right discernment. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

englishMeaning: Works cannot contaminate Me. There is no desire for the fruits of actions in Me. He who understands this is not bound by actions.

sanskrit:
