hindiMeaning: ।।4.15।। पूर्वकालके मुमुक्षुओंने भी इस प्रकार जानकर कर्म किये हैं, इसलिये तू भी पूर्वजोंके द्वारा सदासे किये जानेवाले कर्मोंको ही (उन्हींकी तरह) कर।

englishMeaning: For, there is what ought to be known in action; likewise, there is what ought to be known in multi-form action; and there is what ought to be understood in non-action. Thus, mysterious is the way of action.

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: He who sees inaction in action and also action in inaction is wise among men. He is fit for release and has accomplished all actions.

yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma-saṅkalpa-varjitāḥ

englishMeaning: He whose every undertaking is free from desire and delusive identification (of the body with the self), whose actions are burned up in the fire of knowledge—the wise describe him as a sage.

कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः।।4.20।।
transliteration:
tyaktvā karma-phalāsaṅgaṁ nitya-tṛipto nirāśhrayaḥ
karmaṇyabhipravṛitto ’pi naiva kiñchit karoti saḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।4.20।। जो कर्म और फलकी आसक्तिका त्याग करके आश्रयसे रहित और सदा तृप्त है, वह कर्मोंमें अच्छी तरह लगा हुआ भी वास्तवमें कुछ भी नहीं करता।
englishMeaning: Having renounced attachment to the fruits of their actions, ever contented with the eternal self, and dependent on none, one does not act at all, even while being engaged in action.

hindiMeaning: ।।4.21।। जिसका शरीर और अन्तःकरण अच्छी तरहसे वशमें किया हुआ है, जिसने सब प्रकारके संग्रहका परित्याग कर दिया है, ऐसा आशारहित कर्मयोगी केवल शरीर-सम्बन्धी कर्म करता हुआ भी पापको प्राप्त नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: Free from desire, his intellect and mind controlled, having given up all possessions, and doing bodily work only, he is not subject to evil.

hindiMeaning: ।।4.22।। जो (कर्मयोगी) फल की इच्छा के बिना, अपने-आप जो कुछ मिल जाय, उसमें सन्तुष्ट रहता है और जो ईर्ष्यासे रहित, द्वन्द्वोंसे अतीत तथा सिद्धि और असिद्धिमें सम है, वह कर्म करते हुए भी उससे नहीं बँधता।
englishMeaning: Content with what chance may bring, rising above the pairs of opposites, free from ill-will, even-minded in success and failure, he acts, yet is not bound.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. englishMeaning: One whose attachments have been relinquished, who is liberated, whose mind is established in knowledge, and who works only for sacrifices—their Karma is entirely dissolved.

brahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā
hindiMeaning: ।।4.24।। जिस यज्ञमें अर्पण भी ब्रह्म है, हवी भी ब्रह्म है और ब्रह्मरूप कर्ताके द्वारा ब्रह्मरूप अग्निमें आहुति देनारूप क्रिया भी ब्रह्म है, (ऐसे यज्ञको करनेवाले) जिस मनुष्यकी ब्रह्ममें ही कर्म-समाधि हो गयी है, उसके द्वारा प्राप्त करनेयोग्य फल भी ब्रह्म ही है।
englishMeaning: Brahman is the instrument with which to offer; Brahman is the oblation. By Brahman is the oblation offered into the fire of Brahman; Brahman alone is to be attained by one who meditates on Him in their works.

ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति।।4.25।।

brahmāgnāvapare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati

englishMeaning: Some yogis resort only to the sacrifice relating to gods; others offer sacrifice into the fire of Brahman solely through sacrifice.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on divine knowledge, purpose, and right discernment. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति।।4.26।।

śhrotrādīnīndriyāṇyanye sanyamāgniṣhu juhvati

englishMeaning: Others offer as oblations hearing and other senses into the fires of restraint. Some others offer as oblations the objects of the senses, such as sound and the rest, into the fires of their senses.

ātma-sanyama-yogāgnau juhvati jñāna-dīpite

englishMeaning: Some again offer as an oblation the functions of the senses and the activity of the vital breaths into the fire of the Yoga of restraint of the mind, kindled by knowledge.

dravya-yajñās tapo-yajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpare
swādhyāya-jñāna-yajñāśh cha yatayaḥ sanśhita-vratāḥ

englishMeaning: Self-controlled and firm of resolve, others perform the sacrifice of material objects or austerities or yoga; while others offer their scriptural study and knowledge.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on divine knowledge, purpose, and right discernment. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe ’pānaṁ tathāpare
prāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥ
 apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣhu juhvati
sarve ’pyete yajña-vido yajña-kṣhapita-kalmaṣhāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।4.29 -- 4.30।। दूसरे कितने ही प्राणायामके परायण हुए योगीलोग अपानमें प्राणका पूरक करके, प्राण और अपानकी गति रोककर फिर प्राणमें अपानका हवन करते हैं; तथा अन्य कितने ही नियमित आहार करनेवाले प्राणोंका प्राणोंमें हवन किया करते हैं। ये सभी साधक यज्ञोंद्वारा पापोंका नाश करनेवाले और यज्ञोंको जाननेवाले हैं।
englishMeaning: Others, with restricted diets, are devoted to the control of breath. Some sacrifice the inward breath in the outward breath; similarly, others sacrifice the outward breath in the inward breath. सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः।।4.30।।
transliteration:

sanskrit:

transliteration:

englishMeaning: Know this through prostration, questioning, and service. The wise who have realized the truth will instruct you in knowledge.

transliteration:

englishMeaning: Knowing this, O Arjuna, you will not fall again into delusion in this way—by that knowledge, you will see all beings without exception in yourself and then in Me.

सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि।।4.36।।
transliteration:

ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा।।4.37।।

yathaidhānsi samiddho ’gnir bhasma-sāt kurute ’rjuna

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते।।5.2।।

निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते।।5.3।।

sanskrit:

sanskrit:
यत्सांख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते।

एकं सांख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति।।5.5।।
transliteration:
yat sānkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyate
ekaṁ sānkhyaṁ cha yogaṁ cha yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
hindiMeaning: ।।5.5।। सांख्ययोगियोंके द्वारा जो तत्त्व प्राप्त किया जाता है, कर्मयोगियोंके द्वारा भी वही प्राप्त किया जाता है। अतः जो मनुष्य सांख्ययोग और कर्मयोगको (फलरूपमें) एक देखता है, वही ठीक देखता है।
englishMeaning: That state which is reached by the Sankhyans, the same is also attained by the Yogins; that is, the same state is achieved by those who are Karma Yogins. He alone is wise who perceives that the Sankhya and the Yoga are one and the same, due to their having the same result.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. sanskrit:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः।

योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति।।5.6।।

sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ
yoga-yukto munir brahma na chireṇādhigachchhati

englishMeaning: But, O mighty-armed one, renunciation is hard to attain without practicing Yoga. The sage who contemplates and follows Yoga soon reaches the Brahman (the self or Atman).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. sanskrit:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः।

सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते।।5.7।।
transliteration:
yoga-yukto viśhuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ
sarva-bhūtātma-bhūtātmā kurvann api na lipyate
hindiMeaning: ।।5.7।। जिसकी इन्द्रियाँ अपने वशमें हैं, जिसका अन्तःकरण निर्मल है, जिसका शरीर अपने वशमें है और सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंकी आत्मा ही जिसकी आत्मा है, ऐसा कर्मयोगी कर्म करते हुए भी लिप्त नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: He who follows the Yoga and is pure in mind, who has subdued his self and has conquered his senses, and whose self has become the self of all beings, even while he is acting, remains untainted.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नैव किंचित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित्।

पश्यन् श्रृणवन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपन् श्वसन्।।5.8।।
transliteration:
naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vit
paśhyañ śhṛiṇvan spṛiśhañjighrann aśhnangachchhan svapañśhvasan
 pralapan visṛijan gṛihṇann unmiṣhan nimiṣhann api
indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣhu vartanta iti dhārayan
hindiMeaning: ।।5.8 -- 5.9।। तत्त्वको जाननेवाला सांख्ययोगी देखता, सुनता, छूता, सूँघता, खाता, चलता, ग्रहण करता, बोलता, मल-मूत्र का त्याग करता, सोता, श्वास लेता तथा आँखें खोलता और मूँदता भी सम्पूर्ण इन्द्रियाँ इन्द्रियोंके विषयोंमें बरत रही हैं' -- ऐसा समझकर 'मैं (स्वयं) कुछ भी नहीं करता हूँ' -- ऐसा माने।
englishMeaning: The one who knows the truth and is devoted to yoga should think, "I am not doing anything," even though they are seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving, sleeping, and breathing.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि।

इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन्।।5.9।।
transliteration: pralapan visṛjan gṛhṇann unmiṣan nimiṣann api indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣu vartanta iti dhārayan
hindiMeaning: ।।5.8 -- 5.9।। तत्त्वको जाननेवाला सांख्ययोगी देखता, सुनता, छूता, सूँघता, खाता, चलता, ग्रहण करता, बोलता, मल-मूत्र का त्याग करता, सोता हुआ, श्वास लेता तथा आँखें खोलता और मूँदता हुआ भी 'सम्पूर्ण इन्द्रियाँ इन्द्रियोंके विषयोंमें बरत रही हैं' -- ऐसा समझकर 'मैं (स्वयं) कुछ भी नहीं करता हूँ' -- ऐसा माने।
englishMeaning: Speaking, discharging, grasping, opening, and closing his eyes, etc., he should always bear in mind that the senses operate among sense-objects.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः।

लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा।।5.10।।
transliteration:
brahmaṇyādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ
lipyate na sa pāpena padma-patram ivāmbhasā
hindiMeaning: ।।5.10।। जो (भक्तियोगी) सम्पूर्ण कर्मोंको भगवान् में अर्पण करके और आसक्तिका त्याग करके कर्म करता है, वह जलसे कमलके पत्तेकी तरह पापसे लिप्त नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: He who acts without attachment, reposing all actions on Brahman (Prakṛti), is untouched by evil, just as a lotus leaf is untouched by water.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि।

योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वाऽऽत्मशुद्धये।।5.11।।
transliteration:
kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalair indriyair api
yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṁ tyaktvātma-śhuddhaye
hindiMeaning: ।।5.11।। कर्मयोगी आसक्तिका त्याग करके केवल (ममतारहित) इन्द्रियाँ-शरीर-मन-बुद्धि के द्वारा केवल अन्तःकरणकी शुद्धिके लिये ही कर्म करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Yogins, renouncing attachment, do actions with merely the body, mind, intellect, and senses, for the purification of the self.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम्।

अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते।।5.12।।
transliteration:
yuktaḥ karma-phalaṁ tyaktvā śhāntim āpnoti naiṣhṭhikīm
ayuktaḥ kāma-kāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate
hindiMeaning: ।।5.12।। कर्मयोगी कर्मफलका त्याग करके नैष्ठिकी शान्तिको प्राप्त होता है। परन्तु सकाम मनुष्य कामनाके कारण फलमें आसक्त होकर बँध जाता है।
englishMeaning: A yogi, renouncing the fruits of their actions, attains lasting peace. But the unsteady person who is attached to the fruits of their actions, being driven by desire, is bound.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी।

नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्।।5.13।।
transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī
nava-dvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
hindiMeaning: ।।5.13।। जिसकी इन्द्रियाँ और मन वशमें हैं, ऐसा देहधारी पुरुष नौ द्वारोंवाले शरीररूपी पुरमें सम्पूर्ण कर्मोंका विवेकपूर्वक मनसे त्याग करके निःसन्देह न करता हुआ और न करवाता हुआ सुखपूर्वक (अपने स्वरूपमें) स्थित रहता है।
englishMeaning: The embodied self, mentally resigning all actions as belonging to the city of nine gates (i.e., the body) and becoming self-controlled, dwells happily, neither acting himself nor causing the body to act.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः।

न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते।।5.14।।
transliteration:
na kartṛitvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛijati prabhuḥ
na karma-phala-saṅyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate
hindiMeaning: ।।5.14।। परमेश्वर मनुष्योंके न कर्तापनकी, न कर्मोंकी और न कर्मफलके साथ संयोगकी रचना करते हैं; किन्तु स्वभाव ही बरत रहा है।
englishMeaning: The Lord of the body (the Self, i.e., the Jiva) does not create agency, nor actions, nor union with the fruits of actions in relation to the world of selves; only the inherent tendencies function.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः।

अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः।।5.15।।
transliteration:
nādatte kasyachit pāpaṁ na chaiva sukṛitaṁ vibhuḥ
ajñānenāvṛitaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.15।। सर्वव्यापी परमात्मा न किसीके पापकर्मको और न शुभकर्मको ही ग्रहण करता है; किन्तु अज्ञानसे ज्ञान ढका हुआ है, उसीसे सब जीव मोहित हो रहे हैं।
englishMeaning: The all-pervasive One takes away neither the sin nor the merit of anyone. Knowledge is enveloped by ignorance, and creatures are thereby deluded.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः।

तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम्।।5.16।।
transliteration:
jñānena tu tad ajñānaṁ yeṣhāṁ nāśhitam ātmanaḥ
teṣhām āditya-vaj jñānaṁ prakāśhayati tat param
hindiMeaning: ।।5.16।। परन्तु जिन्होंने अपने जिस ज्ञान-(विवक-) के द्वारा उस अज्ञानका नाश कर दिया है, उनका वह ज्ञान सूर्यकी तरह परमतत्त्व परमात्माको प्रकाशित कर देता है।
englishMeaning: But for those in whom this ignorance is destroyed by the knowledge of the Self, that knowledge, in their case, is supreme and shines brightly like the sun.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः।

गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः।।5.17।।
transliteration:
tad-buddhayas tad-ātmānas tan-niṣhṭhās tat-parāyaṇāḥ
gachchhantyapunar-āvṛittiṁ jñāna-nirdhūta-kalmaṣhāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.17।। जिनकी बुद्धि तदाकार हो रही है, जिनका मन तदाकार हो रहा है, जिनकी स्थिति परमात्मतत्वमें है, ऐसे परमात्मपरायण साधक ज्ञानके द्वारा पापरहित होकर अपुनरावृत्ति (परमगति) को प्राप्त होते हैं।
englishMeaning: Those whose intellects pursue it, whose minds think about it, who undergo discipline for it, and who hold it as their highest object, have their impurities cleansed by knowledge and go from whence there is no return.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
विद्याविनयसंपन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि।

शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः।।5.18।।
transliteration:
vidyā-vinaya-sampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini
śhuni chaiva śhva-pāke cha paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśhinaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.18।। ज्ञानी महापुरुष विद्या-विनययुक्त ब्राह्मणमें और चाण्डालमें तथा गाय, हाथी एवं कुत्तेमें भी समरूप परमात्माको देखनेवाले होते हैं।
englishMeaning: The sages look with an equal eye on one endowed with learning and humility, a Brahmana, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः।

निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः।।5.19।।
transliteration:
ihaiva tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣhāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥ
nirdoṣhaṁ hi samaṁ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.19।। जिनका अन्तःकरण समतामें स्थित है, उन्होंने इस जीवित-अवस्थामें ही सम्पूर्ण संसारको जीत लिया है; ब्रह्म निर्दोष और सम है, इसलिये वे ब्रह्ममें ही स्थित हैं।
englishMeaning: Here itself, those whose minds rest in equanimity overcome samsara. For the Brahman (individual self), when uncontaminated by Prakriti, is the same everywhere; therefore, they abide in Brahman.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम्।

स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः।।5.20।।
transliteration:
na prahṛiṣhyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya chāpriyam
sthira-buddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.20।। जो प्रियको प्राप्त होकर हर्षित न हो और अप्रियको प्राप्त होकर उद्विग्न न हो, वह स्थिर बुद्धिवाला, मूढ़तारहित तथा ब्रह्मको जाननेवाला मनुष्य ब्रह्ममें स्थित है।
englishMeaning: He who knows Brahman (individual self) and abides in Brahman, whose mind is steadfastly focused on the self and undeluded by body consciousness—he neither rejoices at gaining what is pleasant nor grieves on obtaining what is unpleasant.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम्।

स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते।।5.21।।
transliteration:
bāhya-sparśheṣhvasaktātmā vindatyātmani yat sukham

transliteration:
ye hi sansparśha-jā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva te
ādyantavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣhu ramate budhaḥ

transliteration:
śhaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śharīra-vimokṣhaṇāt
kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.23।। इस मनुष्य-शरीरमें जो कोई (मनुष्य) शरीर छूटनेसे पहले ही काम-क्रोधसे उत्पन्न होनेवाले वेगको सहन करनेमें समर्थ होता है, वह नर योगी है और वही सुखी है।
englishMeaning: He who is able, even here, before being released from the body, to bear the impulse generated by desire and anger, he is a Yogin (competent for self-realisation); he is the happy man.

sanskrit:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः।

स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति।।5.24।।
transliteration:
yo 'ntaḥ-sukho 'ntar-ārāmas tathāntar-jyotir eva yaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।5.24।। जो मनुष्य केवल परमात्मामें सुखवाला है और केवल परमात्मामें रमण करनेवाला है तथा जो केवल परमात्मामें ज्ञानवाला है, वह ब्रह्ममें अपनी स्थितिका अनुभव करनेवाला सांख्ययोगी निर्वाण ब्रह्मको प्राप्त होता है।
englishMeaning: He whose joy is within, whose pleasure is within, and whose light is within—he is a yogin, who, having become Brahman, attains the bliss of Brahman.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः।।5.25।।

chhinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.25।। जिनका शरीर मन-बुद्धि-इन्द्रियोंसहित वशमें है, जो सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके हितमें रत हैं, जिनके सम्पूर्ण संशय मिट गये हैं, जिनके सम्पूर्ण कल्मष (दोष) नष्ट हो गये हैं, वे विवेकी साधक निर्वाण ब्रह्मको प्राप्त होते हैं।
englishMeaning: The sages, who are free from the pairs of opposites, whose minds are well subdued, and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, become cleansed of all impurities and attain the bliss of Brahman.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

transliteration:
kāma-krodha-viyuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-chetasām

hindiMeaning: ।।5.26।। काम-क्रोधसे सर्वथा रहित,  जीते हुए मनवाले और स्वरूपका साक्षात्कार किये हुए सांख्ययोगियोंके लिये दोनों ओरसे--शरीरके रहते हुए अथवा शरीर छूटनेके बाद) निर्वाण ब्रह्म परिपूर्ण है।
englishMeaning: To those who are free from desire and wrath, who are accustomed to exerting themselves, whose thoughts are controlled, and who have conquered it—the beatitude of Brahman is close at hand.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. sanskrit:

प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ।।5.27।।
transliteration:
sparśhān kṛitvā bahir bāhyānśh chakṣhuśh chaivāntare bhruvoḥ

 yatendriya-mano-buddhir munir mokṣha-parāyaṇaḥ
vigatechchhā-bhaya-krodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।5.27 -- 5.28।। बाह्य पदार्थोंको बाहर ही छोड़कर और नेत्रोंकी दृष्टिको भौंहोंके बीचमें स्थित करके तथा नासिकामें विचरनेवाले प्राण और अपान वायुको सम करके जिसकी इन्द्रियाँ, मन और बुद्धि अपने वशमें हैं, जो मोक्ष-परायण है तथा जो इच्छा, भय और क्रोधसे सर्वथा रहित है, वह मुनि सदा मुक्त ही है।
englishMeaning: Shutting off outward contacts, fixing the gaze between the eyebrows, realizing inward and outward breaths moving in the nostrils;

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः।।5.28।।

englishMeaning: The sage who has controlled his senses, mind, and intellect, who is intent on release as his final goal, freed forever from desire, fear, and wrath, is indeed liberated forever.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on inner renunciation while living actively. hindiMeaning: ।।5.29।। भक्त मुझे सब यज्ञों और तपोंका भोक्ता, सम्पूर्ण लोकोंका महान् ईश्वर तथा सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंका सुहृद् (स्वार्थरहित दयालु और प्रेमी) जानकर शान्तिको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Knowing Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, as the Supreme Lord of all worlds, as the Friend of every being, he attains peace.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः।

स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः।।6.1।।
transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
anāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥ
sa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।6.1।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- कर्मफलका आश्रय न लेकर जो कर्तव्यकर्म करता है, वही संन्यासी तथा योगी है; और केवल अग्निका त्याग करनेवाला संन्यासी नहीं होता तथा केवल क्रियाओंका त्याग करनेवाला योगी नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "He who performs works that ought to be done without seeking their fruits—he is a sannyasin and yogin, and not he who maintains no sacred fires and performs no actions."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव।

न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन।।6.2।।
transliteration:
yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava
na hyasannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśhchana
hindiMeaning: ।।6.2।। हे अर्जुन ! लोग जिसको संन्यास कहते हैं, उसीको तुम योग समझो; क्योंकि संकल्पोंका त्याग किये बिना मनुष्य कोई-सा भी योगी नहीं हो सकता।
englishMeaning: That which is called Sannyasa (Jnana Yoga), know that to be Yoga (Karma Yoga), O Arjuna. For no one, among Karma Yogins, whose delusive identification of the body with the self has not been abandoned, becomes a true Karma Yogin.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते।

योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते।।6.3।।
transliteration:
ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।6.3।। जो योग-(समता-) में आरूढ़ होना चाहता है, ऐसे मननशील योगीके लिये कर्तव्य-कर्म करना कारण कहा गया है और उसी योगारूढ़ मनुष्यका शम (शान्ति) परमात्मप्राप्तिमें कारण कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: Action is said to be the means for the sage who seeks to climb the heights of Yoga; but when he has climbed the heights of Yoga, tranquility is said to be the means.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते।

सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते।।6.4।।
transliteration:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv-anuṣhajjate
sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadochyate
hindiMeaning: ।।6.4।। जिस समय न इन्द्रियोंके भोगोंमें तथा न कर्मोंमें ही आसक्त होता है, उस समय वह सम्पूर्ण संकल्पोंका त्यागी मनुष्य योगारूढ़ कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: For, when one loses attachment to the things of the senses and to actions, then they have abandoned all desires and are said to have climbed the heights of Yoga.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः।।6.5।।
transliteration:
uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet
ātmaiva hyātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।6.5।। अपने द्वारा अपना उद्धार करे, अपना पतन न करे; क्योंकि आप ही अपना मित्र है और आप ही अपना शत्रु है।
englishMeaning: One should raise oneself by one's own mind and not allow oneself to sink; for the mind alone is the friend of the self, and the mind alone is the foe of the self.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्।।6.6।।

englishMeaning: The mind is the friend of him by whom it has been conquered. But for him whose mind is not conquered, the mind, like an enemy, remains hostile.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. sanskrit:

शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः।।6.7।।
transliteration:

śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।6.7।। जिसने अपने-आपपर अपनी विजय कर ली है, उस शीत-उष्ण (अनुकूलता-प्रतिकूलता) सुख-दुःख तथा मान-अपमानमें निर्विकार मनुष्यको परमात्मा नित्यप्राप्त हैं।
englishMeaning: Of him whose mind is conquered and who is serene, the great self is well-secured in heat and cold, in pleasure and pain, and in honor and dishonor.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः।।6.8।।
transliteration:
jñāna-vijñāna-tṛiptātmā kūṭa-stho vijitendriyaḥ

sanskrit:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदाऽऽत्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः।

sanskrit:

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: To him who sees Me in every self and every self in Me—I am not lost to him, nor is he lost to Me.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।6.31।। मेरेमें एकीभावसे स्थित हुआ जो योगी सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें स्थित मेरा भजन करता है, वह सब कुछ बर्ताव करता हुआ भी मेरेमें ही बर्ताव कर रहा है अर्थात् वह सर्वथा मेरेमें ही स्थित है।
englishMeaning: The yogi who, fixed in oneness, worships Me dwelling in all beings—he abides in Me, no matter how he may live.

sanskrit:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन।

transliteration:
ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo ’rjuna

hindiMeaning: ।।6.32।। हे अर्जुन ! जो (ध्यानयुक्त ज्ञानी महापुरुष) अपने शरीरकी उपमासे सब जगह अपनेको समान देखता है और सुख अथवा दुःखको भी समान देखता है, वह परम योगी माना गया है।
englishMeaning: He who, due to the similarity of selves everywhere, sees pleasure or pain as the same everywhere—that yogi, O Arjuna, is considered the closest.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन।

एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात् स्थितिं स्थिराम्।।6.33।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
yo ’yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana
etasyāhaṁ na paśhyāmi chañchalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām
hindiMeaning: ।।6.33।। अर्जुन बोले -- हे मधुसूदन ! आपने समतापूर्वक जो यह योग कहा है, मनकी चञ्चलताके कारण मैं इस योगकी स्थिर स्थिति नहीं देखता हूँ।
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "O Krsna, this Yoga of reality, which You have declared, I do not see how it can be steady due to the fickleness of the mind."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम्।

तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्।।6.34।।
transliteration:
chañchalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛiṣhṇa pramāthi balavad dṛiḍham

hindiMeaning: ।।6.34।। क्योंकि हे कृष्ण ! मन बड़ा ही चञ्चल, प्रमथनशील, दृढ़ (जिद्दी) और बलवान् है। उसका निग्रह करना मैं वायुकी तरह अत्यन्त कठिन मानता हूँ।
englishMeaning: For the mind is fickle, O Krsna, impetuous, powerful, and stubborn; I think that restraining it is as difficult as restraining the wind.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on discipline of mind through steady practice. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।6.35।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- हे महाबाहो ! यह मन बड़ा चञ्चल है और इसका निग्रह करना भी बड़ा कठिन है -- यह तुम्हारा कहना बिलकुल ठीक है। परन्तु हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! अभ्यास और वैराग्यके द्वारा इसका निग्रह किया जाता है।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "The mind is indeed hard to subdue and fickle, O mighty-armed one, but, O son of Kunti, it can be brought under control through practice and the exercise of dispassion."

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।6.36।। जिसका मन पूरा वशमें नहीं है, उसके द्वारा योग प्राप्त होना कठिन है। परन्तु उपायपूर्वक यत्न करनेवाले वश्यात्माको योग प्राप्त हो सकता है, ऐसा मेरा मत है।
englishMeaning: In my opinion, Yoga is hard to attain by a person of an unrestrained mind; however, it can be attained through the right means by one who strives for it and has a subdued mind.

sanskrit:

अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति।।6.37।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha

hindiMeaning: ।।6.37।। अर्जुन बोले - हे कृष्ण ! जिसकी साधनमें श्रद्धा है, पर जिसका प्रयत्न शिथिल है, वह अन्तसमयमें अगर योगसे विचलितमना हो जाय, तो वह योगसिद्धिको प्राप्त न करके किस गतिको चला जाता है?
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "If a person who is possessed of faith but has put in only inadequate effort finds his mind wandering away from Yoga, and then fails to attain perfection—what way does he go, O Krishna?"

hindiMeaning: ।।6.38।। हे महाबाहो ! संसारके आश्रयसे रहित और परमात्मप्राप्तिके मार्गमें मोहित अर्थात् विचलित -- इस तरह दोनों ओरसे भ्रष्ट हुआ साधक क्या छिन्न-भिन्न बादलकी तरह नष्ट तो नहीं हो जाता ?
englishMeaning: Without any support, confused in the path leading to the Brahman, and thus having fallen from both, does he not perish, O mighty-armed one, like a rent cloud?

transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।6.39।। हे कृष्ण! मेरे इस सन्देहका सर्वथा छेदन करनेके लिये आप ही योग्य हैं; क्योंकि इस संशयका छेदन करनेवाला आपके सिवाय दूसरा कोई हो नहीं सकता।
englishMeaning: O Krsna, you should altogether remove this doubt of mine, for there is no other remover of this doubt than you.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते।

नहि कल्याणकृत्कश्िचद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति।।6.40।।

śhrī bhagavān uvācha

hindiMeaning: ।।6.40।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- हे पृथानन्दन ! उसका न तो इस लोकमें और न परलोकमें ही विनाश होता है; क्योंकि हे प्यारे ! कल्याणकारी काम करनेवाला कोई भी मनुष्य दुर्गतिको प्राप्त नहीं जाता।

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते।।6.41।।
transliteration:
prāpya puṇya-kṛitāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśhvatīḥ samāḥ
śhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo’bhijāyate
hindiMeaning: ।।6.41।। वह योगभ्रष्ट पुण्यकर्म करनेवालोंके लोकोंको प्राप्त होकर और वहाँ बहुत वर्षोंतक रहकर फिर यहाँ शुद्ध  श्रीमानोंके घरमें जन्म लेता है।
englishMeaning: He who has fallen away from Yoga is born again in the house of the pure and prosperous, having attained to the worlds of doers of good deeds and dwelled there for many long years.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्।।6.42।।
transliteration:

etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛiśham

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:

यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन।।6.43।।
transliteration:
tatra taṁ buddhi-sanyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam
yatate cha tato bhūyaḥ sansiddhau kuru-nandana

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः।

transliteration:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśho ’pi saḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।6.44।। वह (श्रीमानोंके घरमें जन्म लेनेवाला योगभ्रष्ट मनुष्य) भोगोंके परवश होता हुआ भी पूर्वजन्ममें किये हुए अभ्यास-(साधन-) के कारण ही परमात्माकी तरफ खिंच जाता है; क्योंकि योग-(समता-) का जिज्ञासु भी वेदोंमें कहे हुए सकाम कर्मोंका अतिक्रमण कर जाता है।

aneka-janma-sansiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim

कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन।।6.46।।
transliteration:
tapasvibhyo ’dhiko yogī

sanskrit:

श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः।।6.47।।
transliteration:
yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntar-ātmanā

hindiMeaning: ।।6.47।। सम्पूर्ण योगियोंमें भी जो श्रद्धावान् भक्त मुझमें तल्लीन हुए मनसे मेरा भजन करता है, वह मेरे मतमें सर्वश्रेष्ठ योगी है।
englishMeaning: He who, with faith, worships Me, and whose innermost self is fixed in Me, I consider him to be the greatest of the Yogins.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः।

असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु।।7.1।।

śhrī bhagavān uvācha
mayyāsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।7.1।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- हे पृथानन्दन ! मुझमें आसक्त मनवाला, मेरे आश्रित होकर योगका अभ्यास करता हुआ तू मेरे समग्ररूपको निःसन्देह जैसा जानेगा, उसको सुन।

transliteration:
jñānaṁ te ’haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmyaśheṣhataḥ
yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo ’nyaj jñātavyam-avaśhiṣhyate
hindiMeaning: ।।7.2।। तेरे लिये मैं विज्ञानसहित ज्ञान सम्पूर्णतासे कहूँगा, जिसको जाननेके बाद फिर यहाँ कुछ भी जानना बाकी नहीं रहेगा।
englishMeaning: I will declare to you in full this knowledge of God, along with the knowledge that makes it distinguished, knowing which nothing else remains to be known.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्िचन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः।।7.3।।

manuṣhyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśhchid yatati siddhaye
yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśhchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।7.3।। हजारों मनुष्योंमें कोई एक वास्तविक सिद्धिके लिये यत्न करता है और उन यत्न करनेवाले सिद्धोंमें कोई एक ही मुझे तत्त्वसे जानता है।
englishMeaning: Among thousands of men, some strive for perfection; even among those who strive for perfection, only some know Me; and among those who know Me, only some truly know Me.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च।

अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा।।7.4।।
transliteration:
bhūmir-āpo ’nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva cha
ahankāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛitir aṣhṭadhā
hindiMeaning: ।।7.4 -- 7.5।।  पृथ्वी, जल, तेज, वायु, आकाश -- ये पञ्चमहाभूत और मन, बुद्धि तथा अहंकार -- यह आठ प्रकारके भेदोंवाली मेरी 'अपरा' प्रकृति है। हे महाबाहो ! इस अपरा प्रकृतिसे भिन्न जीवरूप बनी हुई मेरी 'परा' प्रकृतिको जान, जिसके द्वारा यह जगत् धारण किया जाता है।
englishMeaning: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, Manas, Buddhi, and the ego-sense—thus My Prakriti is divided into eight parts.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम्।

जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्।।7.5।।
transliteration:
apareyam itas tvanyāṁ prakṛitiṁ viddhi me parām
jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat
hindiMeaning: ।।7.4 -- 7.5।।  पृथ्वी, जल, तेज, वायु, आकाश -- ये पञ्चमहाभूत और मन, बुद्धि तथा अहंकार -- यह आठ प्रकारके भेदोंवाली मेरी अपरा प्रकृति है। हे महाबाहो ! इस 'अपरा' प्रकृतिसे भिन्न मेरी जीवरूपा बनी हुुई मेरी 'परा' प्रकृतिको जान, जिसके द्वारा यह जगत् धारण किया जाता है।
englishMeaning: This is My lower Prakṛti. But, O mighty-armed one, know that My higher nature is another. It is the life-principle (Jīva-bhūta), by which this universe is sustained.

sanskrit:

अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा।।7.6।।
transliteration:
etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhāraya
ahaṁ kṛitsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā
hindiMeaning: ।।7.6।। अपरा और परा -- इन दोनों प्रकृतियोंके संयोगसे ही सम्पूर्ण प्राणी उत्पन्न होते हैं, ऐसा तुम समझो। मैं सम्पूर्ण जगत् का प्रभव तथा प्रलय हूँ।
englishMeaning: Know that all beings have these two as the source of their birth. Therefore, I am the origin and the dissolver of the whole universe.

sanskrit:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय।

मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव।।7.7।।
transliteration:
mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjaya
mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva
hindiMeaning: ।।7.7।। हे धनञ्जय ! मेरे बढ़कर (इस जगत् का) दूसरा कोई किञ्चिन्मात्र भी कारण नहीं है। जैसे सूतकी मणियाँ सूतके धागेमें पिरोयी हुई होती हैं, ऐसे ही यह सम्पूर्ण जगत् मेरेमें ही ओत-प्रोत है।
englishMeaning: There is nothing higher than Me, O Arjuna. All this is strung on Me, like rows of gems on a thread.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु।।7.8।।
transliteration:
raso ’ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśhi-sūryayoḥ
praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛiṣhu
hindiMeaning: ।।7.8।। हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! जलोंमें रस मैं हूँ, चन्द्रमा और सूर्यमें प्रभा (प्रकाश) मैं हूँ, सम्पूर्ण वेदोंमें प्रणव (ओंकार) मैं हूँ, आकाशमें शब्द और मनुष्योंमें पुरुषार्थ मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am the taste in the waters, O Arjuna! I am the light in the sun and the moon; the sacred syllable Om in all the Vedas; sound in the ether; and manhood in men, I am.

जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु।।7.9।।
transliteration:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛithivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasau
jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu
hindiMeaning: ।।7.9।। पृथ्वीमें पवित्र गन्ध मैं हूँ, और अग्निमें तेज मैं हूँ, तथा सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें जीवनीशक्ति मैं हूँ और तपस्वियोंमें तपस्या मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am the pure scent in the earth; I am the radiance in the fire; I am the life-force in all beings, and austerity in ascetics.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्।

बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्।।7.10।।
transliteration:
bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam
buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।7.10।। हे पृथानन्दन ! सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंका अनादि बीज मुझे जान। बुद्धिमानोंमें बुद्धि और तेजस्वियोंमें तेज मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Know Me, O Arjuna, to be the primeval seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the discerning and the brilliance of the brilliant.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्।

धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ।।7.11।।
transliteration:
balaṁ balavatāṁ chāhaṁ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo ’smi bharatarṣhabha
hindiMeaning: ।।7.11।। हे भरतवंशियोंमें श्रेष्ठ अर्जुन ! बलवालोंमें काम और रागसे रहित बल मैं हूँ। मनुषयोंमें धर्मसे अविरुद्ध (धर्मयुक्त) काम मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: In the strong, I am strength, devoid of desire and passion. In all beings, I am the desire which is not contrary to Dharma, O Arjuna.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये।

मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि नत्वहं तेषु ते मयि।।7.12।।
transliteration:
ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha ye
matta eveti tān viddhi na tvahaṁ teṣhu te mayi
hindiMeaning: ।।7.12।। (और तो क्या कहूँ)  जितने भी सात्त्विक, राजस और तामस भाव हैं, वे सब मुझ से ही होते हैं -- ऐसा समझो। पर मैं उनमें और वे मेरेमें नहीं हैं।
englishMeaning: Know that all those states of Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas are from Me alone; however, I am not in them; rather, they are in Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्।

मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्।।7.13।।
transliteration:
tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat
mohitaṁ nābhijānāti māmebhyaḥ param avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।7.13।। किन्तु - इन तीनों गुणरूप भावोंसे मोहित यह सब जगत् इन गुणोंसे अतीत अविनाशी मुझे नहीं जानता।
englishMeaning: The entire universe is deluded by these three states originating from the Gunas (of Prakrti), and fails to recognize Me, who am beyond them and immutable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया।

मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते।।7.14।।
transliteration:
daivī hyeṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā
mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te
hindiMeaning: ।।7.14।। क्योंकि मेरी यह गुणमयी दैवी माया बड़ी दुरत्यय है अर्थात् इससे पार पाना बड़ा कठिन है। जो केवल मेरे ही शरण होते हैं, वे इस मायाको तर जाते हैं।
englishMeaning:

৷৷
(b) ৷৷ But those who take refuge in Me alone shall pass beyond the Maya.

sanskrit:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः।

माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः।।7.15।।
transliteration:
na māṁ duṣhkṛitino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ

englishMeaning: The evil-doers, the foolish, the lowest of men, those persons deprived of knowledge by delusion (Maya) and those who are dominated by a demoniac nature - they do not seek refuge in Me.

sanskrit:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन।

आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ।।7.16।।
transliteration:
chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛitino ’rjuna
ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha
hindiMeaning: ।।7.16।। हे भरतवंशियोंमें श्रेष्ठ अर्जुनव ! पवित्र कर्म करनेवाले अर्थार्थी, आर्त, जिज्ञासु और ज्ञानी अर्थात् प्रेमी -- ये चार प्रकारके मनुष्य मेरा भजन करते हैं अर्थात् मेरे शरण होते हैं।
englishMeaning: Four types of men of good deeds worship Me, O Arjuna: the distressed, the seekers of knowledge, the seekers of wealth, and the men of knowledge.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्ितर्विशिष्यते।

प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः।।7.17।।
transliteration:
teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśhiṣhyate
priyo hi jñānino ’tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।7.17।। उन चार भक्तोंमें मेरेमें निरन्तर लगा हुआ, अनन्यभक्तिवाला ज्ञानी अर्थात् प्रेमी भक्त श्रेष्ठ है; क्योंकि ज्ञानी भक्तको मैं अत्यन्त प्रिय हूँ और वह भी मेरेको अत्यन्त प्रिय है।
englishMeaning: Of these, the man of knowledge, who is ever with Me in Yoga and devoted to the One only, is the foremost; for I am very dear to the man of knowledge, and he is also dear to Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्।

आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्।।7.18।।
transliteration:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim
hindiMeaning: ।।7.18।। पहले कहे हुए सब-के-सब भक्त बड़े उदार (श्रेष्ठ भाववाले) हैं। परन्तु ज्ञानी (प्रेमी) तो मेरा स्वरूप ही है -- ऐसा मेरा मत है। कारण कि वह युक्तात्मा है और जिससे श्रेष्ठ दूसरी कोई गति नहीं है, ऐसे मेरेमें ही दृढ़ आस्थावाला है।
englishMeaning: All these are indeed generous, but I deem the man of knowledge to be My very self; for he, integrated, is devoted solely to Me as the highest end.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते।

वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः।।7.19।।
transliteration:
bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate
vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।7.19।। बहुत जन्मोंके अन्तमें अर्थात् मनुष्यजन्ममें 'सब कुछ परमात्मा ही है', ऐसा जो ज्ञानवान् मेरे शरण होता है, वह महात्मा अत्यन्त दुर्लभ है।
englishMeaning: At the end of many births, the man of knowledge finds refuge in Me, realizing that 'Vasudeva is all.' It is very difficult to find such a great-souled person.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः।

तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया।।7.20।।
transliteration:
kāmais tais tair hṛita-jñānāḥ prapadyante ’nya-devatāḥ
taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛityā niyatāḥ svayā
hindiMeaning: ।।7.20।। उन-उन कामनाओंसे जिनका ज्ञान अपहृत हो गया है, ऐसे वे मनुष्य अपनी-अपनी प्रकृतिसे नियन्त्रित होकर (देवताओंके) उन-उन नियमोंको धारण करते हुए उन-उन देवताओंके शरण हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Controlled by their inherent nature, and deprived of knowledge by various desires, worldly-minded people resort to other gods, observing various disciplines.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति।

तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम्।।7.21।।
transliteration:
yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārchitum ichchhati
tasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmyaham
hindiMeaning: ।।7.21।। जो-जो भक्त जिस-जिस देवताका श्रद्धापूर्वक पूजन करना चाहता है, उस-उस देवताके प्रति मैं उसकी श्रद्धाको दृढ़ कर देता हूँ।
englishMeaning: Whichever devotee seeks to worship with faith whatever form, I make their faith steadfast.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते।

लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान् हि तान्।।7.22।।
transliteration:
sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate
labhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān
hindiMeaning: ।।7.22।। उस (मेरे द्वारा दृढ़ की हुई) श्रद्धासे युक्त होकर वह मनुष्य (सकामभावपूर्वक) उस देवताकी उपासना करता है और उसकी वह कामना पूरी भी होती है; परन्तु वह कामना-पूर्ति मेरे द्वारा  विहित की हुई होती है।
englishMeaning: Endowed with that faith, he worships that form and thereby gets the objects of his desire, granted in reality by Me alone.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम्।

देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि।।7.23।।
transliteration:
antavat tu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavatyalpa-medhasām
devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api
hindiMeaning: ।।7.23।। परन्तु उन अल्पबुद्धिवाले मनुष्योंको उन देवताओंकी आराधनाका फल अन्तवाला (नाशवान्) ही मिलता है। देवताओंका पूजन करनेवाले देवताओंको प्राप्त होते हैं और मेरे भक्त मेरे ही प्राप्त होते हैं।
englishMeaning: But the fruit gained by these men of small understanding is limited. The worshippers of the gods will go to the gods, but My devotees will come to Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्ितमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः।

परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम्।।7.24।।
transliteration:
avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam
hindiMeaning: ।।7.24।। बुद्धिहीन मनुष्य मेरे सर्वश्रेष्ठ अविनाशी परमभावको न जानते हुए अव्यक्त (मन-इन्द्रियोंसे पर) मुझ सच्चिदानन्दघन परमात्माको मनुष्यकी तरह ही शरीर धारण करनेवाला मानते हैं।
englishMeaning: Not knowing My higher, immutable, and unsurpassed nature, the ignorant think of Me as an entity that has now become manifest, though I was previously unmanifest.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः।

मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्।।7.25।।
transliteration:
nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛitaḥ
mūḍho ’yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।7.25।। जो मूढ़ मनुष्य मेरेको अज और अविनाशी ठीक तरहसे नहीं जानते (मानते), उन सबके सामने योगमायासे अच्छी तरहसे आवृत हुआ मैं प्रकट नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: Veiled by my Maya, I am not manifest to all; this deluded world does not recognize me as the unborn and immutable.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन।

भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन।।7.26।।
transliteration:
vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjuna
bhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana
hindiMeaning: ।।7.26।। हे अर्जुन ! जो प्राणी भूतकालमें हो चुके हैं, तथा जो वर्तमानमें हैं और जो भविष्यमें होंगे, उन सब प्राणियोंको तो मैं जानता हूँ; परन्तु मेरेको कोई (मूढ़ मनुष्य) नहीं जानता।
englishMeaning: I know all beings, O Arjuna, past, present, and those to come; but no one knows Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत।

सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप।।7.27।।
transliteration:
ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata
sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa
hindiMeaning: ।।7.27।। हे भरतवंशमें उत्पन्न परंतप ! इच्छा (राग) और द्वेषसे उत्पन्न होनेवाले द्वन्द्व-मोहसे मोहित सम्पूर्ण प्राणी संसारमें मूढ़ताको अर्थात् जन्म-मरणको प्राप्त हो रहे हैं।
englishMeaning: O Arjuna, all beings are deluded as soon as they are born, due to the delusion of the pairs of opposites springing from desire and hate.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम्।

ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः।।7.28।।
transliteration:
yeṣhāṁ tvanta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām
te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛiḍha-vratāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।7.28।। परन्तु जिन पुण्यकर्मा मनुष्योंके पाप नष्ट गये हैं, वे द्वन्द्वमोहसे रहित हुए मनुष्य दृढ़व्रती होकर मेरा भजन करते हैं।
englishMeaning: But those who have done good deeds, whose sins have come to an end, are freed from the delusion of the pairs of opposites. They steadfastly worship Me, adhering to their vows.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये।

ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्।।7.29।।
transliteration:
jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti ye
te brahma tadviduḥ kṛitsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam
hindiMeaning: ।।7.29।।  जरा (वृद्धावस्था) और मरण (मृत्यु) से मोक्ष पानेके लिये जो  मेरा आश्रय लेकर प्रयत्न करते हैं, वे उस ब्रह्मको, सम्पूर्ण अध्यात्मको और सम्पूर्ण कर्मको भी जान जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Those who take refuge in Me and strive for deliverance from old age and death, know Brahman (or the Self) and all about the nature of that Self, and the entire Karma (or activities leading to rebirth).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः।

प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः।।7.30।।
transliteration:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥ
prayāṇa-kāle ’pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।7.30।। जो मनुष्य अधिभूत, अधिदैव और अधियज्ञके सहित मुझे जानते हैं, वे युक्तचेता मनुष्य अन्तकालमें भी मुझे ही जानते हैं अर्थात् प्राप्त होते हैं।
englishMeaning: And those who know Me with the Adhibhuta, Adhidaiva, and Adhiyajna, they too, with their minds fixed in meditation, know Me even at the hour of death.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on knowing the Divine as source and support of all. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम।

अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते।।8.1।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
kiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣhottama
adhibhūtaṁ cha kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim uchyate

akṣharaṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo ’dhyātmam uchyate

hindiMeaning: ।।8.3।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- परम अक्षर ब्रह्म है और जीवका अपना जो होनापन है, उसको अध्यात्म कहते हैं। प्राणियों का उद्भव (सत्ता को प्रकट) करनेवाला जो त्याग है उसको कर्म कहा जाता है।

hindiMeaning: ।।8.5।। जो मनुष्य अन्तकालमें भी मेरा स्मरण करते हुए शरीर छोड़कर जाता है, वह मेरे स्वरुप को ही प्राप्त होता है, इसमें सन्देह नहीं है।
englishMeaning: And at the time of death, anyone who departs, giving up the body while thinking of Me alone, attains My state; there is no doubt about this.

transliteration:
yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajatyante kalevaram

hindiMeaning: ।।8.6।। हे कुन्तीपुत्र अर्जुन ! मनुष्य अन्तकाल में जिस-जिस भी भावका स्मरण करते हुए शरीर छोड़ता है वह उस (अन्तकालके) भावसे सदा भावित होता हुआ उस-उसको ही प्राप्त होता है अर्थात् उस-उस योनिमें ही चला जाता है।
englishMeaning: O son of Kunti, thinking of any entity, whichever it may be, one gives up the body at the end; he attains that very one, having been always engrossed in its thought.

मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम्।।8.7।।

englishMeaning: Therefore, think of Me at all times and fight; there is no doubt that by dedicating your mind and intellect to Me, you will attain only Me.

paramaṁ puruṣhaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānuchintayan
hindiMeaning: ।।8.8।। हे पृथानन्दन ! अभ्यासयोगसे युक्त और अन्यका चिन्तन न करनेवाले चित्तसे परम दिव्य पुरुषका चिन्तन करता हुआ (शरीर छोड़नेवाला मनुष्य) उसीको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: O son of Prtha, by meditating with a mind engaged in the yoga of practice and not straying away to anything else, one reaches the supreme Person existing in the effulgent region.

kaviṁ purāṇam anuśhāsitāram

hindiMeaning: ।।8.9।। जो सर्वज्ञ, पुराण, शासन करनेवाला, सूक्ष्म-से-सूक्ष्म, सबका धारण-पोषण करनेवाला, अज्ञानसे अत्यन्त परे, सूर्यकी तरह प्रकाशस्वरूप -- ऐसे अचिन्त्य स्वरूपका चिन्तन करता है।
englishMeaning: He who meditates on the Omniscient, the Ancient, the Ruler, subtler than the subtle, the Ordainer of everything, of inconceivable form, effulgent like the sun, and beyond darkness—he attains the Supreme Person.

प्रयाणकाले मनसाऽचलेन

hindiMeaning: ।।8.10।। वह भक्तियुक्त मनुष्य अन्तसमयमें अचल मनसे और योगबलके द्वारा भृकुटीके मध्यमें प्राणोंको अच्छी तरहसे प्रविष्ट करके (शरीर छोड़नेपर) उस परम दिव्य पुरुषको ही प्राप्त होता है।
englishMeaning: At the time of death, having fully fixed the Prana (vital force) between the eyebrows with an unwavering mind, and being imbued with devotion as well as the strength of concentration, he reaches that resplendent Supreme Person.

hindiMeaning: ।।8.11।। वेदवेत्ता लोग जिसको अक्षर कहते हैं, वीतराग यति जिसको प्राप्त करते हैं और साधक जिसकी प्राप्तिकी इच्छा करते हुए ब्रह्मचर्यका पालन करते हैं, वह पद मैं तेरे लिये संक्षेपसे कहूँगा।
englishMeaning: I will briefly speak to you of that immutable Goal, which the knowers of the Vedas declare; into which diligent ones, free from attachment, enter, and for which people practice celibacy, aspiring.

sarva-dvārāṇi sanyamya mano hṛidi nirudhya cha
mūrdhnyādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām
hindiMeaning: ।।8.12 -- 8.13।। (इन्द्रियोंके) सम्पूर्ण द्वारोंको रोककर मनका हृदयमें निरोध करके और अपने प्राणोंको मस्तकमें स्थापित करके योगधारणामें सम्यक् प्रकारसे स्थित हुआ जो 'ऊँ' इस एक अक्षर ब्रह्मका  उच्चारण और मेरा स्मरण करता हुआ शरीरको छोड़कर जाता है, वह परमगतिको प्राप्त होता है।
englishMeaning: Having controlled all the senses, confined the mind in the heart, and fixed his own vital force in the head, he should remain steadfast in yoga.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on remembrance of the Divine in every transition. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

englishMeaning: He who departs, leaving the body while uttering the single syllable, viz. "Om," which is Brahman, and thinking of Me, attains the supreme Goal.

englishMeaning: O son of Prtha, to that yogi of constant concentration and single-minded attention, who remembers Me uninterruptedly and for a long time, I am easy to attain.

मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते।।8.16।।

sanskrit:

englishMeaning: O best of the Bharata dynasty, I shall now speak of that time by which the yogis depart and attain the State of Non-return, and also the State of Return.

agnir jyotir ahaḥ śhuklaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam
tatra prayātā gachchhanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।8.24।। जिस मार्गमें प्रकाशस्वरूप अग्निका अधिपति देवता, दिनका अधिपति देवता, शुक्लपक्षका अधिपति देवता, और छः महीनोंवाले उत्तरायणका अधिपति देवता है, शरीर छोड़कर उस मार्गसे गये हुए ब्रह्मवेत्ता पुरुष (पहले ब्रह्मलोकको प्राप्त होकर पीछे ब्रह्माजीके साथ) ब्रह्मको प्राप्त हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Fire, light, daytime, the bright fortnight, the six months of the northern solstice—by following this path, persons who are knowers of Brahman attain Brahman when they die.

englishMeaning: These two paths of the world, which are white and black, are indeed considered eternal. Through one, a person goes to the state of non-return; through the other, they return again.
