sanskrit:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्।

भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः।।9.5।।
transliteration:
na cha mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśhya me yogam aiśhwaram
bhūta-bhṛin na cha bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।9.4 -- 9.5।। यह सब संसार मेरे निराकार स्वरूपसे व्याप्त है। सम्पूर्ण प्राणी मुझ में स्थित हैं; परन्तु मैं उनमें स्थित नहीं हूँ तथा वे प्राणी भी मेरेमें स्थित नहीं हैं -- मेरे इस ईश्वर-सम्बन्धी योग-(सामर्थ्य-) को देख ! सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंको उत्पन्न करनेवाला और उनका धारण, भरण-पोषण करनेवाला मेरा स्वरूप उन प्राणियोंमें स्थित नहीं है।
englishMeaning: Yet, beings do not remain in Me. Behold My divine Yoga. I am the sustainer of all beings, yet I am not in them. It is My will alone that causes their existence.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यथाऽऽकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान्।

तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय।।9.6।।
transliteration:
yathākāśha-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānītyupadhāraya
hindiMeaning: ।।9.6।। जैसे सब जगह विचरनेवाली महान् वायु नित्य ही आकाशमें स्थित रहती है, ऐसे ही सम्पूर्ण प्राणी मुझमें ही स्थित रहते हैं -- ऐसा तुम मान लो।
englishMeaning: As the powerful element air, moving everywhere, ever remains in the ether, know that so too all beings abide in Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम्।

कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्।।9.7।।
transliteration:
sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛitiṁ yānti māmikām
kalpa-kṣhaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛijāmyaham
hindiMeaning: ।।9.7।। हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! कल्पोंका क्षय होनेपर सम्पूर्ण प्राणी मेरी प्रकृतिको प्राप्त होते हैं और कल्पोंके आदिमें मैं फिर उनकी रचना करता हूँ।
englishMeaning: All beings, O Arjuna, enter into My Prakriti at the end of a cycle of time; again, I send them forth at the beginning of a cycle of time.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः।

भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्।।9.8।।
transliteration:
prakṛitiṁ svām avaṣhṭabhya visṛijāmi punaḥ punaḥ
bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛitsnam avaśhaṁ prakṛiter vaśhāt
hindiMeaning: ।।9.8।। प्रकृतिके वशमें होनेसे परतन्त्र हुए इस सम्पूर्ण प्राणिसमुदायको मैं (कल्पोंके आदिमें) अपनी प्रकृतिको वशमें करके बार-बार रचता हूँ।
englishMeaning: Controlling the Prakṛti, which is My own, I send forth again and again this multitude of beings, helpless under the sway of Prakṛti.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय।

उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु।।9.9।।
transliteration:
na cha māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya
udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣhu karmasu
hindiMeaning: ।।9.9।। हे धनञ्जय ! उन (सृष्टि-रचना आदि) कर्मोंमें अनासक्त और उदासीनकी तरह रहते हुए मेरेको वे कर्म नहीं बाँधते।
englishMeaning: But these actions do not bind Me, O Arjuna, for I remain detached from them, as if I were unconcerned.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
मयाऽध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम्।

हेतुनाऽनेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते।।9.10।।
transliteration:
mayādhyakṣheṇa prakṛitiḥ sūyate sa-charācharam
hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate
hindiMeaning: ।।9.10।। प्रकृति मेरी अध्यक्षतामें सम्पूर्ण चराचर जगत् को रचती है। हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! इसी हेतुसे जगत् का विविध प्रकारसे परिवर्तन होता है।
englishMeaning: Under My supervision, Prakrti gives birth to all mobile and immobile entities, and thus, O Arjuna, the world revolves.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम्।

परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्।।9.11।।
transliteration:
avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣhīṁ tanum āśhritam
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram
hindiMeaning: ।।9.11।। मूर्खलोग मेरे सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके महान् ईश्वररूप परमभावको न जानते हुए मुझे मनुष्यशरीरके आश्रित मानकर अर्थात् साधारण मनुष्य मानकर मेरी अवज्ञा करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Fools disregard Me, dwelling in a human form, not knowing My higher nature as the Supreme Lord of all beings.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः।

राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः।।9.12।।
transliteration:
moghāśhā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vichetasaḥ
rākṣhasīm āsurīṁ chaiva prakṛitiṁ mohinīṁ śhritāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।9.12।। जिनकी सब आशाएँ व्यर्थ होती हैं, सब शुभ-कर्म व्यर्थ होते हैं और सब ज्ञान व्यर्थ होते हैं अर्थात् जिनकी आशाएँ, कर्म और ज्ञान सत्-फल देनेवाले नहीं होते, ऐसे अविवेकी मनुष्य आसुरी, राक्षसी और मोहिनी फकृतिका आश्रय लेते हैं।
englishMeaning: Senseless people have a nature that is deluding and similar to that of rakshasas and asuras. Their hopes are futile, their actions are futile, and their knowledge is futile.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः।

भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्।।9.13।।
transliteration:
mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛitim āśhritāḥ
bhajantyananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।9.13।। परन्तु हे पृथानन्दन ! दैवी प्रकृतिके आश्रित अनन्यमनवाले महात्मालोग मुझे सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंका आदि और अविनाशी समझकर मेरा भजन करते हैं।
englishMeaning: But the great-souled ones, O Arjuna, who are associated with My divine nature, worship Me with an unwavering mind, knowing Me to be the immutable source of all beings.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः।

नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते।।9.14।।
transliteration:
satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaśh cha dṛiḍha-vratāḥ
namasyantaśh cha māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate
hindiMeaning: ।।9.14।। नित्य- (मेरेमें) युक्त मनुष्य दृढ़व्रती होकर लगनपूर्वक साधनमें लगे हुए और भक्तिपूर्वक कीर्तन करते हुए तथा नमस्कार करते हुये निरन्तर मेरी उपासना करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Aspiring for eternal communion with Me, they worship Me, always singing My praises, striving with steadfast resolution and bowing down to Me in devotion.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते।

एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्।।9.15।।
transliteration:
jñāna-yajñena chāpyanye yajanto mām upāsate
ekatvena pṛithaktvena bahudhā viśhvato-mukham
hindiMeaning: ।।9.15।। दूसरे साधक ज्ञानयज्ञके द्वारा एकीभावसे (अभेद-भावसे) मेरा पूजन करते हुए मेरी उपासना करते हैं और दूसरे कई साधक अपनेको पृथक् मानकर चारों तरफ मुखवाले मेरे विराट्ररुपकी अर्थात् संसारको मेरा विराट्ररुप मानकर (सेव्य-सेवकभावसे) मेरी अनेक प्रकारसे उपासना करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Others, besides offering the sacrifice of knowledge, also worship Me as One, who is characterized by diversity in countless ways and is multiform (in My Cosmic aspect).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाऽहमहमौषधम्।

मंत्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्।।9.16।।
transliteration:
ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣhadham
mantro ’ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam
hindiMeaning: ।।9.16 -- 9.18।।  क्रतु मैं हूँ, यज्ञ मैं हूँ, स्वधा मैं हूँ, औषध मैं हूँ, मन्त्र मैं हूँ, घृत मैं हूँ, अग्नि मैं हूँ और हवनरूप क्रिया भी मैं हूँ। जाननेयोग्य पवित्र, ओंकार, ऋग्वेद, सामवेद और यजुर्वेद भी मैं ही हूँ। इस सम्पूर्ण जगत्का पिता, धाता, माता, पितामह, गति, भर्ता, प्रभु, साक्षी, निवास, आश्रय, सुहृद्, उत्पत्ति, प्रलय, स्थान, निधान तथा अविनाशी बीज भी मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am Kratu, I am the sacrifice, I am the offering to the manes, I am the herb, I am the Mantra, I am the clarified butter, I am the fire, I am the oblation.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
पिताऽहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः।

वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक् साम यजुरेव च।।9.17।।
transliteration:
pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ
vedyaṁ pavitram oṁkāra ṛik sāma yajur eva cha
hindiMeaning: ।।9.16 -- 9.18।। क्रतु मैं हूँ, यज्ञ मैं हूँ, स्वधा मैं हूँ, औषध मैं हूँ, मन्त्र मैं हूँ, घृत मैं हूँ, अग्नि मैं हूँ और हवनरूप क्रिया भी मैं हूँ। जाननेयोग्य पवित्र, ओंकार, ऋग्वेद, सामवेद और यजुर्वेद भी मैं ही हूँ। इस सम्पूर्ण जगत् का पिता, धाता, माता, पितामह, गति, भर्ता, प्रभु, साक्षी, निवास, आश्रय, सुहृद्, उत्पत्ति, प्रलय, स्थान, निधान तथा अविनाशी बीज भी मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am the father, mother, creator, and grandfather of the universe; I am the purifier. I am the syllable Om, as well as Rk, Saman, and Yajus.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्।

प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्।।9.18।।
transliteration:
gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣhī nivāsaḥ śharaṇaṁ suhṛit
prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।9.16 -- 9.18।।  क्रतु मैं हूँ, यज्ञ मैं हूँ, स्वधा मैं हूँ, औषध मैं हूँ, मन्त्र मैं हूँ, घृत मैं हूँ, अग्नि मैं हूँ और हवनरूप क्रिया भी मैं हूँ। जाननेयोग्य पवित्र, ओंकार, ऋग्वेद, सामवेद और यजुर्वेद भी मैं ही हूँ। इस सम्पूर्ण जगत्का पिता, धाता, माता, पितामह, गति, भर्ता, प्रभु, साक्षी, निवास, आश्रय, सुहृद्, उत्पत्ति, प्रलय, स्थान, निधान तथा अविनाशी बीज भी मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am the goal, the supporter, the Lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the friend. I am the origin, the dissolution, the basis for preservation, and the imperishable seed.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च।

अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन।।9.19।।
transliteration:
tapāmyaham ahaṁ varṣhaṁ nigṛihṇāmyutsṛijāmi cha
amṛitaṁ chaiva mṛityuśh cha sad asach chāham arjuna
hindiMeaning: ।।9.19।। हे अर्जुन ! (संसारके हितके लिये) मैं ही सूर्यरूपसे तपता हूँ, जलको ग्रहण करता हूँ और फिर उस जलको वर्षारूपसे बरसा देता हूँ। (और तो क्या कहूँ) अमृत और मृत्यु तथा सत् और असत् भी मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: I give heat, I withhold and send forth the rain; I am immortality and also death, O Arjuna. I am the being and the non-being.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on the Lord's intimate grace and loving reciprocity. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा

यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते।

ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक

मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्।।9.20।।
transliteration:
trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā
yajñair iṣhṭvā svar-gatiṁ prārthayante
te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam
aśhnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān

sanskrit:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः।

अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च।।10.20।।
transliteration:
aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥ
aham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha
hindiMeaning: ।।10.20।। हे नींदको जीतनेवाले अर्जुन ! सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके आदि, मध्य तथा अन्तमें भी मैं ही हूँ और प्राणियोंके अन्तःकरणमें आत्मरूपसे भी मैं ही स्थित हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am the Self, O Arjuna, dwelling in the hearts of all beings; I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्।

मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी।।10.21।।
transliteration:
ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir anśhumān
marīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī
hindiMeaning: ।।10.21।।  मैं अदितिके पुत्रोंमें विष्णु (वामन) और प्रकाशमान वस्तुओंमें किरणोंवाला सूर्य हूँ। मैं मरुतोंका तेज और नक्षत्रोंका अधिपति चन्द्रमा हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the Adityas, I am Vishnu; of luminous bodies, I am the radiant sun. Of the Maruts, I am Marici, and among the constellations, I am the moon.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः।

इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना।।10.22।।
transliteration:
vedānāṁ sāma-vedo ’smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ
indriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā
hindiMeaning: ।।10.22।। मैं वेदोंमें सामवेद हूँ, देवताओंमें इन्द्र हूँ, इन्द्रियोंमें मन हूँ और प्राणियोंकी चेतना हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the Vedas, I am the Samaveda; of gods, I am Indra; of sense-organs, I am the mind; and of living beings, I am consciousness.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्।

वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्।।10.23।।
transliteration:
rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasām
vasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruḥ śhikhariṇām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।10.23।। रुद्रोंमें शंकर और यक्ष-राक्षसोंमें कुबेर मैं हूँ।वसुओंमें पावक (अग्नि) और शिखरवाले पर्वतोंमें सुमेरु मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the Rudras, I am Sankara. Of the Yaksas and Raksasas, I am the Lord of Wealth (Kubera). Of the Vasus, I am Agni; of the mountains, I am Meru.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्।

सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः।।10.24।।
transliteration:
purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛihaspatim
senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.24।। हे पार्थ ! पुरोहितोंमें मुख्य बृहस्पतिको मेरा स्वरूप समझो। सेनापतियोंमें स्कन्द और जलाशयोंमें समुद्र मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Among family priests, O Arjuna, know Me to be the chief Brhaspati; of generals, I am Skanda; of reservoirs of water, I am the ocean.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्।

यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः।।10.25।।
transliteration:
maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛigur ahaṁ girām asmyekam akṣharam
yajñānāṁ japa-yajño ’smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.25।। महर्षियोंमें भृगु और वाणियों-(शब्दों-) में एक अक्षर अर्थात् प्रणव मैं हूँ। सम्पूर्ण यज्ञोंमें जपयज्ञ और स्थिर रहनेवालोंमें हिमालय मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the great seers, I am Bhrgu; of words, I am the single-lettered word Om; of sacrifices, I am the sacrifice of Japa; of immovable things, I am the Himalayas.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः।

गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः।।10.26।।
transliteration:
aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛikṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥ
gandharvāṇāṁ chitrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.26।। सम्पूर्ण वृक्षोंमें पीपल, देवर्षियोंमें नारद, गन्धर्वोंमें चित्ररथ और सिद्धोंमें कपिल मुनि मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of trees I am the Asvattha; of celestial seers, I am Narada; of the Gandharvas, I am Citraratha; of the perfected, I am Kapila.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्।

ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्।।10.27।।
transliteration:
uchchaiḥśhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛitodbhavam
airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam
hindiMeaning: ।।10.27।। घोड़ोंमें अमृतके साथ समुद्रसे प्रकट होनेवाले उच्चैःश्रवा नामक घोड़ेको, श्रेष्ठ हाथियोंमें ऐरावत नामक हाथीको और मनुष्योंमें राजाको मेरी विभूति मानो।
englishMeaning: Of horses, know Me to be Uccaihsravas, the nectar-born. Of lordly elephants, I am Airavata, and of men, I am the monarch.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्।

प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः।।10.28।।
transliteration:
āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
prajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.28।। आयुधोंमें वज्र और धेनुओंमें कामधेनु मैं हूँ। सन्तान-उत्पत्तिका हेतु कामदेव मैं हूँ और सर्पोंमें वासुकि मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of weapons, I am the Vajra (thunderbolt); of cows, I am Kamadhuk; I am Kandarpa, the cause of progeny; of serpents, I am Vasuki.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्।

पितृ़णामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्।।10.29।।
transliteration:
anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham
pitṝīṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ sanyamatām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।10.29।। नागोंमें अनन्त (शेषनाग) और जल-जन्तुओंका अधिपति वरुण मैं हूँ। पितरोंमें अर्यमा और शासन करनेवालोंमें यमराज मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of snakes, I am Ananta; of aquatic beings, I am Varuna; of manes, I am Aryama; of subduers, I am Yama.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्।

मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्।।10.30।।
transliteration:
prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham
mṛigāṇāṁ cha mṛigendro ’haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām
hindiMeaning: ।।10.30।। दैत्योंमें प्रह्लाद और गणना करनेवालोंमें काल मैं हूँ । पशुओंमें सिंह और पक्षियोंमें गरुड मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of Daityas, I am Prahlada; of reckoners, I am Death; of beasts, I am the lion; and of birds, I am Garuda, the son of Vinata.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्।

झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी।।10.31।।
transliteration:
pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛitām aham
jhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
hindiMeaning: ।।10.31।। पवित्र करनेवालोंमें वायु और शास्त्रधारियोंमें राम मैं हूँ। जल-जन्तुओंमें मगर मैं हूँ। बहनेवाले स्त्रोतोंमें गङ्गाजी मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of moving things, I am the wind; of those who bear weapons, I am Rama; of fishers, I am Makara; and of rivers, I am the Ganga.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन।

अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्।।10.32।।
transliteration:
sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjuna
adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।10.32।। हे अर्जुन ! सम्पूर्ण सर्गोंके आदि, मध्य तथा अन्तमें मैं ही हूँ। विद्याओंमें अध्यात्मविद्या और परस्पर शास्त्रार्थ करनेवालोंका(तत्त्व-निर्णयके लिये किया जानेवाला) वाद मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of creatures, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end, O Arjuna. Of sciences, I am the science of the Self (of the individual and Universal Self). Of those who argue, I am the fair reasoning.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च।

अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताऽहं विश्वतोमुखः।।10.33।।
transliteration:
अहमेवाक्षय: कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुख: || 33||

akṣharāṇām a-kāro ’smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya cha
aham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśhvato-mukhaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.33।। अक्षरोंमें अकार और समासोंमें द्वन्द्व समास मैं हूँ। अक्षयकाल अर्थात् कालका भी महाकाल तथा सब ओर मुखवाला धाता भी मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of letters, I am the alphabet 'A'; of compound words, I am the dvandva (copulative); I am myself imperishable time; I am the creator, facing all sides.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम्।

कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा।।10.34।।
transliteration:
mṛityuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatām
kīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛitir medhā dhṛitiḥ kṣhamā
hindiMeaning: ।।10.34।। सबका हरण करनेवाली मृत्यु और उत्पन्न होनेवालोंका उभ्दव मैं हूँ तथा स्त्री-जातिमें कीर्ति, श्री, वाक्, स्मृति, मेधा, धृति और क्षमा मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am also death, which snatches away all. I am the origin of all that will be born. Among women, I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, endurance, and forgiveness.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्।

मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः।।10.35।।
transliteration:
bṛihat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām aham
māsānāṁ mārga-śhīrṣho ’ham ṛitūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.35।। गायी जानेवाली श्रुतियोंमें बृहत्साम और वैदिक छन्दोंमें गायत्री छन्द मैं हूँ। बारह महीनोंमें मार्गशीर्ष और छः ऋतुओंमें वसन्त मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of Saman hymns, I am the Brhatsaman; of meters, I am the Gayatri; of months, I am Margasira (Nov-Dec); and of seasons, I am the season of flowers.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्।

जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्।।10.36।।
transliteration:
dyūtaṁ chhalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
jayo ’smi vyavasāyo ’smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।10.36।। छल करनेवालोंमें जूआ और तेजस्वियोंमें तेज मैं हूँ। जीतनेवालोंकी विजय, निश्चय करनेवालोंका निश्चय और सात्त्विक मनुष्योंका सात्त्विक भाव मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the fraudulent, I am gambling; I am the brilliance of the brilliant; I am victory, I am effort; I am the magnanimity of the magnanimous.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनंजयः।

मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः।।10.37।।
transliteration:
vṛiṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo ’smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ
munīnām apyahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।10.37।। वृष्णिवंशियोंमें वासुदेव और पाण्डवोंमें धनञ्जय मैं हूँ। मुनियोंमें वेदव्यास और कवियोंमें कवि शुक्राचार्य भी मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of the Vrsnis, I am Vasudeva; of the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; of sages, I am Vyasa; and of seers, I am Usana (Sukra).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्।

मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्।।10.38।।
transliteration:
daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatām
maunaṁ chaivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
hindiMeaning: ।।10.38।। दमन करनेवालोंमें दण्डनीति और विजय चाहनेवालोंमें नीति मैं हूँ। गोपनीय भावोंमें मौन और ज्ञानवानोंमें ज्ञान मैं हूँ।
englishMeaning: Of those who punish, I am the principle of punishment. Of those who seek victory, I am policy. Of secrets, I am also silence. And of the wise, I am wisdom.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन।

न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्।।10.39।।
transliteration:
yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna
na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam
hindiMeaning: ।।10.39।। हे अर्जुन! सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंका जो बीज है, वह बीज मैं ही हूँ; क्योंकि मेरे बिना कोई भी चर-अचर प्राणी नहीं है अर्थात् चर-अचर सब कुछ मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: I am also that which is the seed of all beings, O Arjuna. Nothing that moves or does not move exists without Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परंतप।

एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया।।10.40।।
transliteration:
nānto ’sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa
eṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
hindiMeaning: ।।10.40।। हे परंतप अर्जुन ! मेरी दिव्य विभूतियोंका अन्त नहीं है। मैंने तुम्हारे सामने अपनी विभूतियोंका जो विस्तार कहा है, यह तो केवल संक्षेपसे कहा है।
englishMeaning: There is no limit to My divine manifestations. Here, I have briefly described the extent of such manifestations.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा।

तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसंभवम्।।10.41।।
transliteration:
yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vā
tat tad evāvagachchha tvaṁ mama tejo ’nśha-sambhavam
hindiMeaning: ।।10.41।। जो-जो ऐश्वर्ययुक्त, शोभायुक्त और बलयुक्त प्राणी तथा वस्तु है, उस-उसको तुम मेरे ही तेज-(योग-) के अंशसे उत्पन्न हुई समझो।
englishMeaning: Whatever being is possessed of power, or splendour, or energy, know that as coming from a fragment of My power.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन।

विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्।।10.42।।
transliteration:
atha vā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna
viṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛitsnam ekānśhena sthito jagat
hindiMeaning: ।।10.42।। अथवा हे अर्जुन ! तुम्हें इस प्रकार बहुत-सी बातें जाननेकी क्या आवश्यकता है?  मैं अपने किसी एक अंशसे  सम्पूर्ण जगत् को व्याप्त करके स्थित हूँ।
englishMeaning: But of what use is all this extensive knowledge to you, O Arjuna? I sustain this whole universe with only a fragment of My power.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on seeing divine presence in excellence everywhere. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम्।

यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम।।11.1।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
mad-anugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-sanjñitam
yat tvayoktaṁ vachas tena moho ’yaṁ vigato mama
hindiMeaning: ।।11.1।। अर्जुन बोले -- केवल मेरेपर कृपा करनेके लिये ही आपने जो परम गोपनीय अध्यात्मतत्तव जाननेका वचन कहा, उससे मेरा यह मोह नष्ट हो गया है।
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "To show favor to me, You have told me that most profound mystery concerning the Self; by that, this delusion of mine has been dispelled."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया।

त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्।।11.2।।
transliteration:
bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śhrutau vistaraśho mayā
tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣha māhātmyam api chāvyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।11.2।।  हे कमलनयन ! सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंकी उत्पत्ति और प्रलय मैंने विस्तारपूर्वक आपसे ही सुना है और आपका अविनाशी माहात्म्य भी सुना है।
englishMeaning: O Krsna, I have heard in detail about the origin and dissolution of all beings, which come from You, as well as Your immutable greatness.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर।

द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम।।11.3।।
transliteration:
evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśhvara
draṣhṭum ichchhāmi te rūpam aiśhwaraṁ puruṣhottama
hindiMeaning: ।।11.3।। हे पुरुषोत्तम ! आप अपने-आपको जैसा कहते हैं, यह वास्तवमें ऐसा ही है। हे परमेश्वर ! आपके ईश्वर-सम्बन्धी रूपको मैं देखना चाहता हूँ।
englishMeaning: O Supreme Lord, as You have described Yourself, so You are. I wish to behold Your divine form, O Supreme Person.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो।

योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयाऽत्मानमव्ययम्।।11.4।।
transliteration:
manyase yadi tach chhakyaṁ mayā draṣhṭum iti prabho
yogeśhvara tato me tvaṁ darśhayātmānam avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।11.4।। हे प्रभो ! मेरे द्वारा आपका वह परम ऐश्वर रूप देखा जा सकता है -- ऐसा अगर आप मानते हैं, तो हे योगेश्वर ! आप अपने उस अविनाशी स्वरूपको मुझे दिखा दीजिये।
englishMeaning: If you think, O Lord, that it can be seen by me, then, O Lord of Yoga, reveal Yourself fully to me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः।

नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च।।11.5।।
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
paśhya me pārtha rūpāṇi śhataśho ’tha sahasraśhaḥ
nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛitīni cha
hindiMeaning: ।।11.5।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- हे पृथानन्दन ! अब मेरे अनेक तरहके, अनेक अनेक वर्णों और आकृतियोंवाले सैकड़ों-हजारों दिव्यरूपोंको तू देख।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "Behold, O Arjuna, My forms, hundreds upon thousands, manifold, divine, varied in hue and shape."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्िवनौ मरुतस्तथा।

बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याऽश्चर्याणि भारत।।11.6।।
transliteration:
paśhyādityān vasūn rudrān aśhvinau marutas tathā
bahūny adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvāṇi paśhyāśhcharyāṇi bhārata
hindiMeaning: ।।11.6।। हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन! तू बारह आदित्योंको, आठ वसुओंको, ग्यारह रुद्रोंको और दो अश्विनीकुमारोंको तथा उनचास मरुद्गणोंको देख। जिनको तूने पहले कभी देखा नहीं, ऐसे बहुत-से आश्चर्यजनक रूपोंको भी तू देख।
englishMeaning: Behold, O Arjuna, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the two Asvins, and the Maruts—many marvels never seen before.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्।

मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि।।11.7।।
transliteration:
ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ paśhyādya sa-charācharam
mama dehe guḍākeśha yach chānyad draṣhṭum ichchhasi
hindiMeaning: ।।11.7।। हे नींदको जीतनेवाले अर्जुन! मेरे इस शरीरके एक देशमें चराचरसहित सम्पूर्ण जगत् को अभी देख ले। इसके सिवाय तू और भी जो कुछ देखना चाहता है, वह भी देख ले।
englishMeaning: Behold here, O Arjuna, the entire universe with its mobile and immobile things, all centered in My body, and whatever else you desire to see.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा।

दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्।।11.8।।
transliteration:
na tu māṁ śhakyase draṣhṭum anenaiva sva-chakṣhuṣhā
divyaṁ dadāmi te chakṣhuḥ paśhya me yogam aiśhwaram
hindiMeaning: ।।11.8।। परन्तु तू अपनी इस आँखसे अर्थात् चर्मचक्षुसे मेरेको देख ही नहीं सकता, इसलिये मैं तुझे दिव्य चक्षु देता हूँ, जिससे तू मेरी ईश्वर-सम्बन्धी सामर्थ्यको देख।
englishMeaning: But you will not be able to see Me with your own eyes. I give you a divine eye, so behold My Lordly Yoga!
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
सञ्जय उवाच

एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः।

दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्।।11.9।।
transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśhvaro hariḥ
darśhayām āsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśhwaram
hindiMeaning: ।।11.9।। सञ्जय बोले -- हे राजन् ! ऐसा कहकर फिर महायोगेश्वर भगवान् श्रीकृष्णने अर्जुनको परम ऐश्वर-रूप दिखाया।
englishMeaning: Sanjaya said, "O King, having spoken, Sri Krishna, the great Lord of Yoga, then revealed to Arjuna the supreme, lordly form."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्।

अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्।।11.10।।
transliteration:
aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśhanam
aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham
hindiMeaning: ।।11.10 -- 11.11।। जिसके अनेक मुख और नेत्र हैं, अनेक तहरके अद्भुत दर्शन हैं, अनेक दिव्य आभूषण हैं, हाथोंमें उठाये हुए अनेक दिव्य आयुध हैं तथा जिनके गलेमें दिव्य मालाएँ हैं, जो दिव्य वस्त्र पहने हुए हैं, जिनके ललाट तथा शरीरपर दिव्य चन्दन, कुंकुम आदि लगा हुआ है, ऐसे सम्पूर्ण आश्चर्यमय, अनन्तरूपवाले तथा चारों तरफ मुखवाले देव-(अपने दिव्य स्वरूप-) को भगवान् ने दिखाया।
englishMeaning: With innumerable mouths and eyes, many marvelous aspects, numerous divine ornaments, and numerous divine weapons.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम्।

सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्।।11.11।।
transliteration:
divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanam
sarvāśhcharya-mayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśhvato-mukham
hindiMeaning: ।।11.10 -- 11.11।। जिसके अनेक मुख और नेत्र हैं, अनेक तहरके अद्भुत दर्शन हैं, अनेक दिव्य आभूषण हैं, हाथोंमें उठाये हुए अनेक दिव्य आयुध हैं तथा जिनके गलेमें दिव्य मालाएँ हैं, जो दिव्य वस्त्र पहने हुए हैं, जिनके ललाट तथा शरीरपर दिव्य चन्दन, कुंकुम आदि लगा हुआ है, ऐसे सम्पूर्ण आश्चर्यमय, अनन्त रूपोंवाले तथा चारों तरफ मुखवाले देव-(अपने दिव्य स्वरूप-) को भगवान् ने दिखाया।
englishMeaning: Wearing celestial garlands and raiments, anointed with divine perfumes, full of wonders, resplendent, boundless, and facing all directions.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता।

यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः।।11.12।।
transliteration:
divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā
yadi bhāḥ sadṛiśhī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।11.12।। अगर आकाशमें एक साथ हजारों सूर्य उदित हो जायँ, तो भी उन सबका प्रकाश मिलकर उस महात्मा-(विराट् रूप परमात्मा-) के प्रकाशके समान शायद ही हो।
englishMeaning: If a thousand suns were to rise at once in the sky, the resulting splendour would be like the splendour of that mighty One.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा।

अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा।।11.13।।
transliteration:
tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ pravibhaktam anekadhā
apaśhyad deva-devasya śharīre pāṇḍavas tadā

sanskrit:

ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ

sanskrit:
अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं

aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁ

sanskrit:

पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ता

kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakriṇaṁ cha

englishMeaning: I behold You as a mass of light, shining everywhere, with a diadem, mace, and discus, hard to behold, blazing like a burning fire and the sun, and immeasurable.

sanskrit:
त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं

transliteration:
tvam akṣharaṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁ
tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam

sanātanas tvaṁ puruṣho mato me
hindiMeaning: ।।11.18।। आप ही जाननेयोग्य परम अक्षर (अक्षरब्रह्म) हैं, आप ही इस सम्पूर्ण विश्वके परम आश्रय हैं, आप ही सनातनधर्मके रक्षक हैं और आप ही अविनाशी सनातन पुरुष हैं -- ऐसा मैं मानता हूँ।
englishMeaning: You are the Imperishable, Supreme One to be realized. You are the Supreme Substratum of this universe. You are immutable, the guardian of the eternal law; I know You are the Supreme Person who is everlasting.

sanskrit:

स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्।।11.19।।

hindiMeaning: ।।11.19।। आपको मैं आदि, मध्य और अन्तसे रहित, अनन्त प्रभावशाली, अनन्त भुजाओंवाले, चन्द्र और सूर्यरूप नेत्रोवाले, प्रज्वलित अग्निके समान मुखोंवाले और अपने तेजसे संसारको संतप्त करते हुए देख रहा हूँ।

sanskrit:
द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि

dyāv ā-pṛithivyor idam antaraṁ hi

englishMeaning: You alone have pervaded the interspace between heaven and earth, and all the quarters. Beholding your marvelous and terrible form, O Mahatman, the three worlds are greatly overwhelmed with fear.

स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः।।11.21।।

englishMeaning: Verily, the hosts of Devas enter into You. Some, in fear, extol You with clasped hands, crying "Hail!" The bands of great seers and Siddhas praise You with meaningful hymns.

गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा

vīkṣhante tvāṁ vismitāśh chaiva sarve

englishMeaning: The Rudras, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Sadhyas, the Visvas, the Asvins, the Maruts, and the Manes, as well as the hosts of Gandharvas, Yaksas, Asuras, and Siddhas—all gaze upon You in amazement.

rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁ

englishMeaning: Beholding Your great form with many mouths and eyes, many arms, thighs, and feet, many stomachs, and terrible with many teeth, the worlds tremble, and I too quake, O mighty-armed one.

hindiMeaning: ।।11.24।। हे विष्णो ! आपके अनेक देदीप्यमान वर्ण हैं, आप आकाशको स्पर्श कर रहे हैं, आपका मुख फैला हुआ है आपके नेत्र प्रदीप्त और विशाल हैं। ऐसे आपको देखकर भयभीत अन्तःकरणवाला मैं धैर्य और शान्तिको प्राप्त नहीं हो रहा हूँ।
englishMeaning: When I behold You touching the Supreme Heaven, shining, multicolored, with yawning mouths and large, resplendent eyes, my inner being trembles in fear. I am unable to find support or peace, O Vishnu.

danṣhṭrā-karālāni cha te mukhāni
dṛiṣhṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhāni
diśho na jāne na labhe cha śharma
prasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa

englishMeaning: Viewing Your mouths, presenting awe-generating fangs and looking like the consuming fire of final destruction, I know not the quarters of the globe nor do I find repose. Be gracious, O Lord of the Devas! O Abode of the universe!

sanskrit:

amī cha tvāṁ dhṛitarāśhtrasya putrāḥ

bhīṣhmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsau

 vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśhanti
danṣhṭrā-karālāni bhayānakāni
kechid vilagnā daśhanāntareṣhu
sandṛiśhyante chūrṇitair uttamāṅgaiḥ

englishMeaning: All these sons of Dhrtarastra, together with the hosts of monarchs, Bhisma, Drona, and Karna, along with the leading warriors of our side,
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति

दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि।

केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु

संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः।।11.27।।

hindiMeaning: ।।11.26 -- 11.27।। हमारे मुख्य  योद्धाओंके सहित भीष्म, द्रोण और वह कर्ण भी आपमें प्रविष्ट हो रहे हैं। राजाओंके समुदायोंके सहित धृतराष्ट्रके वे ही सब-के-सब पुत्र आपके विकराल दाढ़ोंके कारण भयंकर मुखोंमें बड़ी तेजीसे प्रविष्ट हो रहे हैं। उनमेंसे कईएक तो चूर्ण हुए सिरोंसहित आपके दाँतोंके बीचमें फँसे हुए दीख रहे हैं।
englishMeaning: Hasten to enter Your fearful mouths with terrible fangs, crushing some of those caught between the teeth to powder.

विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति।।11.28।।
transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।11.28।। जैसे नदियोंके बहुत-से जलके प्रवाह स्वाभाविक ही समुद्रके सम्मुख दौड़ते हैं, ऐसे ही वे संसारके महान् शूरवीर आपके प्रज्वलित मुखोंमें प्रवेश कर रहे हैं।

sanskrit:
यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा

विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः।

तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका

स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः।।11.29।।
transliteration:
yathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgā
viśhanti nāśhāya samṛiddha-vegāḥ
tathaiva nāśhāya viśhanti lokās
tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛiddha-vegāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।11.29।। जैसे पतंगे मोहवश अपना नाश करनेके लिये बड़े वेगसे दौड़ते हुए प्रज्वलित अग्निमें प्रविष्ट होते हैं, ऐसे ही ये सब लोग भी मोहवश अपना नाश करनेके लिये बड़े वेगसे दौड़ते हुए आपके मुखोंमें प्रविष्ट हो रहे हैं।
englishMeaning: As moths rush swiftly into a blazing fire, leading to their destruction, so do these men swiftly rush into Your mouths, leading to their destruction.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ता

ल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः।

तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं

भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो।।11.30।।
transliteration:
lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl
lokān samagrān vadanair jvaladbhiḥ
tejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁ
bhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣhṇo
hindiMeaning: ।।11.30।। आप अपने प्रज्वलित मुखोंद्वारा सम्पूर्ण लोकोंका ग्रसन करते हुए उन्हें चारों ओरसे बार-बार चाट रहे हैं और हे विष्णो ! आपका उग्र प्रकाश अपने तेजसे सम्पूर्ण जगत् को परिपूर्ण करके सबको तपा रहा है।
englishMeaning: Devouring all the worlds on every side with your flaming mouths, you lick them up. Your fiery rays, filling the whole universe with their radiance, scorch it, O Vishnu.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो

नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद।

विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं

न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्।।11.31।।
transliteration:
ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūpo
namo ’stu te deva-vara prasīda
vijñātum ichchhāmi bhavantam ādyaṁ
na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛittim
hindiMeaning: ।।11.31।। मुझे यह बताइये कि उग्ररूपवाले आप कौन हैं? हे देवताओंमें श्रेष्ठ ! आपको नमस्कार हो। आप प्रसन्न होइये। आदिरूप आपको मैं तत्त्वसे जानना चाहता हूँ; क्योंकि मैं आपकी प्रवृत्तिको नहीं जानता।
englishMeaning: Tell me, who are You with this terrible form? Salutations to You, O Supreme God. Be gracious to me. I desire to know You, the Primal One. I do not know Your activities.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो

लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः।

ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे

येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः।।11.32।।
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
kālo ’smi loka-kṣhaya-kṛit pravṛiddho
lokān samāhartum iha pravṛittaḥ
ṛite ’pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣhyanti sarve
ye ’vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣhu yodhāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।11.32।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- मैं सम्पूर्ण लोकोंका क्षय करनेवाला बढ़ा हुआ काल हूँ और इस समय मैं इन सब लोगोंका संहार करनेके लिये यहाँ आया हूँ। तुम्हारे प्रतिपक्षमें जो योद्धालोग खड़े हैं, वे सब तुम्हारे युद्ध किये बिना भी नहीं रहेंगे।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "I am the world-destroying Time. Manifesting myself fully, I have begun to destroy the worlds here. Even without you, none of the warriors arrayed in the hostile ranks will survive."
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व

जित्वा शत्रून् भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्।

मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव

निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्।।11.33।।
transliteration:
tasmāt tvam uttiṣhṭha yaśho labhasva
jitvā śhatrūn bhuṅkṣhva rājyaṁ samṛiddham
mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva
nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savya-sāchin
hindiMeaning: ।।11.33।। इसलिये तुम युद्धके लिये खड़े हो जाओ और यशको प्राप्त करो तथा शत्रुओंको जीतकर धन-धान्यसे सम्पन्न राज्यको भोगो। ये सभी मेरे द्वारा पहलेसे ही मारे हुए हैं। हे सव्यसाचिन् !  तुम निमित्तमात्र बन जाओ।
englishMeaning: Therefore, arise, win glory. Conquering your foes, enjoy a prosperous kingdom. By Me they have already been slain. You be merely an instrument, O Arjuna, you great archer!

sanskrit:
द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च

कर्णं तथाऽन्यानपि योधवीरान्।

मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा

युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्।।11.34।।
transliteration:
droṇaṁ cha bhīṣhmaṁ cha jayadrathaṁ cha
karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān
mayā hatāṁs tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣhṭhā
yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān
hindiMeaning: ।।11.34।। द्रोण, भीष्म, जयद्रथ और कर्ण तथा अन्य सभी मेरे द्वारा मारे हुए शूरवीरोंको तुम मारो। तुम व्यथा मत करो और युद्ध करो। युद्धमें तुम निःसन्देह वैरियोंको जीतोगे।
englishMeaning: Slay Drona, Bhisma, Jayadratha, Karna, as well as other mighty warriors who have been doomed by Me. Do not feel distressed. Fight; you shall conquer your rivals in the battle.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. sanskrit:
सञ्जय उवाच

एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य

कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी।

नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं

सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य।।11.35।।
transliteration:
sañjaya uvācha
etach chhrutvā vachanaṁ keśhavasya
kṛitāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭī
namaskṛitvā bhūya evāha kṛiṣhṇaṁ
sa-gadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya
hindiMeaning: ।।11.35।। सञ्जय बोले -- भगवान् केशवका यह वचन सुनकर भयसे कम्पित हुए किरीटी अर्जुन हाथ जोड़कर नमस्कार करके और अत्यन्त भयभीत होकर फिर प्रणाम करके गद्गदं वाणीसे भगवान् कृष्णसे बोले।
englishMeaning: Sanjaya said, Having heard this speech of Krsna, Arjuna did Him obeisance; and trembling with awe, he bowed down again, and with folded palms, his voice choked with emotion, he spoke to Krsna.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
अर्जुन उवाच

स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या

जगत् प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च।

रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति

सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः।।11.36।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
sthāne hṛiṣhīkeśha tava prakīrtyā
jagat prahṛiṣhyaty anurajyate cha
rakṣhānsi bhītāni diśho dravanti
sarve namasyanti cha siddha-saṅghāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।11.36।। अर्जुन बोले -- हे अन्तर्यामी भगवन् ! आपके नाम, गुण, लीलाका कीर्तन करनेसे यह सम्पूर्ण जगत् हर्षित हो रहा है और अनुराग(-प्रेम-) को प्राप्त हो रहा है। आपके नाम, गुण आदिके कीर्तनसे भयभीत होकर राक्षसलोग दसों दिशाओंमें भागते हुए जा रहे हैं और सम्पूर्ण सिद्धगण आपको नमस्कार कर रहे हैं। यह सब होना उचित ही है।
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, Rightly it is, O Krsna, that Your praise should move the world to joy and love. The rakshasas flee in fear on all sides, and all the hosts of siddhas bow down to You.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्

गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे।

अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास

त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्।।11.37।।
transliteration:
kasmāch cha te na nameran mahātman
garīyase brahmaṇo ’py ādi-kartre
ananta deveśha jagan-nivāsa
tvam akṣharaṁ sad-asat tat paraṁ yat
hindiMeaning: ।।11.37।। हे महात्मन् ! गुरुओंके भी गुरु और ब्रह्माके भी आदिकर्ता आपके लिये (वे सिद्धगण) नमस्कार क्यों नहीं करें? क्योंकि हे अनन्त ! हे देवेश ! हे जगन्निवास ! आप अक्षरस्वरूप हैं; आप सत् भी हैं, असत् भी हैं, और सत्-असत् से पर भी जो कुछ है, वह भी आप ही हैं।
englishMeaning:
(a) And why should they not, O Mahatma, bow down to You who are great, being the first Creator, even of Brahma?
(b) O Infinite, Lord of gods, O You who have the universe as Your abode! You are the imperishable individual self, the existent and the non-existent, and that which is beyond both.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराण

स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्।

वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम

त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप।।11.38।।
transliteration:
tvam ādi-devaḥ puruṣhaḥ purāṇas
tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam
vettāsi vedyaṁ cha paraṁ cha dhāma
tvayā tataṁ viśhvam ananta-rūpa
hindiMeaning: ।।11.38।। आप ही आदिदेव और पुराणपुरुष हैं तथा आप ही इस संसारके परम आश्रय हैं। आप ही सबको जाननेवाले, जाननेयोग्य और परमधाम हैं। हे अनन्तरूप ! आपसे ही सम्पूर्ण संसार व्याप्त है।
englishMeaning:
(a) You are the Primal God and the Ancient One. You are the Supreme resting place of the universe...
(b)...You are the Knower and the object of knowledge, and the Supreme Abode. Through You, O infinite of form, is this universe pervaded.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः

प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च।

नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः

पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते।।11.39।।
transliteration:
vāyur yamo ’gnir varuṇaḥ śhaśhāṅkaḥ
prajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaśh cha
namo namas te ’stu sahasra-kṛitvaḥ
punaśh cha bhūyo ’pi namo namas te
hindiMeaning: ।।11.39।। आप ही वायु, यमराज, अग्नि, वरुण, चन्द्रमा, दक्ष आदि प्रजापति और प्रपितामह (ब्रह्माजीके भी पिता) हैं। आपको हजारों बार नमस्कार हो! नमस्कार हो ! ! और फिर भी आपको बार-बार नमस्कार हो ! नमस्कार हो !
englishMeaning:
(a) You are Yayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, Sashanka, Prajapati, and the great-grandsire.
(b) Hail to You a thousand times! Hail to You again and yet again!
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on awe before the cosmic form and surrender of ego. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit:
नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते

नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व।

अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं

सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः।।11.40।।
transliteration:
namaḥ purastād atha pṛiṣhṭhatas te
namo ’stu te sarvata eva sarva
ananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁ
sarvaṁ samāpnoṣhi tato ’si sarvaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।11.40।। हे सर्व ! आपको आगेसे भी नमस्कार हो !  पीछेसे भी नमस्कार हो ! सब ओरसे ही नमस्कार हो ! हे अनन्तवीर्य ! अमित विक्रमवाले आपने सबको समावृत कर रखा है; अतः सब कुछ आप ही हैं।

sanskrit:

transliteration:
tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁ

hindiMeaning: ।।11.44।। इसलिये शरीरसे लम्बा पड़कर स्तुति करनेयोग्य आप ईश्वरको मैं प्रणाम करके प्रसन्न करना चाहता हूँ। जैसे पिता पुत्रके, मित्र मित्रके और पति पत्नीके अपमानको सह लेता है, ऐसे ही हे देव ! आप मेरे द्वारा किया गया अपमान सहनेमें समर्थ हैं।

sanskrit:

hindiMeaning: ।।11.45।। मैंने ऐसा रुप पहले कभी नहीं देखा। इस रूपको देखकर मैं हर्षित हो रहा हूँ और (साथ-ही-साथ) भयसे मेरा मन अत्यन्त व्यथित हो रहा है। अतः आप मुझे अपने उसी देवरूपको (सौम्य विष्णुरूपको)  दिखाइये। हे देवेश ! हे जगन्निवास ! आप प्रसन्न होइये।
englishMeaning: Seeing something never seen before, I am delighted. But my mind is also filled with awe. Show me, O Lord! Your other form. O Lord of the gods! Be gracious, O Abode of the universe!

hindiMeaning: ।।11.46।।  मैं आपको वैसे ही किरीटधारी, गदाधारी और हाथमें चक्र लिये हुए देखना चाहता हूँ। इसलिये हे सहस्रबाहो ! हे विश्वमूर्ते ! आप उसी चतुर्भुजरूपसे हो जाइये।

sanskrit:
श्री भगवानुवाच

hindiMeaning: ।।11.50।। सञ्जय बोले -- वासुदेवभगवान् ने अर्जुनसे ऐसा कहकर फिर उसी प्रकारसे अपना रूप (देवरूप) दिखाया और महात्मा श्रीकृष्णने पुनः सौम्यवपु (द्विभुजरूप) होकर इस भयभीत अर्जुनको आश्वासन दिया।

शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा।।11.53।।
transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।11.53।। जिस प्रकार तुमने मुझे देखा है, इस प्रकारका (चतुर्भुजरूपवाला) मैं न तो वेदोंसे, न तपसे, न दानसे और न यज्ञसे ही देखा जा सकता हूँ।

ज्ञातुं दृष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परंतप।।11.54।।
transliteration:
bhaktyā tv ananyayā śhakya aham evaṁ-vidho ’rjuna

hindiMeaning: ।।13.4।।वह क्षेत्र जो है, जैसा है, जिन विकारोंवाला है और जिससे जो पैदा हुआ है; तथा वह क्षेत्रज्ञ भी जो है और जिस प्रभाववाला है, वह सब संक्षेपमें मेरेसे सुन।

sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्।ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्िचतैः।।13.5।।

transliteration:

sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्।सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति।।13.14।।
transliteration:
sarvataḥ pāṇi-pādaṁ tat sarvato ’kṣhi-śhiro-mukham
sarvataḥ śhrutimal loke sarvam āvṛitya tiṣhṭhati
hindiMeaning: ।।13.14।।वे (परमात्मा) सब जगह हाथों और पैरोंवाले, सब जगह नेत्रों, सिरों और मुखोंवाले तथा सब जगह कानोंवाले हैं। वे संसारमें सबको व्याप्त करके स्थित हैं।
englishMeaning: Its hands and feet are everywhere; Its eyes, heads, and mouths are everywhere; Its ears are on all sides; and It exists, encompassing all things.

sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम्।असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च।।13.15।।
transliteration:
sarvendriya-guṇābhāsaṁ sarvendriya-vivarjitam
asaktaṁ sarva-bhṛich chaiva nirguṇaṁ guṇa-bhoktṛi cha
hindiMeaning: ।।13.15।।वे (परमात्मा) सम्पूर्ण इन्द्रियोंसे रहित हैं और सम्पूर्ण इन्द्रियोंके विषयोंको प्रकाशित करनेवाले हैं; आसक्तिरहित हैं और सम्पूर्ण संसारका भरण-पोषण करनेवाले हैं; तथा गुणोंसे रहित हैं और सम्पूर्ण गुणोंके भोक्ता हैं।
englishMeaning: Shining by the functions of the senses, yet devoid of the senses, detached yet supporting all, devoid of the Gunas yet experiencing the Gunas;
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च।सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्।।13.16।।
transliteration:
bahir antaśh cha bhūtānām acharaṁ charam eva cha
sūkṣhmatvāt tad avijñeyaṁ dūra-sthaṁ chāntike cha tat
hindiMeaning: ।।13.16।।वे परमात्मा सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके बाहर-भीतर परिपूर्ण हैं और चर-अचर प्राणियोंके रूपमें भी वे ही हैं एवं दूर-से-दूर तथा नजदीक-से-नजदीक भी वे ही हैं। वे अत्यन्त सूक्ष्म होनेसे जाननेका विषय नहीं हैं।
englishMeaning: It is within and without all beings; It is unmoving yet moving; It is so subtle that none can comprehend it; It is far away yet very near.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्।भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च।।13.17।।
transliteration:
avibhaktaṁ cha bhūteṣhu vibhaktam iva cha sthitam
bhūta-bhartṛi cha taj jñeyaṁ grasiṣhṇu prabhaviṣhṇu cha
hindiMeaning: ।।13.17।।वे परमात्मा स्वयं विभागरहित होते हुए भी सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें विभक्तकी तरह स्थित हैं। वे जाननेयोग्य परमात्मा ही सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंको उत्पन्न करनेवाले, उनका भरण-पोषण करनेवाले और संहार करनेवाले हैं।
englishMeaning: Undivided yet appearing as if divided among beings, this Self is to be known as the supporter of the elements. It devours them and causes their generation.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते।ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्।।13.18।।
transliteration:
jyotiṣhām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param uchyate
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ jñāna-gamyaṁ hṛidi sarvasya viṣhṭhitam
hindiMeaning: ।।13.18।।वह परमात्मा सम्पूर्ण ज्योतियोंका भी ज्योति और अज्ञानसे अत्यन्त परे कहा गया है। वह ज्ञानस्वरूप, जाननेयोग्य, ज्ञान(साधन-समुदाय) से प्राप्त करनेयोग्य और सबके हृदयमें विराजमान है।
englishMeaning: The light of all lights is said to be beyond Tamas (darkness); it is known to be knowledge, to be attained through knowledge, and to be present in the hearts of all.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः।मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते।।13.19।।
transliteration:
iti kṣhetraṁ tathā jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ choktaṁ samāsataḥ
mad-bhakta etad vijñāya mad-bhāvāyopapadyate
hindiMeaning: ।।13.19।।इस प्रकार क्षेत्र, ज्ञान और ज्ञेयको संक्षेपसे कहा गया। मेरा भक्त इसको तत्त्वसे जानकर मेरे भावको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Thus, the Ksetra, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been briefly set forth. On knowing this, My devotee becomes fit to attain My state.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि।विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसंभवान्।।13.20।।
transliteration:
prakṛitiṁ puruṣhaṁ chaiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api
vikārānśh cha guṇānśh chaiva viddhi prakṛiti-sambhavān
hindiMeaning: ।।13.20।।प्रकृति और पुरुष -- दोनोंको ही तुम अनादि समझो और विकारों तथा गुणोंको भी प्रकृतिसे ही उत्पन्न समझो। कार्य और करणके द्वारा होनेवाली क्रियाओंको उत्पन्न करनेमें प्रकृति हेतु कही जाती है और सुख-दुःखोंके भोक्तापनमें पुरुष हेतु कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: Know that both Prakṛti and the Self (Puruṣa) are without beginning; know that all modifications and the attributes are born from Prakṛti.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते।पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते।।13.21।।
transliteration:
kārya-kāraṇa-kartṛitve hetuḥ prakṛitir uchyate
puruṣhaḥ sukha-duḥkhānāṁ bhoktṛitve hetur uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।13.21।।प्रकृति और पुरुष -- दोनोंको ही तुम अनादि समझो और विकारों तथा गुणोंको भी प्रकृतिसे ही उत्पन्न समझो। कार्य और करणके द्वारा होनेवाली क्रियाओंको उत्पन्न करनेमें प्रकृति हेतु कही जाती है और सुखदुःखोंके भोक्तापनमें पुरुष हेतु कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: The Prakṛti is said to be the cause of agency to the body (Kārya) and sense-organs (Karaṇa); the Self is said to be the cause of experiencing pleasure and pain.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान्।कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु।।13.22।।
transliteration:
puruṣhaḥ prakṛiti-stho hi bhuṅkte prakṛiti-jān guṇān
kāraṇaṁ guṇa-saṅgo ’sya sad-asad-yoni-janmasu
hindiMeaning: ।।13.22।।प्रकृतिमें स्थित पुरुष ही प्रकृतिजन्य गुणोंका भोक्ता बनता है और गुणोंका सङ्ग ही उसके ऊँच-नीच योनियोंमें जन्म लेनेका कारण बनता है।
englishMeaning:
(a) Indeed, the self seated in Prakrti experiences the Gunas born of Prakrti.
(b) Its attachment to these Gunas is the cause of birth in good and evil wombs.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: उपद्रष्टाऽनुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः।परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः।।13.23।।
transliteration:
upadraṣhṭānumantā cha bhartā bhoktā maheśhvaraḥ
paramātmeti chāpy ukto dehe ’smin puruṣhaḥ paraḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।13.23।।यह पुरुष प्रकृति-(शरीर-) के साथ सम्बन्ध रखनेसे 'उपद्रष्टा', उसके साथ मिलकर सम्मति, अनुमति देनेसे 'अनुमन्ता', अपनेको उसका भरणपोषण करनेवाला माननेसे 'भर्ता', उसके सङ्गसे सुखदुःख भोगनेसे 'भोक्ता', और अपनेको उसका स्वामी माननेसे 'महेश्वर' बन जाता है। परन्तु स्वरूपसे यह पुरुष 'परमात्मा' कहा जाता है। यह देहमें रहता हुआ भी देहसे पर (सम्बन्ध-रहित) ही है।
englishMeaning: The self in the body is called the spectator, approver, supporter, experiencer, great lord, and supreme self.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैःसह।सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते।।13.24।।
transliteration:
ya evaṁ vetti puruṣhaṁ prakṛitiṁ cha guṇaiḥ saha
sarvathā vartamāno ’pi na sa bhūyo ’bhijāyate
hindiMeaning: ।।13.24।।इस प्रकार पुरुषको और गुणोंके सहित प्रकृतिको जो मनुष्य अलग-अलग जानता है, वह सब तरहका बर्ताव करता हुआ भी फिर जन्म नहीं लेता।
englishMeaning: He who understands the Self and Prakriti, along with the Gunas, will not be born again, no matter what state he may be in.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना।अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे।।13.25।।
transliteration:
dhyānenātmani paśhyanti kechid ātmānam ātmanā
anye sānkhyena yogena karma-yogena chāpare
hindiMeaning: ।।13.25।।कई मनुष्य ध्यानयोगके द्वारा, कई सांख्ययोगके द्वारा और कई कर्मयोगके द्वारा अपने-आपसे अपने-आपमें परमात्मतत्त्वका अनुभव करते हैं।
englishMeaning: Some perceive the Self within the self (body) through meditation of the mind, others through Sankhya Yoga, and still others through Karma Yoga.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वाऽन्येभ्य उपासते।तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः।।13.26।।
transliteration:
anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śhrutvānyebhya upāsate
te ’pi chātitaranty eva mṛityuṁ śhruti-parāyaṇāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।13.26।।दूसरे मनुष्य इस प्रकार (ध्यानयोग, सांख्ययोग, कर्मयोग, आदि साधनोंको) नहीं जानते, केवल (जीवन्मुक्त महापुरुषोंसे) सुनकर उपासना करते हैं, ऐसे वे सुननेके परायण मनुष्य भी मृत्युको तर जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: But some, who do not know this, having heard from others, worship accordingly—these too, devoted to what they hear, pass beyond death.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यावत्सञ्जायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम्।क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ।।13.27।।
transliteration:
yāvat sañjāyate kiñchit sattvaṁ sthāvara-jaṅgamam
kṣhetra-kṣhetrajña-sanyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣhabha
hindiMeaning: ।।13.27।।हे भरतवंशियोंमें श्रेष्ठ अर्जुन ! स्थावर और जंगम जितने भी प्राणी पैदा होते हैं, उनको तुम क्षेत्र और क्षेत्रज्ञके संयोगसे उत्पन्न हुए समझो।
englishMeaning: Whatever being is born, whether it be moving or stationary, know, O Arjuna, that it is through the combination of the Ksetra (body) and Ksetrajna (knower of the Field).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम्।विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति।।13.28।।
transliteration:
samaṁ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu tiṣhṭhantaṁ parameśhvaram
vinaśhyatsv avinaśhyantaṁ yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
hindiMeaning: ।।13.28।।जो नष्ट होते हुए सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें परमात्माको नाशरहित और समरूपसे स्थित देखता है, वही वास्तवमें सही देखता है।
englishMeaning: Who sees the supreme ruler dwelling alike in all bodies and never perishing, even when they perish, he indeed sees.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम्।न हिनस्त्यात्मनाऽऽत्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्।।13.29।।
transliteration:
samaṁ paśhyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśhvaram
na hinasty ātmanātmānaṁ tato yāti parāṁ gatim
hindiMeaning: ।।13.29।।क्योंकि सब जगह समरूपसे स्थित ईश्वरको समरूपसे देखनेवाला मनुष्य अपने-आपसे अपनी हिंसा नहीं करता, इसलिये वह परमगतिको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: For, seeing the ruler abiding alike in every place, he does not injure himself with his own mind and therefore reaches the highest goal.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः।यः पश्यति तथाऽऽत्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति।।13.30।।
transliteration:
prakṛityaiva cha karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśhaḥ
yaḥ paśhyati tathātmānam akartāraṁ sa paśhyati
hindiMeaning: ।।13.30।।जो सम्पूर्ण क्रियाओंको सब प्रकारसे प्रकृतिके द्वारा ही की जाती हुई देखता है और अपने-आपको अकर्ता देखता (अनुभव करता) है, वही यथार्थ देखता है।
englishMeaning: He who sees that all acts are done universally by Prakrti alone, and likewise that the self is not the doer, he indeed sees.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति।तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा।।13.31।।
transliteration:
yadā bhūta-pṛithag-bhāvam eka-stham anupaśhyati
tata eva cha vistāraṁ brahma sampadyate tadā
hindiMeaning: ।।13.31।।जिस कालमें साधक प्राणियोंके अलग-अलग भावोंको एक प्रकृतिमें ही स्थित देखता है और उस प्रकृतिसे ही उन सबका विस्तार देखता है, उस कालमें वह ब्रह्मको प्राप्त हो जाता है।

sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः।शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते।।13.32।।
transliteration:
anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ
śharīra-stho ’pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
hindiMeaning: ।।13.32।।हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! यह पुरुष स्वयं अनादि और गुणोंसे रहित होनेसे अविनाशी परमात्मस्वरूप ही है। यह शरीरमें रहता हुआ भी न करता है और न लिप्त होता है।
englishMeaning: This supreme Self, though dwelling in the body, is immutable, O Arjuna, being without beginning. It neither acts nor is tainted, as it is without Gunas.
