sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते।सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथाऽऽत्मा नोपलिप्यते।।13.33।।
transliteration:
yathā sarva-gataṁ saukṣhmyād ākāśhaṁ nopalipyate
sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate
hindiMeaning: ।।13.33।।जैसे सब जगह व्याप्त आकाश अत्यन्त सूक्ष्म होनेसे कहीं भी लिप्त नहीं होता, ऐसे ही सब जगह परिपूर्ण आत्मा किसी भी देहमें लिप्त नहीं होता।
englishMeaning: As the all-pervading ether is not tainted due to its subtlety, even so, the self abiding in the body is not tainted everywhere.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः।क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत।।13.34।।
transliteration:
yathā prakāśhayaty ekaḥ kṛitsnaṁ lokam imaṁ raviḥ
kṣhetraṁ kṣhetrī tathā kṛitsnaṁ prakāśhayati bhārata
hindiMeaning: ।।13.34।।हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन ! जैसे एक ही सूर्य सम्पूर्ण संसारको प्रकाशित करता है, ऐसे ही क्षेत्री (क्षेत्रज्ञ, आत्मा) सम्पूर्ण क्षेत्रको प्रकाशित करता है।
englishMeaning: As the one sun illuminates this entire world, so does the Knower of the Field (Ksetrin, the self), O Arjuna, illuminate the entire Field (the body).
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा।भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्।।13.35।।
transliteration:
kṣhetra-kṣhetrajñayor evam antaraṁ jñāna-chakṣhuṣhā
bhūta-prakṛiti-mokṣhaṁ cha ye vidur yānti te param
hindiMeaning: ।।13.35।।इस प्रकार जो ज्ञानरूपी नेत्रसे क्षेत्र और क्षेत्रज्ञके अन्तर-(विभाग-) को तथा कार्य-कारणसहित प्रकृतिसे स्वयंको अलग जानते हैं, वे परमात्माको प्राप्त हो जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Those who thus discern, with the eye of knowledge, the difference between the body or the Field (Ksetra) and the knower of the body or Field-knower (Ksetrajna), and the means of deliverance from the manifested Prakrti, they attain the Supreme.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on distinguishing body, mind, and witnessing consciousness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: श्री भगवानुवाचपरं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम्।यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः।।14.1।।
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
paraṁ bhūyaḥ pravakṣhyāmi jñānānāṁ jñānam uttamam
yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṁ siddhim ito gatāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।14.1।।श्रीभगवान् बोले -- सम्पूर्ण ज्ञानोंमें उत्तम और पर ज्ञानको मैं फिर कहूँगा, जिसको जानकर सब-के-सब मुनिलोग इस संसारसे मुक्त होकर परमसिद्धिको प्राप्त हो गये हैं।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "I shall declare again another kind of knowledge: It is the best of all forms of knowledge, by knowing which all the sages have attained the state of perfection beyond this world."

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः।सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च।।14.2।।
transliteration:
idaṁ jñānam upāśhritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
sarge ’pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti cha
hindiMeaning: ।।14.2।।इस ज्ञानका आश्रय लेकर जो मनुष्य मेरी सधर्मताको प्राप्त हो गये हैं, वे महासर्गमें भी पैदा नहीं होते और महाप्रलयमें भी व्यथित नहीं होते।
englishMeaning: Resorting to this knowledge, partaking in My Nature, they are not born at the time of creation nor do they suffer at the time of dissolution.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन् गर्भं दधाम्यहम्।संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत।।14.3।।
transliteration:
mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṁ dadhāmy aham
sambhavaḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ tato bhavati bhārata
hindiMeaning: ।।14.3।।हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन ! मेरी मूल प्रकृति तो उत्पत्ति-स्थान है और मैं उसमें जीवरूप गर्भका स्थापन करता हूँ। उससे सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंकी उत्पत्ति होती है।
englishMeaning: My womb is the great Brahman (i.e. Prakṛti). In it, I lay the germ. From that, O Arjuna, comes the birth of all beings.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः सम्भवन्ति याः।तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता।।14.4।।
transliteration:
sarva-yoniṣhu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ sambhavanti yāḥ
tāsāṁ brahma mahad yonir ahaṁ bīja-pradaḥ pitā
hindiMeaning: ।।14.4।।हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! सम्पूर्ण योनियोंमें प्राणियोंके जितने शरीर पैदा होते हैं, उन सबकी मूल प्रकृति तो माता है और मैं बीज-स्थापन करनेवाला पिता हूँ।
englishMeaning: Whatever forms are produced in any womb, O Arjuna, the Prakṛti is their great womb, and I am the sowing father.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसंभवाः।निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्।।14.5।।
transliteration:
sattvaṁ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛiti-sambhavāḥ
nibadhnanti mahā-bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।14.5।।हे महाबाहो ! प्रकृतिसे उत्पन्न होनेवाले सत्त्व, रज और तम -- ये तीनों गुण अविनाशी देहीको देहमें बाँध देते हैं।
englishMeaning: The Gunas of Sattva, Rajas, and Tamas arise from Prakrti and bind the immutable Self in the body, O Arjuna.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम्।सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ।।14.6।।
transliteration:
tatra sattvaṁ nirmalatvāt prakāśhakam anāmayam
sukha-saṅgena badhnāti jñāna-saṅgena chānagha
hindiMeaning: ।।14.6।।हे पापरहित अर्जुन ! उन गुणोंमें सत्त्वगुण निर्मल (स्वच्छ) होनेके कारण प्रकाशक और निर्विकार है। वह सुख और ज्ञानकी आसक्तिसे (देहीको) बाँधता है।
englishMeaning: Of these, sattva, being without impurity, is luminous and free from morbidity. It binds, O Arjuna, through attachment to pleasure and knowledge.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम्।तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्।।14.7।।
transliteration:
rajo rāgātmakaṁ viddhi tṛiṣhṇā-saṅga-samudbhavam
tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karma-saṅgena dehinam
hindiMeaning: ।।14.7।।हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! तृष्णा और आसक्तिको पैदा करनेवाले रजोगुणको तुम रागस्वरूप समझो। वह कर्मोंकी आसक्तिसे शरीरधारीको बाँधता है।
englishMeaning: Know, O Arjuna, that Rajas is of the nature of passion springing from thirst and attachment. It binds the embodied self with attachment to action.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम्।प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत।।14.8।।
transliteration:
tamas tv ajñāna-jaṁ viddhi mohanaṁ sarva-dehinām
pramādālasya-nidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata
hindiMeaning: ।।14.8।।हे भरतवंशी अर्जुन ! सम्पूर्ण देहधारियोंको मोहित करनेवाले तमोगुणको तुम अज्ञानसे उत्पन्न होनेवाला समझो। वह प्रमाद, आलस्य और निद्राके द्वारा देहधारियोंको बाँधता है।
englishMeaning: Know that Tamas is born of false knowledge and deludes all embodied beings. It binds, O Arjuna, with negligence, indolence, and sleep.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे सञ्जयति रजः कर्मणि भारत।ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे सञ्जयत्युत।।14.9।।
transliteration:
sattvaṁ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
jñānam āvṛitya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta
hindiMeaning: ।।14.9।।हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन ! सत्त्वगुण सुखमें और रजोगुण कर्ममें लगाकर मनुष्यपर विजय करता है तथा तमोगुण ज्ञानको ढककर एवं प्रमादमें भी लगाकर मनुष्यपर विजंय करता है।
englishMeaning: Sattva generates attachment to pleasure, Rajas to action, O Arjuna. But Tamas, obscuring knowledge, generates attachment to negligence.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत।रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा।।14.10।।
transliteration:
rajas tamaśh chābhibhūya sattvaṁ bhavati bhārata
rajaḥ sattvaṁ tamaśh chaiva tamaḥ sattvaṁ rajas tathā
hindiMeaning: ।।14.10।।हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन ! रजोगुण और तमोगुणको दबाकर सत्त्वगुण सत्त्वगुण, और तमोगुणको दबाकर रजोगुण, वैसे ही सत्त्वगुण और रजोगुणको दबाकर तमोगुण बढ़ता है।
englishMeaning: Prevailing over Rajas and Tamas, Sattva predominates, O Arjuna. Prevailing over Tamas and Sattva, Rajas predominates. Prevailing over Rajas and Sattva, Tamas predominates.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते।ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत।।14.11।।
transliteration:
sarva-dvāreṣhu dehe ’smin prakāśha upajāyate
jñānaṁ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛiddhaṁ sattvam ity uta
hindiMeaning: ।।14.11।।जब इस मनुष्यशरीरमें सब द्वारों-(इन्द्रियों और अन्तःकरण-) में प्रकाश (स्वच्छता) और ज्ञान (विवेक) प्रकट हो जाता है, तब जानना चाहिये कि सत्त्वगुण बढ़ा हुआ है।
englishMeaning: When knowledge, like light, illuminates from all gateways (i.e., the senses), then one should know that Sattva prevails.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा।रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ।।14.12।।
transliteration:
lobhaḥ pravṛittir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśhamaḥ spṛihā
rajasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe bharatarṣhabha
hindiMeaning: ।।14.12।।हे भरतवंशमें श्रेष्ठ अर्जुन ! रजोगुणके बढ़नेपर लोभ, प्रवृत्ति, कर्मोंका आरम्भ, अशान्ति और स्पृहा -- ये वृत्तियाँ पैदा होती हैं।
englishMeaning: Greed, activity, undertaking of work, restlessness, and longing—these arise, O Arjuna, when Rajas predominates.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च।तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन।।14.13।।
transliteration:
aprakāśho ’pravṛittiśh cha pramādo moha eva cha
tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛiddhe kuru-nandana
hindiMeaning: ।।14.13।।हे कुरुनन्दन ! तमोगुणके बढ़नेपर अप्रकाश, अप्रवृत्ति, प्रमाद और मोह -- ये वृत्तियाँ भी पैदा होती हैं।
englishMeaning: Non-illumination, inactivity, negligence, and even delusion—these arise, O Arjuna, when Tamas prevails.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on rising beyond the three gunas through awareness. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत्।तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते।।14.14।।
transliteration:
yadā sattve pravṛiddhe tu pralayaṁ yāti deha-bhṛit

sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम्।रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्।।14.16।।

sanskrit: सत्त्वात्सञ्जायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च।प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च।।14.17।।
transliteration:

englishMeaning: From Sattva arises knowledge, from Rajas arises greed, from Tamas arises negligence and delusion, and from it arises ignorance.

transliteration:
ūrdhvaṁ gachchhanti sattva-sthā madhye tiṣhṭhanti rājasāḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।14.18।।सत्त्वगुणमें स्थित मनुष्य ऊर्ध्वलोकोंमें जाते हैं, रजोगुणमें स्थित मनुष्य मृत्युलोकमें जन्म लेते हैं और निन्दनीय तमोगुणकी वृत्तिमें स्थित मनुष्य अधोगतिमें जाते हैं।
englishMeaning: Those who rest in Sattva ascend upwards; those who abide in Rajas stay in the middle; and those, abiding in the tendencies of Tamas descend downwards.

transliteration:
nānyaṁ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṁ yadā draṣhṭānupaśhyati

hindiMeaning: ।।14.19।।जब विवेकी (विचारकुशल) मनुष्य तीनों गुणोंके सिवाय अन्य किसीको कर्ता नहीं देखता और अपनेको गुणोंसे पर अनुभव करता है, तब वह मेरे स्वरूपको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: When the seer beholds no agent of action other than the Gunas, and knows what is beyond the Gunas, he attains to My state.

transliteration:
guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha-samudbhavān
janma-mṛityu-jarā-duḥkhair vimukto ’mṛitam aśhnute
hindiMeaning: ।।14.20।।देहधारी (विवेकी मनुष्य) देहको उत्पन्न करनेवाले इन तीनों गुणोंका अतिक्रमण करके जन्म, मृत्यु और वृद्धावस्थारूप दुःखोंसे रहित हुआ अमरताका अनुभव करता है।
englishMeaning: The embodied Self, crossing beyond these three Gunas that arise in the body, and being freed from birth, death, aging, and pain, attains immortality.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाचकैर्लिंगैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो।किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते।।14.21।।
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho

hindiMeaning: ।।14.21।।अर्जुन बोले -- हे प्रभो ! इन तीनों गुणोंसे अतीत हुआ मनुष्य किन लक्षणोंसे युक्त होता है? उसके आचरण कैसे होते हैं? और इन तीनों गुणोंका अतिक्रमण कैसे किया जा सकता है?
englishMeaning: Arjuna said, "What are the marks of a person who has transcended the three Gunas? What is their behavior? And how do they transcend the three Gunas?"

sanskrit: श्री भगवानुवाचप्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव।न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति।।14.22।।
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
prakāśhaṁ cha pravṛittiṁ cha moham eva cha pāṇḍava
na dveṣhṭi sampravṛittāni na nivṛittāni kāṅkṣhati
hindiMeaning: ।।14.22।।श्रीभगवान् बोले -- हे पाण्डव ! प्रकाश, प्रवृत्ति तथा मोह -- ये सभी अच्छी तरहसे प्रवृत्त हो जायँ तो भी गुणातीत मनुष्य इनसे द्वेष नहीं करता, और ये सभी निवृत्त हो जायँ तो इनकी इच्छा नहीं करता।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "He does not hate illumination, nor activity, nor even delusion, O Arjuna, while these prevail, nor does He long for them when they cease."

sanskrit: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते।गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते।।14.23।।

hindiMeaning: ।।14.23।।जो उदासीनकी तरह स्थित है और जो गुणोंके द्वारा विचलित नहीं किया जा सकता तथा गुण ही (गुणोंमें) बरत रहे हैं -- इस भावसे जो अपने स्वरूपमें ही स्थित रहता है और स्वयं कोई भी चेष्टा नहीं करता।
englishMeaning: He who sits like one unconcerned, undisturbed by the Gunas; who knows, 'It is the Gunas that are in motion,' and so remains unshaken;

transliteration:
sama-duḥkha-sukhaḥ sva-sthaḥ sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।14.24।।जो धीर मनुष्य सुख-दुःखमें सम तथा अपने स्वरूपमें स्थित रहता है; जो मिट्टीके ढेले, पत्थर और सोनेमें सम रहता है जो प्रिय-अप्रियमें तथा अपनी निन्दा-स्तुतिमें सम रहता है; जो मान-अपमानमें तथा मित्र-शत्रुके पक्षमें सम रहता है जो सम्पूर्ण कर्मोंके आरम्भका त्यागी है, वह मनुष्य गुणातीत कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: He who is alike in pleasure and pain, who dwells in his Self, who looks upon a clod, a stone, and a piece of gold as of equal value, who remains the same towards things dear and hateful, and who is intelligent, who regards both blame and praise of himself as equal.

englishMeaning: He who is the same in honor and dishonor, and the same to friend and foe, and who has abandoned all enterprises—he is said to have risen above the Gunas.

sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्ितयोगेन सेवते।स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान् ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते।।14.26।।

hindiMeaning: ।।14.26।।जो मनुष्य अव्यभिचारी भक्तियोगके द्वारा मेरा सेवन करता है, वह इन गुणोंका अतिक्रमण करके ब्रह्मप्राप्तिका पात्र हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: And he who, with unwavering devotion through Yoga, serves Me, he, transcending the Gunas, becomes fit for the state of Brahman.

transliteration:

sanskrit: श्री भगवानुवाचऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम्।छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्।।15.1।।
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha

hindiMeaning: ।।15.1।। श्रीभगवान् बोले -- ऊपरकी ओर मूलवाले तथा नीचेकी ओर शाखावाले जिस संसाररूप अश्वत्थवृक्षको अव्यय कहते हैं और वेद जिसके पत्ते हैं, उस संसारवृक्षको जो जानता है, वह सम्पूर्ण वेदोंको जाननेवाला है।
englishMeaning: The Lord said, "They speak of an immutable Asvattha tree with its roots above and branches below; its leaves are the Vedas. He who knows it knows the Vedas."

sanskrit: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा     गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः।अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि     कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके।।15.2।।
transliteration:
adhaśh chordhvaṁ prasṛitās tasya śhākhā

karmānubandhīni manuṣhya-loke
hindiMeaning: ।।15.2।।उस संसारवृक्षकी गुणों-(सत्त्व, रज और तम-) के द्वारा बढ़ी हुई तथा विषयरूप कोंपलोंवाली शाखाएँ नीचे, मध्यमें और ऊपर सब जगह फैली हुई हैं। मनुष्यलोकमें कर्मोंके अनुसार बाँधनेवाले मूल भी नीचे और ऊपर (सभी लोकोंमें) व्याप्त हो रहे हैं।
englishMeaning:
(a) Its branches extend both above and below, nourished by the Gunas. Their shoots are sense objects.

sanskrit: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते    नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा।अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूल    मसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा।।15.3।।
transliteration:
na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyate
nānto na chādir na cha sampratiṣhṭhā

asaṅga-śhastreṇa dṛiḍhena chhittvā
hindiMeaning: ।।15.3।।इस संसारवृक्षका जैसा रूप देखनेमें आता है, वैसा यहाँ (विचार करनेपर) मिलता नहीं; क्योंकि इसका न तो आदि है, न अन्त है और न स्थिति ही है। इसलिये इस दृढ़ मूलोंवाले संसाररूप अश्वत्थवृक्षको दृढ़ असङ्गतारूप शस्त्रके द्वारा काटकर --

hindiMeaning: ।।15.4।।उसके बाद उस परमपद-(परमात्मा-) की खोज करनी चाहिये जिसको प्राप्त होनेपर मनुष्य फिर लौटकर संसारमें नहीं आते और जिससे अनादिकालसे चली आनेवाली यह सृष्टि विस्तारको प्राप्त हुई है, उस आदिपुरुष परमात्माके ही मैं शरण हूँ।
englishMeaning: Then, one should seek that goal, attaining which one never returns. One should seek refuge with that Primal Person from whom this ancient activity streamed forth.

sanskrit: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा    अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः।द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञै    र्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्।।15.5।।
transliteration:
nirmāna-mohā jita-saṅga-doṣhā
adhyātma-nityā vinivṛitta-kāmāḥ

gachchhanty amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṁ tat
hindiMeaning: ।।15.5।।जो मान और मोहसे रहित हो गये हैं, जिन्होंने आसक्तिसे होनेवाले दोषोंको जीत लिया है, जो नित्य-निरन्तर परमात्मामें ही लगे हुए हैं, जो (अपनी दृष्टिसे) सम्पूर्ण कामनाओंसे रहित हो गये हैं, जो सुख-दुःखरूप द्वन्द्वोंसे मुक्त हो गये हैं, ऐसे (ऊँची स्थितिवाले) मोहरहित साधक भक्त उस अविनाशी परमपद-(परमात्मा-) को प्राप्त होते हैं।
englishMeaning: Without the delusion of perverse notions concerning the self, victorious over the evil of attachment, ever devoted to the Self, turned away from desires and liberated from dualities such as pleasure and pain, the undeluded go to that imperishable state.

sanskrit: न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः।यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम।।15.6।।
transliteration:
na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śhaśhāṅko na pāvakaḥ
yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama
hindiMeaning: ।।15.6।।उस-(परमपद-) को न सूर्य, न चन्द्र और न अग्नि ही प्रकाशित कर सकती है; और जिसको प्राप्त होकर जीव लौटकर (संसारमें) नहीं आते, वही मेरा परमधाम है।
englishMeaning: That supreme light, upon reaching which they do not return any more, is Mine; neither the sun nor the moon nor the fire illuminates It.

sanskrit: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः।मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति।।15.7।।
transliteration:
mamaivānśho jīva-loke jīva-bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ
manaḥ-ṣhaṣhṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛiti-sthāni karṣhati
hindiMeaning: ।।15.7।।इस संसारमें जीव बना हुआ आत्मा मेरा ही सनातन अंश है; परन्तु वह प्रकृतिमें स्थित मन और पाँचों इन्द्रियोंको आकर्षित करता है (अपना मान लेता है)।
englishMeaning: An everlasting part of Myself, having become the bound self in the world of life, attracts the senses, of which the mind is the sixth, and which abide in Prakriti.

transliteration:
śharīraṁ yad avāpnoti yach chāpy utkrāmatīśhvaraḥ
gṛihītvaitāni sanyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśhayāt
hindiMeaning: ।।15.8।।जैसे वायु गन्धके स्थानसे गन्धको ग्रहण करके ले जाती है, ऐसे ही शरीरादिका स्वामी बना हुआ जीवात्मा भी जिस शरीरको छोड़ता है, वहाँसे मनसहित इन्द्रियोंको ग्रहण करके फिर जिस शरीरको प्राप्त होता है, उसमें चला जाता है।
englishMeaning: Whatever body its lord acquires and from whatever body it departs, it goes on its way, taking these senses as the wind carries scents from their places.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च।अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते।।15.9।।
transliteration:
śhrotraṁ chakṣhuḥ sparśhanaṁ cha rasanaṁ ghrāṇam eva cha
adhiṣhṭhāya manaśh chāyaṁ viṣhayān upasevate
hindiMeaning: ।।15.9।।यह जीवात्मा मनका आश्रय लेकर श्रोत्र, नेत्र, त्वचा, रसना और घ्राण -- इन पाँचों इन्द्रियोंके द्वारा विषयोंका सेवन करता है।
englishMeaning: Presiding over the ear, the eye, the sense of touch, the tongue, the nose, and the mind, It experiences these objects of the senses.

transliteration:
utkrāmantaṁ sthitaṁ vāpi bhuñjānaṁ vā guṇānvitam

hindiMeaning: ।।15.10।।शरीरको छोड़कर जाते हुए या दूसरे शरीरमें स्थित हुए अथवा विषयोंको भोगते हुए भी गुणोंसे युक्त जीवात्माके स्वरूपको मूढ़ मनुष्य नहीं जानते, ज्ञानरूपी नेत्रोंवाले ज्ञानी मनुष्य ही जानते हैं।
englishMeaning: The deluded do not perceive it conjoined with the Gunas when departing, staying, or experiencing. Those who have the eye of knowledge, however, see it.

sanskrit: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम्।यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः।।15.11।।
transliteration:
yatanto yoginaśh chainaṁ paśhyanty ātmany avasthitam
yatanto ‘py akṛitātmāno nainaṁ paśhyanty achetasaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।15.11।।यत्न करनेवाले योगीलोग अपने-आपमें स्थित इस परमात्मतत्त्वका अनुभव करते हैं। परन्तु जिन्होंने अपना अन्तःकरण शुद्ध नहीं किया है, ऐसे अविवेकी मनुष्य यत्न करनेपर भी इस तत्त्वका अनुभव नहीं करते।

sanskrit: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम्।यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम्।।15.12।।
transliteration:
yad āditya-gataṁ tejo jagad bhāsayate ’khilam
yach chandramasi yach chāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam
hindiMeaning: ।।15.12।।सूर्यमें आया हुआ जो तेज सम्पूर्ण जगत् को प्रकाशित करता है और जो तेज चन्द्रमामें है तथा जो तेज अग्निमें है, उस तेजको मेरा ही जान।

transliteration:
gām āviśhya cha bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasā
puṣhṇāmi chauṣhadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।15.13।।मैं ही पृथ्वीमें प्रविष्ट होकर अपनी शक्तिसे समस्त प्राणियोंको धारण करता हूँ; और मैं ही रसमय चन्द्रमाके रूपमें समस्त ओषधियों-(वनस्पतियों-) को पुष्ट करता हूँ।
englishMeaning: And, entering the earth, I uphold all beings with My strength. I nourish all herbs, becoming the juicy Soma.

hindiMeaning: ।।15.14।।प्राणियोंके शरीरमें रहनेवाला मैं प्राण-अपानसे युक्त वैश्वानर होकर चार प्रकारके अन्नको पचाता हूँ।

hindiMeaning: ।।15.15।।मैं सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके हृदयमें स्थित हूँ। मेरेसे ही स्मृति, ज्ञान और अपोहन (संशय आदि दोषोंका नाश) होता है। सम्पूर्ण वेदोंके द्वारा मैं ही जाननेयोग्य हूँ। वेदोंके तत्त्वका निर्णय करनेवाला और वेदोंको जाननेवाला भी मैं ही हूँ।
englishMeaning: And I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me come memory, knowledge, and their removal too. Indeed, I alone am to be known from all the Vedas. I bring about the fruition of the Vedic rituals; I alone am the knower of the Vedas.

transliteration:
dvāv imau puruṣhau loke kṣharaśh chākṣhara eva cha

hindiMeaning: ।।15.16।।इस संसारमें क्षर (नाशवान्) और अक्षर (अविनाशी) -- ये दो प्रकारके पुरुष हैं। सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके शरीर नाशवान् और कूटस्थ (जीवात्मा) अविनाशी कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: There are two kinds of persons spoken of in the sastra: the perishable (ksara) and the imperishable (aksara). All beings are perishable, while the imperishable is called the unchanging (kutastha).

transliteration:
uttamaḥ puruṣhas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛitaḥ

hindiMeaning: ।।15.17।।उत्तम पुरुष तो अन्य ही है, जो परमात्मा नामसे कहा गया है। वही अविनाशी ईश्वर तीनों लोकोंमें प्रविष्ट होकर सबका भरण-पोषण करता है।
englishMeaning: There is a Supreme Person other than these. He is referred to as the Supreme Self (Paramatma) in all the Vedas. He, as the Immutable One and the Lord, enters the threefold world and supports it.

hindiMeaning: ।।15.18।।मैं क्षरसे अतीत हूँ और अक्षरसे भी उत्तम हूँ, इसलिये लोकमें और वेदमें पुरुषोत्तम नामसे प्रसिद्ध हूँ।
englishMeaning: Because I transcend the perishable person and am also higher than the imperishable one, therefore I am referred to in the Smrti and the Veda as the Supreme Person (Purusotama).

sanskrit: यो मामेवमसम्मूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम्।स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत।।15.19।।

englishMeaning: He who, without delusion, thus knows Me as the Supreme Self, knows all, O Arjuna, and worships Me in every way.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाचये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयाऽन्विताः।तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः।।17.1।।

hindiMeaning: ।।17.1।। अर्जुन बोले -- हे कृष्ण ! जो मनुष्य शास्त्र-विधिका त्याग करके श्रद्धापूर्वक देवता आदिका पूजन करते हैं, उनकी निष्ठा फिर कौन-सी है? सात्त्विकी है अथवा राजसी-तामसी?

kaṭv-amla-lavaṇāty-uṣhṇa- tīkṣhṇa-rūkṣha-vidāhinaḥ
āhārā rājasasyeṣhṭā duḥkha-śhokāmaya-pradāḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।17.9।।अति कड़वे, अति खट्टे, अति नमकीन, अति गरम, अति तीखे, अति रूखे और अति दाहकारक आहार अर्थात् भोजनके पदार्थ राजस मनुष्यको प्रिय होते हैं, जो कि दुःख, शोक और रोगोंको देनेवाले हैं।
englishMeaning: Foods that are bitter, sour, very salty, excessively heating, highly pungent, dry, and burning are all dear to Rajasika men; they cause pain, sorrow, and disease.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्।उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्।।17.10।।
transliteration:
yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣhitaṁ cha yat
uchchhiṣhṭam api chāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.10।।जो भोजन अधपका, रसरहित, दुर्गन्धित, बासी और उच्छिष्ट है तथा जो महान् अपवित्र भी है, वह तामस मनुष्यको प्रिय होता है।
englishMeaning: That food which is stale, tasteless, putrid, decayed, rejected, unclean, is dear to those of a Tamasic nature.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते।यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः।।17.11।।
transliteration:
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yajño vidhi-driṣhṭo ya ijyate
yaṣhṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।17.11।।यज्ञ करना कर्तव्य है -- इस तरह मनको समाधान करके फलेच्छारहित मनुष्योंद्वारा जो शास्त्रविधिसे नियत यज्ञ किया जाता है, वह सात्त्विक है।
englishMeaning: The sacrifice (worship) marked by Sattva is what is offered by those who desire no fruit and have the conviction that it should be performed as prescribed in the scriptures.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत्।इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्।।17.12।।
transliteration:
abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api chaiva yat
ijyate bharata-śhreṣhṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.12।।परन्तु हे भरतश्रेष्ठ अर्जुन ! जो यज्ञ फलकी इच्छाको लेकर अथवा दम्भ-(दिखावटीपन-) के लिये भी किया जाता है, उसको तुम राजस समझो।
englishMeaning: But that sacrifice which is offered with the intention of gaining a reward and for the sake of show, know it, O Arjuna, to be Rajasic.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम्।श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते।।17.13।।
transliteration:
vidhi-hīnam asṛiṣhṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣhiṇam
śhraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ parichakṣhate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.13।।शास्त्रविधिसे हीन, अन्न-दानसे रहित, बिना मन्त्रोंके, बिना दक्षिणाके और बिना श्रद्धाके किये जानेवाले यज्ञको तामस यज्ञ कहते हैं।
englishMeaning: That sacrifice which is devoid of authority, which uses offerings not sanctioned by the Sastras, which is performed without recitation of hymns and devoid of gifts and faith - that, they say, is marked by Tamas.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम्।ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते।।17.14।।
transliteration:
deva-dwija-guru-prājña- pūjanaṁ śhaucham ārjavam
brahmacharyam ahinsā cha śhārīraṁ tapa uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.14।।देवता, ब्राह्मण, गुरुजन और जीवन्मुक्त महापुरुषका पूजन करना, शुद्धि रखना, सरलता, ब्रह्मचर्यका पालन करना और हिंसा न करना -- यह शरीरसम्बन्धी तप कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: Worshiping the gods, the twice-born, the preceptors, the enlightened ones, practicing purity, uprightness, continence, and non-injury—these are called austerity of the body.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्।स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते।।17.15।।
transliteration:
anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ cha yat
svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ chaiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.15।।उद्वेग न करनेवाला, सत्य, प्रिय, हितकारक भाषण तथा स्वाध्याय और अभ्यास करना -- यह वाणी-सम्बन्धी तप कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: Speech that causes no shock, is true, pleasant, and beneficial, and also the practice of reciting scriptures, is called the austerity of speech.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः।भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते।।17.16।।
transliteration:
manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
bhāva-sanśhuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.16।।मनकी प्रसन्नता, सौम्य भाव, मननशीलता, मनका निग्रह और भावोंकी शुद्धि -- इस तरह यह मन-सम्बन्धी तप कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: Serenity of mind, benevolence, silence, self-control, and purity of mind—these are known as austerity of the mind.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्ित्रविधं नरैः।अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते।।17.17।।
transliteration:
śhraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ parichakṣhate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.17।।परम श्रद्धासे युक्त फलेच्छारहित मनुष्योंके द्वारा तीन प्रकार-(शरीर, वाणी और मन-) का तप किया जाता है, उसको सात्त्विक कहते हैं।
englishMeaning: The threefold austerity, practiced with supreme faith by men who desire no fruit and are devoted—they call it austerity of Sattva.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत्।क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्।।17.18।।
transliteration:
satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena chaiva yat
kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ chalam adhruvam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.18।।जो तप सत्कार, मान और पूजाके लिये तथा दिखानेके भावसे किया जाता है, वह इस लोकमें अनिश्चित और नाशवान् फल देनेवाला तप राजस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: That austerity, practiced with ostentation for the sake of gaining respect, praise, and reverence, is here said to be Rajasa. It is unsteady and impermanent.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः।परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्।।17.19।।
transliteration:
mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
parasyotsādanārthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.19।।जो तप मूढ़तापूर्वक हठसे अपनेको पीड़ा देकर अथवा दूसरोंको कष्ट देनेके लिये किया जाता है, वह तप तामस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: That austerity which is practised from deluded notions by means of self-torture or to injure another is said to be Tamasika.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे।देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्।।17.20।।
transliteration:
dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate ‘nupakāriṇe
deśhe kāle cha pātre cha tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.20।।दान देना कर्तव्य है -- ऐसे भावसे जो दान देश, काल और पात्रके प्राप्त होनेपर अनुपकारीको दिया जाता है, वह दान सात्त्विक कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: Gifts given with the feeling that it is one's own duty to give, to one who makes no return, at the proper place and time to the deserving person—that is said to be sattvika.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः।दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्।।17.21।।
transliteration:
yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśhya vā punaḥ
dīyate cha parikliṣhṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.21।।किन्तु जो दान प्रत्युपकारके लिये अथवा फलप्राप्तिका उद्देश्य बनाकर फिर क्लेशपूर्वक दिया जाता है, वह दान राजस कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: But that which is given as a consideration for something received or in expectation of a future reward, or grudgingly, is called a Rajasika gift.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते।असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्।।17.22।।
transliteration:
adeśha-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaśh cha dīyate
asat-kṛitam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।17.22।।जो दान बिना सत्कारके तथा अवज्ञापूर्वक अयोग्य देश और कालमें कुपात्रको दिया जाता है, वह दान तामस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: That gift which is given at the wrong place, wrong time, to an unworthy recipient, without due respect and with contempt, is called the gift of a Tamasa nature.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः।ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा।।17.23।।
transliteration:
oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśho brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛitaḥ
brāhmaṇās tena vedāśh cha yajñāśh cha vihitāḥ purā
hindiMeaning: ।।17.23।। ऊँ, तत् और सत् -- इन तीनों नामोंसे जिस परमात्माका निर्देश किया गया है, उसी परमात्माने सृष्टिके आदिमें वेदों, ब्राह्मणों और यज्ञोंकी रचना की है।
englishMeaning: Om, Tat, Sat—thus, Brahman is denoted by this threefold expression. In the past, Brahmanas, the Vedas, and sacrifices were ordained in association with these.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः।प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम्।।17.24।।
transliteration:
tasmād oṁ ity udāhṛitya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām
hindiMeaning: ।।17.24।।इसलिये वैदिक सिद्धान्तोंको माननेवाले पुरुषोंकी शास्त्रविधिसे नियत यज्ञ, दान और तपरूप क्रियाएँ सदा 'ऊँ' इस परमात्माके नामका उच्चारण करके ही आरम्भ होती हैं।
englishMeaning: Therefore, the Veda-enjoined sacrificial acts, gifts, and austerities, expounded by the Vedas, or those belonging to the first three stations, are always begun after pronouncing Om at the beginning.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः।दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षि।।17.25।।
transliteration:
tad ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
dāna-kriyāśh cha vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।17.25।। 'तत्' नामसे कहे जानेवाले परमात्माके लिये ही सब कुछ है -- ऐसा मानकर मुक्ति चाहनेवाले मनुष्योंद्वारा फलकी इच्छासे रहित होकर अनेक प्रकारकी यज्ञ और तपरूप क्रियाएँ तथा दानरूप क्रियाएँ की जाती हैं।
englishMeaning: Acts of sacrifice, austerity, and various gifts are performed without aiming at a reward by those who seek release, after pronouncing Tat.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते।प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते।।17.26।।
transliteration:
sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve cha sad ity etat prayujyate
praśhaste karmaṇi tathā sach-chhabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
hindiMeaning: ।।17.26।।हे पार्थ ! परमात्माके 'सत्'--इस  नामका सत्तामात्रमें और श्रेष्ठ भावमें प्रयोग किया जाता है तथा प्रशंसनीय कर्मके साथ 'सत्' शब्द जोड़ा जाता है।
englishMeaning: This term "Sat" is used in the sense of existence and goodness. And so also, O Arjuna, the word "Sat" is applied to an auspicious action.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on purifying faith, speech, food, and intention. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते।कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते।।17.27।।
transliteration:
yajñe tapasi dāne cha sthitiḥ sad iti chochyate
karma chaiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate

sanskrit: ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना।करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः।।18.18।।
transliteration:
jñānaṁ jñeyaṁ parijñātā tri-vidhā karma-chodanā
karaṇaṁ karma karteti tri-vidhaḥ karma-saṅgrahaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।18.18।।ज्ञान, ज्ञेय और परिज्ञाता -- इन तीनोंसे कर्मप्रेरणा होती है तथा करण, कर्म और कर्ता -- इन तीनोंसे कर्मसंग्रह होता है।
englishMeaning: Knowledge, the object of knowledge, and the knower are the threefold incitements to action. The instrument, the act, and the agent are the threefold constituents of action.

In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः।प्रोच्यते गुणसंख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि।।18.19।।
transliteration:
jñānaṁ karma cha kartā cha tridhaiva guṇa-bhedataḥ
prochyate guṇa-saṅkhyāne yathāvach chhṛiṇu tāny api
hindiMeaning: ।।18.19।।गुणसंख्यान (गुणोंके सम्बन्धसे प्रत्येक पदार्थके भिन्न-भिन्न भेदोंकी गणना करनेवाले) शास्त्रमें गुणोंके भेदसे ज्ञान और कर्म तथा कर्ता तीन-तीन प्रकारसे ही कहे जाते हैं, उनको भी तुम यथार्थरूपसे सुनो।
englishMeaning: Knowledge, action, and agent are declared in the science of the Gunas to be of three kinds, according to the difference in the Gunas. Listen to them also as they are.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते।अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम्।।18.20।।
transliteration:
sarva-bhūteṣhu yenaikaṁ bhāvam avyayam īkṣhate
avibhaktaṁ vibhakteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi sāttvikam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.20।।जिस ज्ञानके द्वारा साधक सम्पूर्ण विभक्त प्राणियोंमें विभागरहित एक अविनाशी भाव-(सत्ता-) को देखता है, उस ज्ञानको तुम सात्त्विक समझो।
englishMeaning: Know that knowledge to be sattvika, by which one sees in all beings an immutable existence, undivided even in the divided.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान्।वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम्।।18.21।।
transliteration:
pṛithaktvena tu yaj jñānaṁ nānā-bhāvān pṛithag-vidhān
vetti sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu taj jñānaṁ viddhi rājasam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.21।।परन्तु जो ज्ञान अर्थात् जिस ज्ञानके द्वारा मनुष्य सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें अलग-अलग अनेक भावोंको अलग-अलग रूपसे जानता है, उस ज्ञानको तुम राजस समझो।
englishMeaning: But that knowledge which sees all beings, due to their individual nature, as distinct entities—know that knowledge to be Rajasic.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम्।अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्।।18.22।।
transliteration:
yat tu kṛitsna-vad ekasmin kārye saktam ahaitukam
atattvārtha-vad alpaṁ cha tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.22।।किंतु जो (ज्ञान) एक कार्यरूप शरीरमें ही सम्पूर्णके तरह आसक्त है तथा जो युक्तिरहित, वास्तविक ज्ञानसे रहित और तुच्छ है, वह तामस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: But that knowledge is declared to be Tamasika which clings to one single act as if it were the whole, which is not based on reason, and which is false and insignificant.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम्।अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते।।18.23।।
transliteration:
niyataṁ saṅga-rahitam arāga-dveṣhataḥ kṛitam
aphala-prepsunā karma yat tat sāttvikam uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।18.23।।जो कर्म शास्त्रविधिसे नियत किया हुआ और कर्तृत्वाभिमानसे रहित हो तथा फलेच्छारहित मनुष्यके द्वारा बिना राग-द्वेषके किया हुआ हो, वह सात्त्विक कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: That obligatory act is said to be Sattvika, which is done without attachment, without desire or aversion, and by one who seeks no fruit.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहङ्कारेण वा पुनः।क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम्।।18.24।।
transliteration:
yat tu kāmepsunā karma sāhankāreṇa vā punaḥ
kriyate bahulāyāsaṁ tad rājasam udāhṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.24।।परन्तु जो कर्म भोगोंको चाहनेवाले मनुष्यके द्वारा अहंकार अथवा परिश्रमपूर्वक किया जाता है, वह राजस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: But that act is said to be Rajasic, which is performed with great effort by one who seeks to gratify their desires and under the prompting of egoism.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनपेक्ष्य च पौरुषम्।मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते।।18.25।।
transliteration:
anubandhaṁ kṣhayaṁ hinsām anapekṣhya cha pauruṣham
mohād ārabhyate karma yat tat tāmasam uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।18.25।।जो कर्म परिणाम, हानि, हिंसा और सामर्थ्यको न देखकर मोहपूर्वक आरम्भ किया जाता है, वह तामस कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: That act is said to be Tamasika which is undertaken through delusion, without regard to consequences, loss, injury, and one's own capacity.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः।सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते।।18.26।।
transliteration:
mukta-saṅgo ‘nahaṁ-vādī dhṛity-utsāha-samanvitaḥ
siddhy-asiddhyor nirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।18.26।।जो कर्ता रागरहित, अनहंवादी, धैर्य और उत्साहयुक्त तथा सिद्धि और असिद्धिमें निर्विकार है, वह सात्त्विक कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: That agent is said to be Sattvika, who is free from attachment, who does not boast of himself, who is endowed with steadiness and zeal, and who is unaffected by success and failure.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः।हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः।।18.27।।
transliteration:
rāgī karma-phala-prepsur lubdho hinsātmako ‘śhuchiḥ
harṣha-śhokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।18.27।।जो कर्ता रागी, कर्मफलकी इच्छावाला, लोभी, हिंसाके स्वभाववाला, अशुद्ध और हर्षशोकसे युक्त है, वह राजस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: That doer is called Rajasika who is passionate, who seeks the fruits of his actions, who is greedy, harmful, and impure, and who is swayed by delight and grief.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. sanskrit: अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः।विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते।।18.28।।
transliteration:
ayuktaḥ prākṛitaḥ stabdhaḥ śhaṭho naiṣhkṛitiko ‘lasaḥ
viṣhādī dīrgha-sūtrī cha kartā tāmasa uchyate
hindiMeaning: ।।18.28।।जो कर्ता असावधान, अशिक्षित, ऐंठ-अकड़वाला, जिद्दी, उपकारीका अपकार करनेवाला, आलसी, विषादी और दीर्घसूत्री है, वह तामस कहा जाता है।
englishMeaning: That doer is said to be Tamasika who is unqualified, unrefined, obstinate, depraved, dishonest, indolent, despondent, and lethargic.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं श्रृणु।प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनञ्जय।।18.29।।
transliteration:
buddher bhedaṁ dhṛiteśh chaiva guṇatas tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu
prochyamānam aśheṣheṇa pṛithaktvena dhanañjaya
hindiMeaning: ।।18.29।।हे धनञ्जय ! अब तू गुणोंके अनुसार बुद्धि और धृतिके भी तीन प्रकारके भेद अलग-अलगरूपसे सुन, जो कि मेरे द्वारा पूर्णरूपसे कहे जा रहे हैं।
englishMeaning: Hear now, O Arjuna, the threefold division of Buddhi (reason) and Dhrti (fortitude) according to the Gunas, to be fully and severally set forth.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये।बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी।।18.30।।
transliteration:
pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha kāryākārye bhayābhaye
bandhaṁ mokṣhaṁ cha yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
hindiMeaning: ।।18.30।।हे पृथानन्दन ! जो बुद्धि प्रवृत्ति और निवृत्तिको, कर्तव्य और अकर्तव्यको, भय और अभयको तथा बन्धन और मोक्षको जानती है, वह बुद्धि सात्त्विकी है।
englishMeaning: That Buddhi, O Arjuna, which knows activity and renunciation, what should be done and what should not be done, fear and fearlessness, bondage and release—that Buddhi is Sattvika.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च।अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी।।18.31।।
transliteration:
yayā dharmam adharmaṁ cha kāryaṁ chākāryam eva cha
ayathāvat prajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
hindiMeaning: ।।18.31।।हे पार्थ ! मनुष्य जिसके द्वारा धर्म और अधर्मको, कर्तव्य और अकर्तव्यको भी ठीक तरहसे नहीं जानता, वह बुद्धि राजसी है।
englishMeaning: The Buddhi that gives an erroneous knowledge of Dharma and Adharma (its opposite) and also of what should be done and what should not be done, O Arjuna, is Rajasic.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसाऽऽवृता।सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी।।18.32।।
transliteration:
adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛitā
sarvārthān viparītānśh cha buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
hindiMeaning: ।।18.32।।हे पृथानन्दन ! तमोगुणसे घिरी हुई जो बुद्धि अधर्मको धर्म और सम्पूर्ण चीजोंको उलटा मान लेती है, वह तामसी है।
englishMeaning: That Buddhi, O Arjuna, which, enveloped in darkness, regards Adharma as Dharma and reverses every value, is Tamasika.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः।योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी।।18.33।।
transliteration:
dhṛityā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥ
yogenāvyabhichāriṇyā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
hindiMeaning: ।।18.33।।हे पार्थ ! समतासे युक्त जिस अव्यभिचारिणी धृतिके द्वारा मनुष्य मन, प्राण और इन्द्रियोंकी क्रियाओंको धारण करता है, वह धृति सात्त्विकी है।
englishMeaning: That fortitude, by which one maintains the unwavering activities of the mind and vital force, and these sense-organs, through yoga—that fortitude is of the nature of sattva.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान् धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन।प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी।।18.34।।
transliteration:
yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛityā dhārayate ‘rjuna
prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣhī dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
hindiMeaning: ।।18.34।।हे पृथानन्दन अर्जुन ! फलकी इच्छावाला मनुष्य जिस धृतिके द्वारा धर्म, काम (भोग) और अर्थको अत्यन्त आसक्तिपूर्वक धारण करता है, वह धृति राजसी है।
englishMeaning: That dhṛti, O Arjuna, by which one, who is desirous of fruits, longs for them with intense attachment and holds fast to duty, desire, and wealth—that dhṛti is rajasika.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च।न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी।।18.35।।
transliteration:
yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śhokaṁ viṣhādaṁ madam eva cha

sanskrit: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं श्रृणु मे भरतर्षभ।अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति।।18.36।।
transliteration:
sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu me bharatarṣhabha
abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ cha nigachchhati
 yat tad agre viṣham iva pariṇāme ‘mṛitopamam
tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.36।।हे भरतवंशियोंमें श्रेष्ठ अर्जुन ! अब तीन प्रकारके सुखको भी तुम मेरेसे सुनो। जिसमें अभ्याससे रमण होता है और जिससे दुःखोंका अन्त हो जाता है, ऐसा वह परमात्मविषयक बुद्धिकी प्रसन्नतासे पैदा होनेवाला जो सुख (सांसारिक आसक्तिके कारण) आरम्भमें विषकी तरह और परिणाममें अमृतकी तरह होता है, वह सुख सात्त्विक कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: Now hear from Me, O Arjuna, the threefold division of pleasure৷৷ that in which one rejoices through long practice and in which one comes to the end of pain.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम्।तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्।।18.37।।

sanskrit: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम्।परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्।।18.38।।

hindiMeaning: ।।18.38।।जो सुख इन्द्रियों और विषयोंके संयोगसे आरम्भमें अमृतकी तरह और परिणाममें विषकी तरह होता है, वह सुख राजस कहा गया है।

sanskrit: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः।निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्।।18.39।।
transliteration:
yad agre chānubandhe cha sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ
nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.39।।निद्रा, आलस्य और प्रमादसे उत्पन्न होनेवाला जो सुख आरम्भमें और परिणाममें अपनेको मोहित करनेवाला है, वह सुख तामस कहा गया है।
englishMeaning: That pleasure which, at the beginning and end, deludes the self, through sleep, sloth, and error, is declared to be tamasic.

sanskrit: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः।सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्ित्रभिर्गुणैः।।18.40।।
transliteration:
na tad asti pṛithivyāṁ vā divi deveṣhu vā punaḥ
sattvaṁ prakṛiti-jair muktaṁ yad ebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।18.40।।पृथ्वीमें या स्वर्गमें अथवा देवताओंमें तथा इनके सिवाय और कहीं भी वह ऐसी कोई वस्तु नहीं है, जो प्रकृतिसे उत्पन्न इन तीनों गुणोंसे रहित हो।
englishMeaning: There is no creature, on earth or among the gods in heaven, that is exempt from these three Gunas born of Prakrti.

sanskrit: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परंतप।कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः।।18.41।।
transliteration:
brāhmaṇa-kṣhatriya-viśhāṁ śhūdrāṇāṁ cha parantapa
karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।18.41।।हे परंतप ! ब्राह्मण, क्षत्रिय, वैश्य और शूद्रोंके कर्म स्वभावसे उत्पन्न हुए तीनों गुणोंके द्वारा विभक्त किये गये हैं।
englishMeaning: The duties of the Brahmanas, Ksatriyas, Vaisyas, and Sudras are clearly divided, O Arjuna, according to their Gunas, born of their nature.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. sanskrit: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च।ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्।।18.42।।
transliteration:
śhamo damas tapaḥ śhauchaṁ kṣhāntir ārjavam eva cha
jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.42।।मनका निग्रह करना इन्द्रियोंको वशमें करना; धर्मपालनके लिये कष्ट सहना; बाहर-भीतरसे शुद्ध रहना; दूसरोंके अपराधको क्षमा करना; शरीर, मन आदिमें सरलता रखना; वेद, शास्त्र आदिका ज्ञान होना; यज्ञविधिको अनुभवमें लाना; और परमात्मा, वेद आदिमें आस्तिक भाव रखना -- ये सब-के-सब ब्राह्मणके स्वाभाविक कर्म हैं।
englishMeaning: The control of the senses and mind, austerity, purity, forbearance, uprightness, knowledge, special knowledge, and faith—all these constitute the duty of a Brahmana, born of his inherent nature.

sanskrit: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम्।दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्।।18.43।।
transliteration:
śhauryaṁ tejo dhṛitir dākṣhyaṁ yuddhe chāpy apalāyanam
dānam īśhvara-bhāvaśh cha kṣhātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.43।।शूरवीरता, तेज, धैर्य, प्रजाके संचालन आदिकी विशेष चतुरता, युद्धमें कभी पीठ न दिखाना, दान करना और शासन करनेका भाव -- ये सबकेसब क्षत्रियके स्वाभाविक कर्म हैं।
englishMeaning: Valor, invincibility, steadiness, dexterity, and not fleeing in battle, generosity, and regality are the duties of a Kshatriya, born of his inherent nature.

kṛiṣhi-gau-rakṣhya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśhya-karma svabhāva-jam

hindiMeaning: ।।18.44।।खेती करना, गायोंकी रक्षा करना और शुद्ध व्यापार करना -- ये सब-के-सब वैश्यके स्वाभाविक कर्म हैं, तथा चारों वर्णोंकी सेवा करना शूद्रका भी स्वाभाविक कर्म है।
englishMeaning: Agriculture, cattle-breeding, and trade are the duties of the Vaisya, born of their nature. And the duty of a Sudra is one of service, born of their nature.

sanskrit: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः।स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु।।18.45।।

englishMeaning: Devoting oneself to one's duty, one attains perfection. Hear now how one devoted to their own duty attains perfection.

hindiMeaning: ।।18.46।।जिस परमात्मासे सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंकी उत्पत्ति होती है और जिससे यह सम्पूर्ण संसार व्याप्त है, उस परमात्माका अपने कर्मके द्वारा पूजन करके मनुष्य सिद्धिको प्राप्त हो जाता है।

hindiMeaning: ।।18.47।।अच्छी तरहसे अनुष्ठान किये हुए परधर्मसे गुणरहित अपना धर्म श्रेष्ठ है। कारण कि स्वभावसे नियत किये हुए स्वधर्मरूप कर्मको करता हुआ मनुष्य पापको प्राप्त नहीं होता।

sanskrit: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत्।सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः।।18.48।।

hindiMeaning: ।।18.48।।हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! दोषयुक्त होनेपर भी सहज कर्मका त्याग नहीं करना चाहिये; क्योंकि सम्पूर्ण कर्म धुएँसे अग्निकी तरह किसी-न-किसी दोषसे युक्त हैं।
englishMeaning: One should not relinquish one's work, O Arjuna, though it may be imperfect; for, all endeavors are enveloped by imperfections as fire is by smoke.

sanskrit: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे।समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा।।18.50।।
transliteration:

englishMeaning: Learn from me, O Arjuna, in brief how one who has attained perfection attains the Brahman—the supreme consummation of knowledge.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. sanskrit: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्याऽऽत्मानं नियम्य च।शब्दादीन् विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च।।18.51।।
transliteration:

hindiMeaning: ।।18.51।।जो विशुद्ध (सात्त्विकी) बुद्धिसे युक्त, वैराग्यके आश्रित, एकान्तका सेवन करनेवाला और नियमित भोजन करनेवाला साधक धैर्यपूर्वक इन्द्रियोंका नियमन करके, शरीर-वाणी-मनको वशमें करके, शब्दादि विषयोंका त्याग करके और राग-द्वेषको छोड़कर निरन्तर ध्यानयोगके परायण हो जाता है, वह अहंकार, बल, दर्प, काम, क्रोध और परिग्रहका त्याग करके एवं निर्मम तथा शान्त होकर ब्रह्मप्राप्तिका पात्र हो जाता है।

sanskrit: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः।ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः।।18.52।।
transliteration:
vivikta-sevī laghv-āśhī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ

englishMeaning: Resorting to solitude, eating sparingly, restraining speech, body, and mind, ever engaged in the yoga of meditation and taking refuge in dispassion;

sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम्।विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते।।18.53।।
transliteration:
ahankāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham

englishMeaning: Forsaking egoism, power, pride, desire, wrath, and possessions, with no feeling of 'mine' and tranquil, he becomes worthy of the state of Brahman.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति।समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्।।18.54।।
transliteration:
brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śhochati na kāṅkṣhati
samaḥ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām
hindiMeaning: ।।18.54।।वह ब्रह्मभूत-अवस्थाको प्राप्त प्रसन्न मनवाला साधक न तो किसीके लिये शोक करता है और न किसीकी इच्छा करता है। ऐसा सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंमें समभाववाला साधक मेरी पराभक्तिको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Having realized the state of Brahman, tranquil, he neither grieves nor craves. Regarding all beings alike, he attains supreme devotion to Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः।ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्।।18.55।।
transliteration:
bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaśh chāsmi tattvataḥ
tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśhate tad-anantaram
hindiMeaning: ।।18.55।।उस पराभक्तिसे मेरेको, मैं जितना हूँ और जो हूँ -- इसको तत्त्वसे जान लेता है तथा मेरेको तत्त्वसे जानकर फिर तत्काल मेरेमें प्रविष्ट हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Through devotion, he comes to know Me fully—who and what I am in reality, who I am and how I am. Knowing Me thus in truth, he forthwith enters into Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः।मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्।।18.56।।
transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśhrayaḥ
mat-prasādād avāpnoti śhāśhvataṁ padam avyayam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.56।।मेरा आश्रय लेनेवाला भक्त सदा सब कर्म करता हुआ भी मेरी कृपासे शाश्वत अविनाशी पदको प्राप्त हो जाता है।
englishMeaning: Taking refuge in Me and performing all works constantly, one, by My grace, attains the eternal and immutable abode.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः।बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव।।18.57।।
transliteration:
chetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥ
buddhi-yogam upāśhritya mach-chittaḥ satataṁ bhava
hindiMeaning: ।।18.57।।चित्तसे सम्पूर्ण कर्म मुझमें अर्पण करके, मेरे परायण होकर तथा समताका आश्रय लेकर निरन्तर मुझमें चित्तवाला हो जा।
englishMeaning: Surrender all your actions to Me with your mind, keep Me as your goal, and practice Buddhi-yoga, focusing your thoughts on Me always.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि।अथ चेत्त्वमहङ्कारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि।।18.58।।
transliteration:
mach-chittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣhyasi
atha chet tvam ahankārān na śhroṣhyasi vinaṅkṣhyasi
hindiMeaning: ।।18.58।।मेरेमें चित्तवाला होकर तू मेरी कृपासे सम्पूर्ण विघ्नोंको तर जायगा और यदि तू अहंकारके कारण मेरी बात नहीं सुनेगा तो तेरा पतन हो जायगा।
englishMeaning: Focusing your thoughts on Me, you shall, by My grace, cross over all difficulties. If, however, out of self-conceit, you do not heed Me, you will perish.

sanskrit: यदहङ्कारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे।मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति।।18.59।।
transliteration:
yad ahankāram āśhritya na yotsya iti manyase
mithyaiṣha vyavasāyas te prakṛitis tvāṁ niyokṣhyati
hindiMeaning: ।।18.59।।अहंकारका आश्रय लेकर तू जो ऐसा मान रहा है कि मैं युद्ध नहीं करूँगा, तेरा यह निश्चय मिथ्या (झूठा) है; क्योंकि तेरी क्षात्र-प्रकृति तेरेको युद्धमें लगा देगी।
englishMeaning: If, in your self-conceit, you think, 'I will not fight,' your resolve is futile. Nature will compel you.

sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा।कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्।।18.60।।
transliteration:
swbhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā
kartuṁ nechchhasi yan mohāt kariṣhyasy avaśho ’pi tat
hindiMeaning: ।।18.60।।हे कुन्तीनन्दन ! अपने स्वभावजन्य कर्मसे बँधा हुआ तू मोहके कारण जो नहीं करना चाहता, उसको तू (क्षात्र-प्रकृतिके) परवश होकर करेगा।
englishMeaning: O Arjuna, bound by your own duty born out of your own inner disposition, and having no control over your own will, you will be compelled to do that very thing which you now do not desire to do through delusion.

transliteration:
īśhvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛid-deśhe ‘rjuna tiṣhṭhati

hindiMeaning: ।।18.61।।हे अर्जुन ! ईश्वर सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंके हृदयमें रहता है और अपनी मायासे शरीररूपी यन्त्रपर आरूढ़ हुए सम्पूर्ण प्राणियोंको (उनके स्वभावके अनुसार) भ्रमण कराता रहता है।
englishMeaning: The Lord, O Arjuna, abides in the heart of every being, spinning them round and round, as if mounted on a wheel, by His power.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत।तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्।।18.62।।
transliteration:
tam eva śharaṇaṁ gachchha sarva-bhāvena bhārata
tat-prasādāt parāṁ śhāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śhāśhvatam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.62।।हे भरतवंशोद्भव अर्जुन ! तू सर्वभावसे उस ईश्वरकी ही शरणमें चला जा। उसकी कृपासे तू परमशान्ति-(संसारसे सर्वथा उपरति-) को और अविनाशी परमपदको प्राप्त हो जायगा।
englishMeaning: Seek refuge in Him alone, O Arjuna, with the entirety of your being. By His grace, you shall find supreme peace and an eternal abode.

sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया।विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु।।18.63।।
transliteration:
iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayā
vimṛiśhyaitad aśheṣheṇa yathechchhasi tathā kuru
hindiMeaning: ।।18.63।।यह गुह्यसे भी गुह्यतर (शरणागतिरूप) ज्ञान मैंने तुझे कह दिया। अब तू इसपर अच्छी तरहसे विचार करके जैसा चाहता है, वैसा कर।
englishMeaning: Thus, the knowledge, the mystery of mysteries, has been declared to you by Me. Reflecting on it fully, do as you will.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः श्रृणु मे परमं वचः।इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्।।18.64।।
transliteration:
sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ
iṣhṭo ‘si me dṛiḍham iti tato vakṣhyāmi te hitam
hindiMeaning: ।।18.64।।सबसे अत्यन्त गोपनीय वचन तू फिर मेरेसे सुन। तू मेरा अत्यन्त प्रिय है, इसलिये मैं तेरे हितकी बात कहूँगा।
englishMeaning: Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all; as I am exceedingly fond of you, I am telling you what is good for you.

Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु।मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे।।18.65।।
transliteration:
man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru
mām evaiṣhyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo ‘si me
hindiMeaning: ।।18.65।।तू मेरा भक्त हो जा, मेरेमें मनवाला हो जा, मेरा पूजन करनेवाला हो जा और मेरेको नमस्कार कर। ऐसा करनेसे तू मेरेको ही प्राप्त हो जायगा -- यह मैं तेरे सामने सत्य प्रतिज्ञा करता हूँ; क्योंकि तू मेरा अत्यन्त प्रिय है।
englishMeaning: Focus your mind on Me. Be My devotee. Worship Me. Prostrate before Me. You will come to Me alone. I promise you truly; for you are dear to Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

transliteration:
sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vraja
ahaṁ tvāṁ sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ
hindiMeaning: ।।18.66।।सम्पूर्ण धर्मोंका आश्रय छोड़कर तू केवल मेरी शरणमें आ जा। मैं तुझे सम्पूर्ण पापोंसे मुक्त कर दूँगा, चिन्ता मत कर।
englishMeaning: Relinquishing all Dharmas completely, seek Me alone for refuge. I will release you from all sins; grieve not.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender. Pause with it slowly, observe your present duty without anxiety, and let your actions become an offering rather than a burden. In that shift from ego to service, clarity deepens, the heart steadies, and spiritual progress becomes practical in daily life.

sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन।न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति।।18.67।।
transliteration:
idaṁ te nātapaskyāya nābhaktāya kadāchana

hindiMeaning: ।।18.67।।यह सर्वगुह्यतम वचन अतपस्वीको मत कहना; अभक्तको कभी मत कहना; जो सुनना नहीं चाहता, उसको मत कहना; और जो मेरेमें दोषदृष्टि करता है, उससे भी मत कहना।
englishMeaning: Never should this be told by you to one who is not austere, who is not a devotee, nor to one who has no desire to listen, nor certainly to him who speaks ill of Me.
reflection: This verse invites contemplation on integration of knowledge, action, devotion, and surrender.
